original: kṣudhā pipāsāya ca pīḍītastvaṃ nirāśakaśca tribhavādbhaviṣyasi /🔽bhojanānyupanāmitvā ṛṣiḥ sattva prasādayan
analyzed: kṣudhā pipāsāya ca nirāśakaḥ ca tri bhavāt bhaviṣyasi  bhojanāni upanāmitvā ṛṣiḥ sattva prasādayan
translated: You are afflicted by hunger and thirst, and you will be without hope in the three existences.🔽Having brought the food, the sage delighted the being,

original: mṛṣṭaṃ bhuṃja manāpaṃ ca śarīre tarpanārthikaṃ /
analyzed: mṛṣṭam bhuṃja manāpam ca śarīre tarpana arthikam
translated: saying, Eat the delicious and pleasing food to nourish your body,

original: paścāt te dharma bhāṣāmi sarvapāpakṣayaṃkaram
analyzed: paścāt te dharma bhāṣāmi sarva pāpa kṣayaṃkaram
translated: and afterwards I will teach you the Dharma that destroys all evil.

original: tasya tadbhojanaṃ mṛṣṭaṃ muhūrtaṃ bhuktavān asau /
analyzed: tasya tat bhojanam mṛṣṭam muhūrtam bhuktavān asau
translated: He ate the delicious food for a short while,

original: bhuktvā hastau ca prakṣālya kṛtvā pradakṣiṇaṃ ṛṣiṃ /
analyzed: bhuktvā hastau ca prakṣālya kṛtvā pradakṣiṇam ṛṣim
translated: and after eating, he washed his hands and circumambulated the sage.

original: paryaṃkena niṣīditvā vadat yat pāpakaṃ kṛtam
analyzed: paryaṃkena niṣīditvā vadat yat pāpakam kṛtam
translated: Sitting on a couch, he spoke of the evil he had done:

original: mātṛghātaṃ pitṛghātaṃ stūpabhedaṃ mayā kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: mātṛ ghātam pitṛ ghātam stūpa bhedam mayā kṛtam
translated: I have killed my mother and father, and destroyed a stupa,

original: bodhisattvasya buddhatve antarāyaṃ kṛtaṃ mayā /
analyzed: bodhisattvasya buddha tve antarāyam kṛtam mayā
translated: and created obstacles for the Bodhisattva's enlightenment.

original: tasya tadvacanaṃ śrutvā ṛṣirvākyamathābravīt🔽asādhustava bho puruṣa yat kṛtaṃ pāpakaṃ tvayā /
analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā ṛṣiḥ vākyam atha abravīt  asādhuḥ tava bho puruṣa yat kṛtam pāpakam tvayā
translated: Hearing these words, the sage then spoke:🔽It is not good, O man, that you have done evil.

original: deśehi pāpakaṃ karma kṛtaṃ kārāpitaṃ ca yat //
analyzed: deśehi pāpakam karma kṛtam kārāpitam ca yat
translated: Confess the evil deeds you have done and caused to be done.

original: atha khalu tasmin kāle sa puruṣaḥ śokaśalyasamarpita bhītastrasta udvigna ko me trātā bhaviṣyatītyāha ca //
analyzed: atha khalu tasmin kāle sa puruṣaḥ śoka śalya samarpita bhītaḥ trastaḥ udvigna kaḥ me trātā bhaviṣyati iti āha ca
translated: Then at that time, that man, pierced by the dart of sorrow, frightened, terrified, anxious, said, Who will be my protector?

original: kṛtaṃ me pāpakaṃ karma duḥkhāṃ vetsyāmi vedanāṃ /
analyzed: kṛtam me pāpakam karma duḥkhām vetsyāmi vedanām
translated: I have done evil deeds, I will experience painful feelings,

original: narake raurave ghore tathaiva ca pratāpane //
analyzed: narake raurave ghore tathā eva ca pratāpane
translated: In the terrible Raurava hell, and likewise in the burning hell.

original: atha khalu sa puruṣastasya ṛṣerjānudvayaṃ bhūmau nipātyāha ca /
analyzed: atha khalu sa puruṣaḥ tasya ṛṣeḥ jānu dvayam bhūmau nipātya āha ca
translated: Then indeed that man, having placed his two knees on the ground before that Rishi, said:

original: deśeyaṃ pāpakaṃ karma yatkṛtaṃ kāritaṃ mayā /
analyzed: deśeyam pāpakam karma yat kṛtam kāritam mayā
translated: I confess this evil deed that I have done or caused to be done.

original: māphalaṃ pāpakaṃ bhotu mā me syā duḥkhavedanāṃ /
analyzed: mā aphalam pāpakam bhotu mā me syāḥ duḥkha vedanām
translated: May it not bear evil fruit, may I not have painful feelings.

original: ṛṣistrāṇaṃ bhaven mahyamāsanne haṃ bhaven tava
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ trāṇam bhavet mahyam āsanne haṃ bhavet tava
translated: May the Rishi be my protector, may I be near to you.

original: niṣkaukṛtyasya śāntasya śamyantaṃ pāpakān mama /
analyzed: niṣkaukṛtyasya śāntasya śamyantam pāpakān mama
translated: For one free from remorse, for one at peace, may my evil deeds be pacified.

original: SaSū atha khalu sa riṣistena kālena tena samayena taṃ puruṣametadavocat evaṃ cāśvāsayati /
analyzed: atha khalu sa riṣiḥ tena kālena tena samayena tam puruṣam etat avocat evam ca āśvāsayati
translated: Then indeed that Rishi at that time and on that occasion said this to that man and thus comforted him:

original: mā bhaiḥ kulaputrāhaṃ te trāṇaṃ bhaviṣyāmyahan te gatirahaṃ parāyaṇaṃ bhaviṣyāmi /
analyzed: mā bhaiḥ kula putra aham te trāṇam bhaviṣyāmi ahan te gatiḥ aham parāyaṇam bhaviṣyāmi
translated: Do not be afraid, O son of good family, I will be your protector, I will be your refuge, I will be your final resort.

original: saṃmukhaṃ dharma śṛṇu śrutaṃ tvayā kiṃcit saṃghāṭaṃ nāma dharmaparyāyaṃ /
analyzed: saṃmukham dharma śṛṇu śrutam tvayā kiṃcid saṃghāṭam nāma dharmaparyāyam
translated: Listen to the Dharma face to face. Have you heard anything of the Dharma discourse called Saṃghāṭa?

original: sa āha /
analyzed: saḥ āha
translated: He said:

original: na me kadācicchrutaṃ /
analyzed: na me kadācid śrutam
translated: I have never heard that.

original: ṛṣirāha ko 'gnidagdhasya sattvasya dharman deśayatyanyatra yaḥ karuṇāvihāritayā sattvānāṃ dharman deśayati /
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ āha kaḥ agni dagdhasya sattvasya dharman deśayati anyatra yaḥ karuṇā vihāri tayā sattvānām dharman deśayati
translated: The sage said: Who teaches the Dharma to a being burned by fire, other than one who teaches the Dharma to beings out of dwelling in compassion?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: śṛṇu kulaputra
analyzed: śṛṇu kula putra
translated: Listen, son of noble family.

original: SaSū bhūtapūrvaṃ mayā
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam mayā
translated: In the past, by me

original: asaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpairasaṃkhyeyatarairyadāsītteno kālena tena samayena vimalacandro nāma rājābhūddhārmiko dharmarājā /
analyzed: asaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpaiḥ asaṃkhyeyataraiḥ yat āsīt tena u kālena tena samayena vimalacandraḥ nāma rājā abhūt dhārmikaḥ dharma rājā
translated: in incalculable, even more incalculable eons, at that time and at that occasion, there was a king named Vimalacandra, a righteous Dharma king.

original: tasya khalu punaḥ kulaputra rājño vimalacandrasya gṛhe putro jātaḥ
analyzed: tasya khalu punar kula putra rājñaḥ vimalacandrasya gṛhe putraḥ jātaḥ
translated: Moreover, son of noble family, in the palace of that king Vimalacandra, a son was born

original: SaSū atha sa rājā vimalacandro lakṣaṇanaimittikāṃcchāstrapāṭhakān brāhmaṇān
analyzed: atha sa rājā vimalacandraḥ lakṣaṇa naimittikān śāstra pāṭhakān brāhmaṇān
translated: Then that king Vimalacandra, having assembled the brahmins who were experts in the scriptures on signs and omens,

original: sannipātya kumāramupadarśyaivamāha kiṃ brāhmaṇa kumārasya nimittaṃ paśyatha śobhanamaśobhanaṃ veti /
analyzed: sannipātya kumāram upadarśya evam āha kim brāhmaṇa kumārasya nimittam paśyatha śobhanam aśobhanam vā iti
translated: having shown them the prince, said thus: O brahmins, what signs do you see in the prince, good or bad?

original: tatraiko naimittiko brāhmaṇaḥ kathayatyasādhurayaṃ mahārāja kumāro jātaḥ āsādhuriti /
analyzed: tatra ekaḥ naimittikaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ kathayati asādhuḥ ayam mahā rāja kumāraḥ jātaḥ āsādhuḥ iti
translated: There, one brahmin who was an expert in signs said: This prince, O great king, is born inauspicious, inauspicious.

original: rājā śrutvā sasaṃbhrama papraccha /
analyzed: rājā śrutvā sa saṃbhrama papraccha
translated: Having heard that, the king, alarmed, asked:🔽Why is it so?

original: kimidaṃ brāhmaṇā naimittikaḥ kathayatyayaṃ deva rājakumāro yadi sapta varṣāṇi jīvati sa eṣa mātāpitaraṃ jīvitādvyāvaropayiṣyati /
analyzed: kim idam brāhmaṇāḥ naimittikaḥ kathayati ayam deva rāja kumāraḥ yadi sapta varṣāṇi jīvati saḥ eṣa mātā pitaram jīvitāt vyāvaropayiṣyati
translated: The brahmin astrologer said, If this prince lives for seven years, he will kill his parents.

original: tato 'sa rājā evamāha /
analyzed: tatas sa rājā evam āha
translated: Then the king said this:

original: varaṃ me jīvitāntarāyo bhavatu māccāhaṃ putraṃ vadheyaṃ /
analyzed: varam me jīvita antarāyaḥ bhavatu māt ca aham putram vadheyam
translated: It is better for me to die than to kill my son.

original: tatkasmāt kadācit karhacilloke manuṣyotpādaṃ labhyate /
analyzed: tat kasmāt kadācid karhacit loke manuṣya utpādam labhyate
translated: Why is that? Sometimes, somewhere in the world, one obtains human birth.

original: nāhaṃ tathā kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: na aham tathā kariṣyāmi
translated: I will not do that.

original: yadimaṃ mānuṣyakaṃ kāyaṃ virāgayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: yat imam mānuṣyakam kāyam virāgayiṣyāmi
translated: If I become detached from this human body,

original: SaSū atha sa kumāro vardhate yadanya varṣadvayena vardhante tadāsāvekena māsena vardhate /
analyzed: atha sa kumāraḥ vardhate yat varṣa dvayena vardhante tadā asau ekena māsena vardhate
translated: Then that prince grew, and in one month he grew as much as others grow in two years.

original: jānāti ca sa rājā vimalacandro yaṃ kumāro mama karmopacayena vardhate /
analyzed: jānāti ca sa rājā vimalacandraḥ yam kumāraḥ mama karma upacayena vardhate
translated: And King Vimalacandra knew that the prince was growing through the accumulation of his own karma.

original: tato rājā tasya kumārasya paṭṭamābandhyaivamāha /
analyzed: tatas rājā tasya kumārasya paṭṭam ābandhya evam āha
translated: Then the king consecrated that prince and said this:

original: tava rājyaṃ bhavatu vipulaṃ ca kīrtirājyabhogaiśvaryaṃ ca kāraya dharmeṇa mā adharmeṇa /
analyzed: tava rājyam bhavatu vipulam ca kīrti rājya bhoga aiśvaryam ca kāraya dharmeṇa mā adharmeṇa
translated: Let your kingdom be vast, and rule with Dharma, not with non-Dharma, the glory, sovereignty, and wealth that come with fame.

original: tatastasya rājā paṭṭaṃ badhvā rājeti nāmadheyamakarot sa ca rājā vimalacandro na bhūyaḥ svaviṣaye rājyaṃ kārayaty
analyzed: tatas tasya rājā paṭṭam badhvā rājā iti nāmadheyam akarot sa ca rājā vimalacandraḥ na bhūyas sva viṣaye rājyam kārayati
translated: Then the king gave him a turban and named him King. And that King Vimalacandra no longer ruled the kingdom in his own domain.

original: SaSū atha te triṃśadamātyakoṭyo yena sa rājā vimalacandrastenopasaṃkrāntā upetya
analyzed: atha te triṃśat amātya koṭyaḥ yena sa rājā vimalacandraḥ tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ upetya
translated: Then those thirty koṭis of ministers approached that King Vimalacandra, and having approached

original: taṃ rājānaṃ vimalacandramevamāhuḥ kasmāt tvaṃ bhoḥ mahārāja svaviṣaye na bhūyo rājyaṃ kārayasi /
analyzed: tam rājānam vimala candram evam āhuḥ kasmāt tvam bhoḥ mahā rāja sva viṣaye na bhūyas rājyam kārayasi
translated: they said this to King Vimalacandra: Why is it, Your Majesty, that you no longer rule the kingdom in your own domain?

original: rājāha bahūnyasaṃkhyeyāni kalpāni /
analyzed: rājā āha bahūni asaṃkhyeyāni kalpāni
translated: The king said: For many innumerable kalpas,

original: yanmayā rājyabhogaiśvaryādhipatyaṃ kāritaṃ na ca me kadācid viṣayeṣu tṛptirāsīttena ca kālena tena samayena na cireṇa kālāntareṇa sa putrastaṃ
analyzed: yat mayā rājya bhoga aiśvarya ādhipatyam kāritam na ca me kadācid viṣayeṣu tṛptiḥ āsīt tena ca kālena tena samayena na cireṇa kāla antareṇa sa putraḥ tam
translated: I have enjoyed the sovereignty and lordship of a kingdom, but I have never been satisfied with the pleasures of the senses. And at that time, not long after, that son

original: mātāpitaraṃ jīvitādvyāvaropayati /
analyzed: mātā pitaram jīvitāt vyāvaropayati
translated: murdered his mother and father.

original: tena ca tatra paṃcānantaryāṇi karmānyupacitāni /
analyzed: tena ca tatra paṃca ānantaryāṇi karmāni upacitāni
translated: And he accumulated there the five acts of immediate retribution.

original: ahaṃ ca bhoḥ puruṣa tāvacciraṃ kālasamayamanusmarāmi /
analyzed: aham ca bhoḥ puruṣa tāvat ciram kāla samayam anusmarāmi
translated: And, sir, I remember that long time ago,

original: yathādya śvo vā /
analyzed: yathā adya śvas vā
translated: as if it were today or yesterday.

original: SaSū yadā tasya rājño duḥkhā vedanā utpannāḥ tadā sa rājā vipratisārībhūto srukaṇṭhaḥ paridevati pāpaṃ me karma kṛtamiti /
analyzed: yadā tasya rājñaḥ duḥkhāḥ vedanāḥ utpannāḥ tadā sa rājā vipratisārībhūtaḥ sru kaṇṭhaḥ paridevati pāpam me karma kṛtam iti
translated: When that king experienced painful feelings, then that king, being remorseful, with a choked throat, lamented, I have done evil deeds.

original: avīcau mahānarake duḥkhāṃ vedanāṃ pratyanubhaviṣyāmīti tato 'haṃ kāruṇyacittamutpādya
analyzed: avīcau mahā narake duḥkhām vedanām pratyanubhaviṣyāmi iti tatas ham kāruṇya cittam utpādya
translated: I will experience painful feelings in the great Avīci hell. Then I, giving rise to a mind of compassion,

original: tatra gatvā tasya rājño dharman deśayitavān atha sa rāja taṃ dharmaṃ śrutvā tasya
analyzed: tatra gatvā tasya rājñaḥ dharman deśayitavān atha sa rāja tam dharmam śrutvā tasya
translated: went there and taught the Dharma to that king. Then that king, having heard that Dharma,

original: tāni paṃcānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṣipraṃ niravaśeṣaṃ parikṣayaṃ gatāni /
analyzed: tāni paṃca ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṣipram niravaśeṣam parikṣayam gatāni
translated: quickly and completely exhausted those five heinous actions.

original: āha ca /
analyzed: āha ca
translated: And he said:

original: saṃghāṭaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ sūtrarājaṃ mahātapāḥ
analyzed: saṃghāṭam dharmaparyāyam sūtra rājam mahā tapāḥ
translated: The great ascetic, the king of sūtras, the Saṃghāṭa Dharma discourse,

original: ye śroṣyanti iman dharman padaṃ prāpsyantyanuttaram🔽sarvapāpakṣayaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: ye śroṣyanti iman dharman padam prāpsyanti anuttaram  sarva pāpa kṣayam bhavati
translated: those who will hear this Dharma will attain the unsurpassed stage.🔽All evil is destroyed.

original: sarvakleśāṃcchamiṣyati /
analyzed: sarva kleśān śamiṣyati
translated: All afflictions will be pacified.

original: śṛṇu dharmaṃ pravakṣyāmi yena kṣipraṃ vimokṣase /
analyzed: śṛṇu dharmam pravakṣyāmi yena kṣipram vimokṣase
translated: Listen, I will speak the Dharma by which you will quickly be liberated.

original: catuṣpadāyāṃ gāthāyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇaṃ nirantaraṃ
analyzed: catuṣpadāyām gāthāyām bhāṣyamāṇam nirantaram
translated: The four-line verse, being spoken continuously,

original: sarvapāpakṣayaṃ kṛtvā srotāpanno bhaviṣyasi /
analyzed: sarva pāpa kṣayam kṛtvā srotāpannaḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: having destroyed all evil, you will become a stream-enterer.

original: tato dānaṃ udānemi sarvapāpapramocanaṃ /
analyzed: tatas dānam udānemi sarva pāpa pramocanam
translated: Then I will recite the gift that liberates from all evil.

original: vimocitā duḥkhitā sattvā nārakādbhayabhairavāt
analyzed: vimocitā duḥkhitā sattvā nārakāt bhaya bhairavāt
translated: Liberated from the fear and terror of the hells, the suffering beings.

original: tataḥ sa puruṣotthāya āsanādañjalīkṛtaḥ
analyzed: tatas sa puruṣa utthāya āsanāt añjalīkṛtaḥ
translated: Then, the man rose from his seat with palms joined,

original: praṇamya śirasā tasya sādhukāraṃ prayacchati /
analyzed: praṇamya śirasā tasya sādhukāram prayacchati
translated: Bowed his head and offered praise, saying:

original: sādhu kalyāṇamitrāṇāṃ sādhu pāpavināśakaḥ
analyzed: sādhu kalyāṇa mitrāṇām sādhu pāpa vināśakaḥ
translated: Excellent are the spiritual friends, excellent is the destroyer of evil,

original: sādhu saṃghāṭanirdeśaṃ ye śroṣyanti mahānayaṃ //
analyzed: sādhu saṃghāṭa nirdeśam ye śroṣyanti mahān ayam
translated: Excellent is the teaching of the Saṃghāṭa, those who will hear this great teaching.

original: SaSū atha khalu tena kālena tena samayenoparyantarikṣe sthitāni dvādaśa devaputrasahasrāṇi
analyzed: atha khalu tena kālena tena samayena upari antarikṣe sthitāni dvādaśa devaputra sahasrāṇi
translated: Then at that time, twelve thousand gods dwelling in the sky

original: kṛtāṃjalipuṭāni tam ṛṣimupagamya pādau śirasā praṇamyaivamāhuḥ bhagavan kevacciraṃ
analyzed: kṛta aṃjali puṭāni tam ṛṣim upagamya pādau śirasā praṇamya evam āhuḥ bhagavan kevat ciram
translated: approached the sage with palms joined, bowed their heads at his feet and said: Blessed One, how long have you remembered

original: smarasi mahātapaḥ evaṃ catvāri koṭī nāgarājñāmāgatya aṣṭādaśa koṭīsahasrāṇi yakṣarājñāmāgatya
analyzed: smarasi mahā tapaḥ evam catvāri koṭī nāga rājñām āgatya aṣṭādaśa koṭī sahasrāṇi yakṣa rājñām āgatya
translated: the great austerities? In the same way, four koṭis of Nāga kings have come and eighteen thousand koṭis of Yakṣa kings have come,

original: yena sa ṛṣistenāṃjaliṃ praṇāmyaivamāhuḥ kevacciraṃ smarasi /
analyzed: yena saḥ ṛṣiḥ tena aṃjalim praṇāmya evam āhuḥ kevalam ciram smarasi
translated: having bowed with palms joined to the sage, said: How long have you remembered?

original: SaSū mahātmā ṛṣirāha /
analyzed: mahātmā ṛṣiḥ āha
translated: The great sage said:

original: śatamasaṃkhyeyakalpakoṭīniyutasahasrāṇi samanusmarāmi /
analyzed: śatam asaṃkhyeya kalpa koṭī niyuta sahasrāṇi samanusmarāmi
translated: I remember for a hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of asaṃkhyeyas of kalpas.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: kena kuśalakarmaṇā /
analyzed: kena kuśala karmaṇā
translated: By what wholesome karma?

original: muhūrtamātreṇaivaṃ pāpaṃ karma sarvapāpakarma
analyzed: muhūrta mātreṇa evam pāpam karma sarva pāpa karma
translated: In just a moment, such evil karma, all evil karma

original: praśāntam āha /
analyzed: praśāntam āha
translated: Prashanta said:

original: saṃghāṭaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā
analyzed: saṃghāṭam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā
translated: Having heard the Dharma discourse called Sanghata,

original: anena kuśalakarmaṇā sarvapāpakarma praśāntam
analyzed: anena kuśala karmaṇā sarva pāpa karma praśāntam
translated: through this wholesome action, all evil actions are pacified.

original: SaSū ye ca tatra sattvāḥ sannipatitāḥ yairimaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā śraddadhānatā vā kṛtā pattīyanaṃ vā /
analyzed: ye ca tatra sattvāḥ sannipatitāḥ yaiḥ imam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā śraddadhāna tā vā kṛtā pattīyanam vā
translated: And all the beings who have assembled there, having heard this Dharma discourse and developed faith or taken it up,

original: te sarve vyākriyante 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: te sarve vyākriyante nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: they are all predicted to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: yena ca puruṣeṇa tāṇi paṃcānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṛtāni /
analyzed: yena ca puruṣeṇa tāṇi paṃca ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṛtāni
translated: And by the person who has committed those five heinous actions,

original: tenemaṃ saṃghāṭaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā muhūrtamātreṇa tāni paṃcānantaryāṇi karmāṇi niravaśeṣaṃ parikṣayaṃ paryādānaṃ kṛtāṇi /
analyzed: tena imam saṃghāṭam dharmaparyāyam śrutvā muhūrta mātreṇa tāni paṃca ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi niravaśeṣam parikṣayam paryādānam kṛtāṇi
translated: having heard this Dharma discourse called Sanghata, in just a moment those five heinous actions are completely exhausted and eliminated without remainder.

original: tasyānekāni kalpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi sarvadurgatidvārāṇi pithitāni bhavanti /
analyzed: tasya anekāni kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi sarva durgati dvārāṇi pithitāni bhavanti
translated: For him, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of eons, all the doors to the lower realms are closed.

original: dvātriṃśaddevalokadvārāṇyapāvṛtāni bhavanti /
analyzed: dvātriṃśat deva loka dvārāṇi apāvṛtāni bhavanti
translated: The doors to the thirty-three deva worlds are opened.

original: ya itaḥ saṃghāṭāddharmaparyāyādantaśaścatuṣpadikāmapi gāthāṃ śroṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ itas saṃghāṭāt dharmaparyāyāt antaśas catuṣpadikām api gāthām śroṣyati
translated: Whoever hears even just four lines of a verse from this Dharma discourse called Sanghata,

original: tasyetādṛśāni kuśalamūlāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tasya itādṛśāni kuśala mūlāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: he will have such wholesome roots.

original: kaḥ punarvādo yaḥ saṃghāṭasūtraṃ satkariṣyati gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati pūjayiṣyati /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ yaḥ saṃghāṭa sūtram satkariṣyati gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati pūjayiṣyati
translated: How much more so for one who will honor, revere, respect, make offerings,

original: puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhirvādyāṃjalikarmapraṇāmaṃ vā kariṣyati /
analyzed: puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ vādya aṃjali karma praṇāmam vā kariṣyati
translated: and pay homage with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, flags, music, and prostrations,

original: ekāṃ vārāṃ anumodiṣyatyevaṃ ca vakṣyati /
analyzed: ekām anumodiṣyati evam ca vakṣyati
translated: or rejoice even once, saying,

original: sādhu subhāṣitamiti /
analyzed: sādhu subhāṣitam iti
translated: Well spoken!

original: SaSū atha khalu sarvaśūro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat kiyantaṃ bhagavannañjalipraṇāmāt puṇyaskandhaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: atha khalu sarvaśūraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kiyantam bhagavan añjali praṇāmāt puṇya skandham prasavati
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvaśūra said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, how much merit does one generate by paying homage with joined palms

original: ye te saṃghāṭaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ bhāṣyamāṇaṃ śrutvāñjaliṃ kṛtvā praṇamanti /
analyzed: ye te saṃghāṭam dharmaparyāyam bhāṣyamāṇam śrutvā añjalim kṛtvā praṇamanti
translated: to those who, upon hearing this Dharma discourse called The Great Heap being taught, pay homage with joined palms?

original: bhagavān āha śṛṇu kulaputra yena paṃcānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṛtāṇi kāritāni kriyamāṇāni🔽vānumoditāni bhaveyuḥ yadi sa itat saṃghāṭāddharmaparyāyādantaśaścatuṣpadikāmapi
analyzed: bhagavān āha śṛṇu kula putra yena paṃca ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṛtāṇi kāritāni kriyamāṇāni  vā anumoditāni bhaveyuḥ yadi saḥ itat saṃghāṭāt dharmaparyāyāt antaśas catuṣpadikām api
translated: The Blessed One said, Listen, noble sir. One who has committed or caused others to commit or rejoice in the five acts of immediate retribution,🔽if upon hearing even just four lines of this Dharma discourse called The Great Heap

original: gāthāṃ śrutvāñjaliṃ praṇāmayiṣyati /
analyzed: gāthām śrutvā añjalim praṇāmayiṣyati
translated: pays homage with joined palms,

original: tasya tāni sarvāṇi paṃcānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṣayaṃ gatāni bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tasya tāni sarvāṇi paṃca ānantaryāṇi karmāṇi kṣayam gatāni bhaviṣyanti
translated: All of those five heinous actions will be destroyed for them.

original: kaḥ punarvādaḥ sarvaśūra yaḥ sakalasamāptamevāyaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śroṣyatyayaṃ tato bahutaraṃ puṇyaskandhaṃ prasaviṣyati /
analyzed: kaḥ punar vādaḥ sarva śūra yaḥ sakala samāptam eva ayam dharmaparyāyam śroṣyati ayam tatas bahutaram puṇya skandham prasaviṣyati
translated: To say nothing of, All-Shining, the one who will hear this Dharma discourse in its entirety and complete form, they will produce a heap of merit that is much greater than that.

original: SaSū upamāṃ te kulaputra kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: upamām te kula putra kariṣyāmi
translated: Good man, I will give you a parable,

original: asya saṃghāṭasūtrārthasya vijñaptaye /
analyzed: asya saṃghāṭa sūtra arthasya vijñaptaye
translated: in order to make this meaning of the Saṃghata Sūtra known.

original: tadyathāpi nāma sarvaśūrānavataptasya nāgarājasya bhavane na kadācit sūryo vabhāsayati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma sarva śūra anavataptasya nāga rājasya bhavane na kadācid sūryaḥ vabhāsayati
translated: For example, All-Shining, the sun never shines in the palace of the nāga king Anavatapta.

original: tataśca paṃca mahānadyaḥ pravahanti /
analyzed: tatas ca paṃca mahā nadyaḥ pravahanti
translated: And from there, five great rivers flow.

original: atha kaścideva puruṣo bhaved yastāsāṃ paṃcānāṃ mahānadīnāmudakasya bindūni gaṇayet tatkiṃ manyase sarvaśūra śakyaṃ teṣāmudakavindunāṃ gaṇanāyogena
analyzed: atha kaścid eva puruṣaḥ bhavet yaḥ tāsām paṃcānām mahā nadīnām udakasya bindūni gaṇayet tat kim manyase sarva śūra śakyam teṣām udaka vindunām gaṇanā yogena
translated: Now if there were some person who would count the drops of water in those five great rivers, what do you think, All-Shining, is it possible to reach the end by counting those drops of water

original: paryantamadhigantum āha /
analyzed: paryantam adhigantum āha
translated: with the method of counting? He said:

original: no hīdaṃ bhagavan no hīdaṃ sugata /
analyzed: na u hi idam bhagavat na u hi idam sugata
translated: No, Blessed One, no, Sugata.🔽The Blessed One said: In the same way, All-Shining, it is not possible to reach the end of the wholesome roots

original: bhagavān āha evameva sarvaśūra na śakyaṃ saṃghāṭasūtrasya dharmaparyāyasya kuśalamūlaṃ
analyzed: bhagavān āha evam eva sarva śūra na śakyam saṃghāṭasūtrasya dharmaparyāyasya kuśala mūlam
translated: of the Saṃghata Sūtra, the Dharma discourse,

original: kalpena vā kalpaśatena vā kalpasahasreṇa vā kalpaśatasahasreṇa vā kalpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasreṇa
analyzed: kalpena vā kalpa śatena vā kalpa sahasreṇa vā kalpa śata sahasreṇa vā kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasreṇa
translated: whether by one eon, or one hundred eons, or one thousand eons, or one hundred thousand eons, or one hundred thousand quintillion eons,

original: vā gaṇanayā paryantamadhigantuṃ /
analyzed: vā gaṇanayā paryantam adhigantum
translated: it is not possible to reach the end by calculation.

original: SaSū tatkiṃ manyase sarvaśūra duṣkaraṃ tasya ya imaṃ saṃghāṭaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ muhūrtaṃ prakāśayeta /
analyzed: tat kim manyase sarva śūra duṣkaram tasya yaḥ imam saṃghāṭam dharmaparyāyam muhūrtam prakāśayeta
translated: What do you think, Sarvaśūra, is it difficult for someone to teach this Dharma discourse called The Great Collection for a short time?

original: āha duṣkaraṃ bhagavaṃ duṣkaraṃ sugata /
analyzed: āha duṣkaram bhagavan duṣkaram sugata
translated: He said, It is difficult, Blessed One, it is difficult, Sugata.

original: bhagavān āha ataḥ suduṣkarataraṃ sarvaśūra tasya ya imaṃ saṃghāṭaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śākṣyati śrotum
analyzed: bhagavān āha atas su duṣkarataram sarva śūra tasya yaḥ imam saṃghāṭam dharmaparyāyam śākṣyati śrotum
translated: The Blessed One said, Sarvaśūra, it is even more difficult for someone to be able to listen to this Dharma discourse called The Great Collection.

original: SaSū tadyathā anavataptāt mahāsarasaḥ
analyzed: sasū tat yathā anavataptāt mahā sarasaḥ
translated: Just as from the great lake Anavatapta,

original: paṃca mahānadyaḥ pravahanti /🔽tāsāṃ paṃcānāṃ mahānadīnāṃ pravahatāmudakavindūnna śakyaṃ kenacidgaṇakena vā gaṇakamahāmātrena
analyzed: paṃca mahā nadyaḥ pravahanti  tāsām paṃcānām mahā nadīnām pravahatām udaka vindūn na śakyam kenacid gaṇakena vā gaṇaka mahāmātrena
translated: five great rivers flow.

original: vā gaṇanayā paryantamadhigantumevamevāsya dharmaparyāyasya puṇyaskandhasya na śakyaṃ
analyzed: vā gaṇanayā paryantam adhigantum evam eva asya dharmaparyāyasya puṇya skandhasya na śakyam
translated: It is not possible for any mathematician or great mathematician to reach the end of the water drops of those five great rivers flowing by calculation, in the same way, it is not possible to reach the end of the accumulation of merit of this Dharma discourse.

original: paryantamadhigantum sarvaśūra āha katamāstā bhagavan paṃca mahānadya /
analyzed: paryantam adhigantum sarva śūraḥ āha katamāḥ tāḥ bhagavan paṃca mahānadya
translated: Sarvaśūra said, Blessed One, what are those five great rivers?

original: bhagavān āha tadyathā /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat yathā
translated: The Blessed One said, It is like this.

original: gaṃgā sītā vakṣuḥ yamunāścandrabhāgā ca /
analyzed: gaṃgā sītā vakṣuḥ yamunāḥ candrabhāgā ca
translated: The Ganges, the Sītā, the Vakṣu, the Yamunā, and the Candrabhāgā.

original: imā sarvaśūra paṃca mahānadyo mahāsamudre praviśanti /
analyzed: imāḥ sarva śūra paṃca mahā nadyaḥ mahā samudre praviśanti
translated: All of these, Sarvaśūra, are great rivers that flow into the great ocean.

original: ekaikā ca mahānadī paṃcamahānadīśataparivārāḥ //
analyzed: ekaikā ca mahā nadī paṃca mahā nadī śata parivārāḥ
translated: And each of these great rivers has five hundred great rivers as its retinue.

original: SaSū punaraparaṃ sarvaśūra paṃcemā mahānadyaḥ ākāśe pravahanti /
analyzed: punar aparam sarva śūra paṃca imāḥ mahā nadyaḥ ākāśe pravahanti
translated: Moreover, Sarvaśūra, there are these five great rivers that flow in the sky.

original: yā satatasamitamudakavindubhiḥ prajāṃ plāvayanti /
analyzed: yā satata samitam udaka vindubhiḥ prajām plāvayanti
translated: They constantly flood the people with drops of water.

original: tāśca paṃca mahānadyaḥ ekaikā sahasraparivārāḥ āha katamāstā bhagavan paṃca mahānadyaḥ sahasrāparivārāḥ yā ākāśe pravahanti /
analyzed: tāḥ ca paṃca mahā nadyaḥ ekaikā sahasra parivārāḥ āha katamāḥ tāḥ bhagavan paṃca mahā nadyaḥ sahasra a parivārāḥ yāḥ ākāśe pravahanti
translated: And each of these five great rivers has a retinue of one thousand. He asked, Blessed One, which are those five great rivers with a retinue of one thousand that flow in the sky?

original: bhagavān āha sundarī nāma nadī
analyzed: bhagavān āha sundarī nāma nadī
translated: The Blessed One said, The river named Sundarī

original: sahasraparivārā /
analyzed: sahasra parivārā
translated: has a retinue of one thousand.

original: śaṃkhā nāma nadī
analyzed: śaṃkhā nāma nadī
translated: The river named Śaṅkhalā

original: sahasraparivārā /
analyzed: sahasra parivārā
translated: has a retinue of one thousand.

original: vahantī nāma nadī
analyzed: vahantī nāma nadī
translated: The river named Vahantī

original: sahasraparivārā /
analyzed: sahasra parivārā
translated: has a retinue of one thousand.

original: citrasenā nāma nadī
analyzed: citrasenā nāma nadī
translated: The river named Citrasenā

original: sahasraparivārā /
analyzed: sahasra parivārā
translated: has a retinue of one thousand.

original: dharmavṛttā nāma nadī
analyzed: dharmavṛttā nāma nadī
translated: The river named Dharmavṛttā

original: sahasraparivārā /
analyzed: sahasra parivārā
translated: has a retinue of one thousand.

original: imāstā sarvaśūra paṃca mahanadyaḥ sahasraparivārā yā jaṃbūdvīpe autsukyamāpadyante /
analyzed: imāḥ tāḥ sarva śūra paṃca maha nadyaḥ sahasra parivārāḥ yāḥ jaṃbūdvīpe autsukyam āpadyante
translated: These, Sarvaśūra, are the five great rivers with a retinue of one thousand that are eager in Jambūdvīpa.

original: yāḥ kālena kālaṃ jaṃbūdvīpe bindubhirvarṣadhārāḥ pramuṃcanti /
analyzed: yāḥ kālena kālam jaṃbūdvīpe bindubhiḥ varṣa dhārāḥ pramuṃcanti
translated: Those who from time to time release drops of rain on Jambudvīpa,

original: tena puṣpaphalasasyānyabhiruhyanti /
analyzed: tena puṣpa phala sasyāni abhiruhyanti
translated: by which flowers, fruits, and crops grow.

original: yadā jaṃbūdvīpe vindūbhi🔽varṣadhārāḥ prapatanti /
analyzed: yadā jaṃbūdvīpe  varṣa dhārāḥ prapatanti
translated: When drops of rain fall on Jambudvīpa,

original: tadā udakaṃ jāyate /
analyzed: tadā udakam jāyate
translated: then water is born.

original: jātaṃ codakaṃ sarvakṣetrārāmāṇi saṃtarpayati sukhaṃ ca kārayati /
analyzed: jātam ca udakam sarva kṣetra ārāmāṇi saṃtarpayati sukham ca kārayati
translated: And the water that is born satisfies all the fields and gardens and causes happiness.

original: tadyathāpi nāma sarvaśūra prajāpati sarvajaṃbūdvīpe sukhaṃ kārayati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma sarva śūra prajāpati sarva jaṃbūdvīpe sukham kārayati
translated: Just as, Sarvaśūra, the Lord of Creatures causes happiness in all Jambudvīpa,

original: SaSū evaṃ eva sarvaśurāyaṃ saṃghāṭo dharmaparyāya bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya jaṃbūdvīpe prakāśitaḥ yathā ca sarvaśūra
analyzed: evam eva sarvaśura ayam saṃghāṭaḥ dharmaparyāya bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya jaṃbūdvīpe prakāśitaḥ yathā ca sarvaśūra
translated: in the same way, Sarvaśūra, this Dharma discourse called the Cloth of the Saṅgha is revealed in Jambudvīpa for the benefit and happiness of many people.

original: devānāṃ trāyastiṃśānāmāyuṣpramāṇaṃ na tathā manuṣyāṇāṃ /
analyzed: devānām trāyastiṃśānām āyuṣpramāṇam na tathā manuṣyāṇām
translated: And just as, Sarvaśūra, the lifespan of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three is not the same as that of humans,

original: tatra katame ca sarvaśūra trāyastriṃśā devāḥ yatra śakro devānāmindraḥ prativasati /
analyzed: tatra katame ca sarvaśūra trāyastriṃśāḥ devāḥ yatra śakraḥ devānām indraḥ prativasati
translated: Who, Sarvaśūra, are the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three where Śakra, Lord of the Gods, resides?

original: te trāyastriṃśā nāma devāḥ santi tadyathā
analyzed: te trāyastriṃśāḥ nāma devāḥ santi tat yathā
translated: Those are the gods called the Thirty-Three. It is like this,

original: sarvaśūra sattvāḥ ya ekaṃ vāksucaritaṃ bhāṣante /
analyzed: sarva śūra sattvāḥ ye ekam vāc su caritam bhāṣante
translated: Sarvaśūra, beings who speak one well-spoken word,

original: teṣāṃ na śakyaṃ puṇyaskandhasyopamāṃ kartuṃ /
analyzed: teṣām na śakyam puṇya skandhasya upamām kartum
translated: The heap of merit of those who do not have faith in this Dharma teaching cannot be measured.

original: yan te devamanuṣyeṣvanupamaṃ saukhyamanubhavanti /
analyzed: yat te deva manuṣyeṣu anupamam saukhyam anubhavanti
translated: They experience unsurpassed happiness among gods and humans.

original: SaSū santi sarvaśūra sattvāḥ ya ekaṃ vagduścaritaṃ bhāṣante na śakyaṃ teṣāṃ narakatiryakṣūpamāṃ kartum yat te sattvāḥ narakatiryakpretaduḥkhāṃ
analyzed: santi sarvaśūra sattvāḥ ye ekam vac duścaritam bhāṣante na śakyam teṣām naraka tiryakṣu upamām kartum yat te sattvāḥ naraka tiryak preta duḥkhām
translated: Sarvaśūra, there are beings who speak one evil word. The suffering of those beings falling into hell, animal realms, and the realm of hungry ghosts cannot be measured.

original: vedanāṃ vedayanti /
analyzed: vedanām vedayanti
translated: They experience the suffering of hell, animal realms, and hungry ghosts.

original: na ca kaścit teṣāṃ trātā bhavati tatra te nirāśāḥ paridevante narakeṣu prapatamānāḥ tad akalyāṇamitravaśena draṣṭavyaṃ /
analyzed: na ca kaścid teṣām trātā bhavati tatra te nirāśāḥ paridevante narakeṣu prapatamānāḥ tat akalyāṇa mitra vaśena draṣṭavyam
translated: No one can save them there. They lament in despair as they fall into the hells. That should be seen as the power of bad friends.

original: ye sattvā vāksucaritaṃ bhāṣante teṣāṃ na śakyaṃ puṇyaskandhasyopamāṃ kartuṃ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ vāc su caritam bhāṣante teṣām na śakyam puṇya skandhasya upamām kartum
translated: Those beings who speak well with their speech, the heap of merit of those cannot be measured.

original: tat kalyāṇamitravaśena draṣṭavyaṃ /
analyzed: tat kalyāṇa mitra vaśena draṣṭavyam
translated: That should be seen as the power of good friends.

original: SaSū yadā kalyāṇamitraṃ paśyati tadā tathāgato dṛṣṭo bhavati /
analyzed: yadā kalyāṇa mitram paśyati tadā tathāgataḥ dṛṣṭaḥ bhavati
translated: Sarvaśūra, when one sees a good friend, then the Tathāgata is seen.

original: yadā tathāgataṃ paśyati /🔽tadā tasya sarvapāpakṣayo bhavati /
analyzed: yadā tathāgatam paśyati  tadā tasya sarva pāpa kṣayaḥ bhavati
translated: When one sees the Tathāgata,🔽then all one's evil is destroyed.

original: yadā sarvapāpakṣayo bhavati /
analyzed: yadā sarva pāpa kṣayaḥ bhavati
translated: When all one's evil is destroyed,

original: tadā prajāpatirjaṃbūdvīpe autsukyaṃ karoti /
analyzed: tadā prajāpatiḥ jaṃbūdvīpe autsukyam karoti
translated: then the Lord of Creatures creates eagerness in Jambūdvīpa.

original: yadā prajāpatirjaṃbudvīpe autsukyaṃ karoti /
analyzed: yadā prajāpatiḥ jaṃbudvīpe autsukyam karoti
translated: When the Lord of Creatures shows eagerness in Jambudvīpa,

original: tadā jaṃbūdvīpakanāṃ sattvānāṃ sukhasya na śakyamupamāṃ kartumevamevāyaṃ sarvaśūra saṃghāṭo dharmaparyāya jaṃbūdvīpakānāṃ sattvānāṃ buddhakṛtyaṃ 🔽karoti /
analyzed: tadā jaṃbūdvīpakanām sattvānām sukhasya na śakyam upamām kartum evam eva ayam sarva śūra saṃghāṭaḥ dharmaparyāya jaṃbūdvīpakānām sattvānām buddha kṛtyam  karoti
translated: then the happiness of the beings in Jambudvīpa cannot be compared to. In the same way, Sarvaśūra, this Saṃghāṭa Dharma-discourse performs the Buddha's work for the beings in Jambudvīpa.

original: tadā na śakyaṃ teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ puṇyaskandhasyopamāṃ kartum
analyzed: tadā na śakyam teṣām sattvānām puṇya skandhasya upamām kartum
translated: Then the accumulation of merit of those beings cannot be compared to.

original: SaSū tadyathāpi nāma sarvaśūra yatremāḥ paṃca mahānadyaḥ saṃbhedaṃ samavasaraṇaṃ gacchanti /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma sarva śūra yatra imāḥ paṃca mahā nadyaḥ saṃbhedam samavasaraṇam gacchanti
translated: Just as, Sarvaśūra, wherever these five great rivers meet and converge,

original: tatra na śakyamudakasya pramāṇamudgrahītuṃ /
analyzed: tatra na śakyam udakasya pramāṇam udgrahītum
translated: there it is not possible to measure the water,

original: etāvadudakakuṃbhā vā udakakuṃbhaśatāni vā udakakuṃbhasahasrāṇi vā udakakuṃbhaśatasahasrāṇi vā /
analyzed: etāvat udaka kuṃbhāḥ vā udaka kuṃbha śatāni vā udaka kuṃbha sahasrāṇi vā udaka kuṃbha śata sahasrāṇi vā
translated: saying 'so much water in pots, or hundreds of water pots, or thousands of water pots, or hundreds of thousands of water pots.'

original: api tu bahutvādudakasya mahān udakaskandha iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: api tu bahu tvāt udakasya mahān udaka skandhaḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: But rather, because of the abundance of water, it is counted as a great mass of water.

original: SaSū evameva sarvaśūra yadā jaṃbūdvīpakā sattvā imaṃ saṃghātaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: evam eva sarva śūra yadā sattvāḥ imam saṃghātam dharmaparyāyam śroṣyanti
translated: In the same way, Sarvaśūra, when the beings in Jambudvīpa will hear this Saṃghāṭa Dharma-discourse,

original: śrutvā codgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti /
analyzed: śrutvā ca udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti
translated: and having heard it, will accept it, uphold it,

original: vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti /
analyzed: vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti
translated: They will recite it and master it.

original: pareṣāṃ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyanti pratipatyā ca saṃpādayiṣyanti /
analyzed: pareṣām ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyanti pratipatyā ca saṃpādayiṣyanti
translated: And they will extensively teach it to others and accomplish it through practice.

original: tadā na śakyaṃ teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ puṇyaskandhasya pramāṇaṃ udgrahītumapi tu bahutvāt puṇyasya mahān puṇyaskandha iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: tadā na śakyam teṣām sattvānām puṇya skandhasya pramāṇam udgrahītum api tu bahu tvāt puṇyasya mahān puṇya skandhaḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: At that time, it will not be possible to measure the heap of merit of those beings, but because of the abundance of merit, it will be counted as a great heap of merit.

original: SaSū ye sarvaśūra sattvāḥ saṃghāṭaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ na śroṣyanti na taiḥ śakyamanuttarāṃ
analyzed: ye sarva śūra sattvāḥ saṃghāṭam dharmaparyāyam na śroṣyanti na taiḥ śakyam anuttarām
translated: All-victorious, those beings who will not hear the Dharma discourse called the 'Great Collection' will not be able to fully awaken to unsurpassed

original: samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhum na śakyaṃ dharmacakraṃ pravartayitum na śakyaṃ dharmagaṇḍī
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhum na śakyam dharmacakram pravartayitum na śakyam dharmagaṇḍī
translated: perfect enlightenment, will not be able to turn the wheel of Dharma, will not be able to beat the Dharma drum,

original: parāhanitum na śakyaṃ tairdharmasiṃhāsanamabhiroḍhuṃ na śakyaṃ tai
analyzed: parāhanitum na śakyam taiḥ dharma siṃhāsanam abhiroḍhum na śakyam taiḥ
translated: will not be able to ascend the Dharma lion throne, will not be able to

original: nirvāṇadhātumanupraveṣṭuṃ /
analyzed: nirvāṇa dhātum anupraveṣṭum
translated: enter the realm of nirvana,

original: na śakyamaprameyai raśmibhiravabhāsayitum ya imaṃ sarvaśūra saṃghāṭaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ na śroṣyanti na śakyaṃ tairbodhimaṇḍe niṣattuṃ /
analyzed: na śakyam aprameyaiḥ raśmibhiḥ avabhāsayitum ye imam sarva śūra saṃghāṭam dharmaparyāyam na śroṣyanti na śakyam taiḥ bodhimaṇḍe niṣattum
translated: and will not be able to illuminate with immeasurable rays of light. All-victorious, those who will not hear this Dharma discourse called the 'Great Collection' will not be able to sit on the seat of enlightenment.

original: SaSū sarvaśūra āha pṛcchāmi bhagavaṃ pṛcchāmi sugata /
analyzed: sarva śūraḥ āha pṛcchāmi bhagavan pṛcchāmi sugata
translated: All-victorious said, 'I ask, Blessed One! I ask, Sugata!

original: kaṃcideva kautuhalam bhagavān āha pṛccha tvaṃ sarvaśūra yad yad evākāṃkṣasyahaṃ te niṣkāṃkṣaṃ kariṣyāmi sarvaśūra
analyzed: kaṃcid eva kautuhalam bhagavān āha pṛccha tvam sarva śūra yat yat eva ākāṃkṣasi aham te niṣkāṃkṣam kariṣyāmi sarva śūra
translated: Out of curiosity, the Blessed One said, Ask, Sarvaśūra, whatever you wish, and I will satisfy your desire.

original: āha katamaḥ sa bhagavan ṛṣirabhūd yena te sattvāḥ paṃcabhirānantaryaiḥ karmabhiḥ parimokṣitāḥ avaivarttikabhūmau ca pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ bhagavān
analyzed: āha katamaḥ sa bhagavan ṛṣiḥ abhūt yena te sattvāḥ paṃcabhiḥ ānantaryaiḥ karmabhiḥ parimokṣitāḥ a vaivarttika bhūmau ca pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ bhagavān
translated: Sarvaśūra said, Blessed One, which sage was it who liberated those beings from the five heinous actions and established them in the stage of non-retrogression? The Blessed One

original: āha
analyzed: āha
translated: said:

original: sūkṣmaṃ vacana buddhānāṃ sarvaśūra śṛṇohi me
analyzed: sūkṣmam buddhānām sarva śūra śṛṇohi me
translated: The words of the Buddhas are subtle. Sarvaśūra, listen to me.

original: saṃghāṭadarśanaṃ sūtraṃ ṛṣirūpeṇa darśitaṃ
analyzed: saṃghāṭa darśanam sūtram ṛṣi rūpeṇa darśitam
translated: The Saṃghāṭa Sūtra was shown in the form of a sage.

original: saṃghāṭo buddharūpaṃ ca darśayatyanukampayā /
analyzed: saṃghāṭaḥ buddha rūpam ca darśayati anukampayā
translated: The Saṃghāṭa, in the form of a Buddha, shows compassion.

original: yathā balikagaṃgāyā rūpaṃ darśayate tathā /
analyzed: yathā balikagaṃgāyāḥ rūpam darśayate tathā
translated: Just as Balīka shows the form of the Ganges,

original: buddho darśayate rūpaṃ dharman deśayate svayam
analyzed: buddhaḥ darśayate rūpam dharman deśayate svayam
translated: the Buddha shows the form and teaches the Dharma himself.

original: buddhaṃ ya icchate draṣṭuṃ lokanāthaṃ jinottamaṃ ////
analyzed: buddham yaḥ icchate draṣṭum lokanātham jinottamam
translated: One who wishes to see the Buddha, the Lord of the World, the Victorious Supreme One,

original: saṃghāṭastena śrotavyaḥ
analyzed: saṃghāṭaḥ tena śrotavyaḥ
translated: should listen to the Saṃghāṭa.

original: saṃghāṭaṃ buddhasādṛśaṃ /
analyzed: saṃghāṭam buddha sādṛśam
translated: The Saṃghāṭa is equal to the Buddha.

original: buddhas tatra bhaven nityaṃ saṃghāṭaṃ yatra tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: buddhaḥ tatra bhavet nityam saṃghāṭam yatra tiṣṭhati
translated: Where the Saṃghāṭa is, there the Buddha is always present.

original: SaSū bhagavān āha śṛṇu kulaputra /
analyzed: bhagavān āha śṛṇu kula putra
translated: The Blessed One said, Listen, son of noble family.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ sarvaśūrātīte dhvani navānavatyasaṃkhyeyaṅ kalpān anusmarāmi /
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam sarva śūra atīte dhvani kalpān anusmarāmi
translated: “Sarvaśūra, in the past, innumerable eons ago, I remember ninety-two eons.

original: tatra dvādaśa buddhakoṭya babhūvan ratnottamanāmānastathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ ahaṃ tena kālena tena samayena pradānaśūro bhūvaṃ
analyzed: tatra dvādaśa buddha koṭya babhūvan ratnottama nāmānaḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ aham tena kālena tena samayena pradāna śūraḥ bhūvam
translated: In that time, there were twelve koṭis of Buddhas, Tathāgatas, Arhats, Samyaksaṃbuddhas named Ratnottama. At that time, at that moment, I was a hero of giving,

original: candra nāma /
analyzed: candra nāma
translated: named Candra.

original: te ca me dvādaśa buddhakoṭya paryupāsitāḥ khādanīyabhojanīyamālyagandhavilepanena yathāsukhaṃ /
analyzed: te ca me dvādaśa buddha koṭya paryupāsitāḥ khādanīya bhojanīya mālya gandha vilepanena yathāsukham
translated: Those twelve koṭis of Buddhas were attended by me with food, drink, garlands, incense, and ointments, as they wished.

original: praṇītenāhāreṇa sarvasukhopadhānenopasthitāḥ upasthāpya ca tatraiva mayā sarvaśūra vyākaraṇamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdham
analyzed: praṇītena āhāreṇa sarva sukha upadhānena upasthitāḥ upasthāpya ca tatra eva mayā sarva śūra vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdham
translated: Having served them, I was prophesied by them all, Sarvaśūra, to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: SaSū abhijānāmyahaṃ sarvaśūrāṣṭādaśa buddhakoṭya sarve ratnāvabhāsanāmānastathāgatā loka utpannā abhūvan tatrāhamapi pradānaśūro bhūvan
analyzed: abhijānāmi aham sarva śūra aṣṭādaśa buddha koṭya sarve ratnāvabhāsa nāmānaḥ tathāgatāḥ loke utpannāḥ abhūvan tatra aham api pradāna śūraḥ bhūvan
translated: “Sarvaśūra, I know that eighteen koṭis of Buddhas, all named Ratnaprabhāsa, appeared in the world. At that time, I was also a hero of giving,

original: garbhaseno nāma /
analyzed: garbhasenaḥ nāma
translated: named Garbhasena.

original: te cāṣṭādaśa buddhakoṭyo mayā paryupāsitāḥ pūjitāśca /
analyzed: te ca aṣṭādaśa buddha koṭyaḥ mayā paryupāsitāḥ pūjitāḥ ca
translated: Those eighteen koṭis of Buddhas were attended by me and worshipped.

original: yathā tathāgatānāṃ pratyarhaṃ gandhamālyavilepanālaṃkāravibhūṣaṇaiḥ tatra ca me vyākaraṇamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdhaṃ /
analyzed: yathā tathāgatānām pratyarham gandha mālya vilepana alaṃkāra vibhūṣaṇaiḥ tatra ca me vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdham
translated: I made offerings to them of incense, garlands, ointments, clothing, and ornaments, and I received a prophecy of unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: SaSū anusmarāmyahaṃ sarvaśūra viṣmaśatirbuddhakoṭyaḥ śikhisaṃbhavanāmānastathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā loka udapadyanta /🔽pūjitā me te buddhā bhagavanto yathā pratyarheṇa pūjasatkāreṇa tatraiva ca me vyākaraṇamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdham na cādyāpi
analyzed: anusmarāmi aham sarva śūra viṣmaśatiḥ buddha koṭyaḥ śikhisaṃbhava nāmānaḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ loke udapadyanta  pūjitāḥ me te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ yathā pratyarheṇa pūja satkāreṇa tatra eva ca me vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdham na ca adya api
translated: Sarvaśūra, I remember twenty-four million buddhas named Śikhin, Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, who appeared in the world.🔽I made offerings to those Blessed Buddhas as they deserved, and I received a prophecy of unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: kālasamayamabhūdvyākaraṇāya //🔽SaSū anusmarāmyahaṃ sarvaśūra viṃśatyeva buddhakoṭyaḥ kāśyapa nāmānastathāgatā🔽arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā loka udapadyantaḥ tatrāhamapi pradānaśūro bhūvan kṛtaṃ me
analyzed: kāla samayam abhūt vyākaraṇāya  anusmarāmi aham sarva śūra viṃśatyā iva buddha koṭyaḥ kāśyapa nāmānaḥ tathāgatā  arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ loke udapadyantaḥ tatra aham api pradāna śūraḥ bhūvan kṛtam me
translated: But even now, the time has not come for me to receive a prophecy.🔽Sarvaśūra, I remember twenty million buddhas named Kāśyapa, Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, who appeared in the world.

original: teṣāṃ tathāgatānāmupasthānaṃ /
analyzed: teṣām tathāgatānām upasthānam
translated: There too, I became a hero of generosity, and I served those Tathāgatas.

original: gandhena mālyena vilepanena tathāgatagurūpasthānenopasthitāḥ yathā tathāgatānāṃ gurugauravaṃ kartavyaṃ tathā kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: gandhena mālyena vilepanena tathāgata guru upasthānena upasthitāḥ yathā tathāgatānām guru gauravam kartavyam tathā kṛtam
translated: They served the Thus-Gone Ones with incense, garlands, and ointments, and they served their teachers in the way that the Thus-Gone Ones should be served.

original: tatraiva ca me vyākaraṇamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdhaṃ /
analyzed: tatra eva ca me vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdham
translated: There, I attained the prophecy of unsurpassed and perfect enlightenment.

original: SaSū anusmarāmyahaṃ sarvaśūra ṣoḍaśa buddhakoṭyo bhūvan vimalaprabhāsanāmāna
analyzed: anusmarāmi aham sarva śūra ṣoḍaśa buddha koṭyaḥ bhūvan vimala prabhāsa nāmāna
translated: Sarva-shura, I remember that there were sixteen koṭis of Buddhas named Vimalaprabhasa,

original: tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ tena ca kālena tena samayenāhaṃ gṛhapatirabhūvadāḍhyo
analyzed: tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ tena ca kālena tena samayena aham gṛhapatiḥ abhūvat āḍhyaḥ
translated: Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones. At that time, I was a householder, wealthy,

original: mahādhano mahābhogaḥ sarvasvaparityāgī mahātyāgī / /
analyzed: mahādhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ sarva sva parityāgī mahā tyāgī
translated: with great riches and great enjoyments, who gave away all his possessions, a great giver.

original: te ca mayā ṣoḍaśa buddhakoṭyaḥ pūjitā āstaraṇaprāvaraṇena gandhena mālyena vilepanena vibhūṣaṇācchādanena ca /
analyzed: te ca mayā ṣoḍaśa buddha koṭyaḥ pūjitāḥ āstaraṇa prāvaraṇena gandhena mālyena vilepanena vibhūṣaṇa ācchādanena ca
translated: I made offerings to those sixteen koṭis of Buddhas with bedding, clothing, incense, garlands, ointments, ornaments, and coverings.

original: yathā tathāgatānāṃ gurūpasthānaṃ kartavyaṃ tathā ca mayā kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yathā tathāgatānām guru upasthānam kartavyam tathā ca mayā kṛtam
translated: I served the Thus-Gone Ones in the way that teachers should be served, and I did so.

original: tatraiva ca me vyākaraṇamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdhaṃ /
analyzed: tatra eva ca me vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdham
translated: There, I attained the prophecy of unsurpassed and perfect enlightenment.

original: na ca me kālaṃ na samayamabhūdvyākaraṇāya //
analyzed: na ca me kālam na samayam abhūt vyākaraṇāya
translated: But there was no time or occasion for me to receive the prophecy.

original: SaSū śṛṇu sarvaśūrānusmarāmyahaṃ paṃcanavatirbuddhakoṭyo loka utpannānyabhūvan
analyzed: śṛṇu sarva śūra anusmarāmi aham paṃcanavatiḥ buddha koṭyaḥ loke utpannāni abhūvan
translated: Sarvaśūra, I remember that ninety-five koṭis of Buddhas appeared in the world,

original: sarve śākyamunisahanāmānastathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ ahaṃ ca tena kālena
analyzed: sarve śākyamuni saha nāmānaḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ aham ca tena kālena
translated: all Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones named Śākyamuni. And at that time,

original: tena samayena ca rājā bhūddhārmiko dharmarājā /
analyzed: tena samayena ca rājā bhūt dhārmikaḥ dharma rājā
translated: at that moment, I was a king, a Dharma king who ruled according to the Dharma.

original: paryupāsitā me te
analyzed: paryupāsitāḥ me te
translated: I served those

original: paṃcanavatirbuddhakoṭyaḥ śākyamunināmadheyāstathāgatāḥ gandhena mālyena vilepanenāstaraṇapravaraṇena cchatradhvajapatākābhiśca /
analyzed: paṃcanavatiḥ buddha koṭyaḥ śākyamuni nāmadheyāḥ tathāgatāḥ gandhena mālyena vilepanena āstaraṇa pravaraṇena chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ ca
translated: ninety-five koṭis of Buddhas named Śākyamuni, the Tathāgatas, with incense, garlands, ointments, bedding, canopies, flags, and banners.

original: tatraiva ca me vyākaraṇamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdham //
analyzed: tatra eva ca me vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdham
translated: And it was then that I received the prophecy of my unsurpassed perfect awakening.

original: SaSū anusmarāmyahaṃ sarvaśūra navatirbuddhakoṭyaḥ krakatsudanāmānastathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā loka udapadyanta /
analyzed: anusmarāmi aham sarva śūra navatiḥ buddha koṭyaḥ krakatsuda nāmānaḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ loke udapadyanta
translated: Sarvaśūra, I remember that ninety koṭis of Buddhas named Krakucchanda, Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, appeared in the world.

original: ahaṃ ca tena kālena tena samayena brāhmakumāro 'bhūva āḍhyo mahādhano mahābhogaḥ pradānadātā sarvasvaparityāgī /
analyzed: aham ca tena kālena tena samayena brāhma kumāraḥ bhūvaḥ āḍhyaḥ mahādhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ pradāna dātā sarva sva parityāgī
translated: And at that time, at that moment, I was a wealthy, very rich, very prosperous young brahmin, a giver, a donor, one who gives away all his possessions.

original: te ca mayā tathāgatā sarve upasthitāḥ gandhena mālyena vilepanenāstarāṇaprāvaraṇena vibhūṣaṇācchādanena /
analyzed: te ca mayā tathāgatā sarve upasthitāḥ gandhena mālyena vilepanena āstarāṇa prāvaraṇena vibhūṣaṇa ācchādanena
translated: I served all those Tathāgatas with incense, garlands, ointments, bedding, coverings, ornaments, and clothing.

original: yādṛśaṃ ca tathāgatānāmupasthānaṃ tathā teṣāṃ mayā pratyarhamupasthānaṃ
analyzed: yādṛśam ca tathāgatānām upasthānam tathā teṣām mayā pratyarham upasthānam
translated: And I served them in a way that was worthy of the Tathāgatas.

original: kṛtaṃ tatraiva ca me vyākaraṇaṃ anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdhaṃ na ca me kālaṃ na samayaṃ vyākaraṇāya //
analyzed: kṛtam tatra eva ca me vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdham na ca me kālam na samayam vyākaraṇāya
translated: And I received a prophecy from them right then, but not the time or occasion for my own prophecy to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: SaSū anusmarāmyahaṃ sarvaśūrāṣṭādaśa buddhakoṭyaḥ loka udapadyanta /🔽sarve kanakamunināmānastathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ ahaṃ ca tena kālena tena
analyzed: anusmarāmi aham sarva śūra aṣṭādaśa buddha koṭyaḥ loke udapadyanta  sarve kanakamuni nāmānaḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ aham ca tena kālena tena
translated: I remember, Sarvaśūra, eighteen koṭis of Buddhas appeared in the world.

original: samayena pradānaśūro bhūvan paryupāsitā me te tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
analyzed: samayena pradāna śūraḥ bhūvan paryupāsitāḥ me te tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: All of them were Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones named Kanakamuni. And at that time, on that occasion, I was a hero of generosity. I served those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones,

original: pujitāśca gandhena mālyena vilepanenāstaraṇaprāvaraṇena vibhūṣaṇena /
analyzed: pujitāḥ ca gandhena mālyena vilepanena āstaraṇa prāvaraṇena vibhūṣaṇena
translated: and honored them with incense, garlands, ointments, bedding, coverings, and ornaments.

original: yathā tathāgatānāṃ gurupasthānāṃ tathā me upasthitāḥ tatraiva ca me vyākaraṇamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdhaṃ na ca me kālaṃ na samayaṃ
analyzed: yathā tathāgatānām guru pasthānām tathā me upasthitāḥ tatra eva ca me vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdham na ca me kālam na samayam
translated: Just as I served the Tathāgatas, so did I serve them, and there I received the prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, but not the time or occasion

original: vyākaraṇāyai /
analyzed: vyākaraṇāyai
translated: for the prophecy.

original: SaSū anusmarāmyahaṃ sarvaśūra trayodaśa buddhakoṭyo loka udapadyanta /
analyzed: anusmarāmi aham sarva śūra trayodaśa buddha koṭyaḥ loke udapadyanta
translated: All-victorious, I remember thirteen koṭis of Buddhas who appeared in the world,

original: sarve vabhāsaśirnāmānastathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ te ca me tathāgatāḥ pūjitā āstaraṇaprāvaraṇena gandhena mālyena vilepanācchādanavibhūṣaṇena
analyzed: sarve vabhāsaśiḥ nāmānaḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ te ca me tathāgatāḥ pūjitāḥ āstaraṇa prāvaraṇena gandhena mālyena vilepana ācchādana vibhūṣaṇena
translated: all of them Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones named Vabhāṣa. They were worshipped by me with bedding, clothing, incense, garlands, ointments, coverings, and ornaments,

original: yathā tathāgatānāṃ gurūpasthānaṃ kṛtaṃ tadṛśamupasthānamupasthitāḥ taiśca tathāgatairnānādharmamukhāni
analyzed: yathā tathāgatānām guru upasthānam kṛtam tadṛśam upasthānam upasthitāḥ taiḥ ca tathāgataiḥ nānā dharma mukhāni
translated: just as the service of the Tathāgatas was done, that kind of service was rendered to them, and by those Tathāgatas various Dharma doors

original: bhāṣitāni arthavinayaviniścayā tatraiva ca me vyākaraṇamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: bhāṣitāni artha vinaya viniścayā tatra eva ca me vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: were taught, with the certainty of the discipline of meaning. There I received the prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: pratilabdhaṃ na cādyāpi samayaṃ vyākaraṇāya /
analyzed: pratilabdham na ca adya api samayam vyākaraṇāya
translated: but not yet the time for the prophecy.

original: SaSū anusmarāmyahaṃ sarvaśūra paṃcaviṃśatirbuddhakoṭyaḥ puṣyanāmānastathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā loka udapādyanta /
analyzed: anusmarāmi aham sarva śūra paṃcaviṃśatiḥ buddha koṭyaḥ puṣya nāmānaḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ loke udapādyanta
translated: “Sarvaśūra, I remember twenty-five koṭis of buddhas, tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened ones named Puṣya, who appeared in the world.

original: ahaṃ ca tena kālena tena samayena prabrajito 'bhūvam paryupāsitā me te tathāgatā yathā ānandaitarhi mamopasthāyakaupasthānamupatiṣṭhati /
analyzed: aham ca tena kālena tena samayena prabrajitaḥ bhūvam paryupāsitāḥ me te tathāgatāḥ yathā ānanda etarhi mama upasthāyaka opasthānam upatiṣṭhati
translated: And at that time I went forth, and I served those tathāgatas as Ānanda now serves me.

original: tādṛśaṃ ca me te tathāgatā upasthitāḥ tatraiva ca me vyākaraṇamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdhaṃ na cādyāpi me samayamabhūdvyākaraṇāya
analyzed: tādṛśam ca me te tathāgatāḥ upasthitāḥ tatra eva ca me vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdham na ca adya api me samayam abhūt vyākaraṇāya
translated: I served those tathāgatas in the same way, and I received the prediction of unsurpassed perfect awakening from them, but even now I have not received the prediction.

original: SaSū anusmarāmyahaṃ sarvaśūra aṣṭādaśa buddhakoṭyo vipaśyināmānastathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā loka udapadyanta /
analyzed: anusmarāmi aham sarva śūra aṣṭādaśa buddha koṭyaḥ vipaśyi nāmānaḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ loke udapadyanta
translated: “Sarvaśūra, I remember eighteen koṭis of buddhas, tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened ones named Vipaśyin, who appeared in the world.

original: paryupāsitā me te tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ ābharaṇaprāvaraṇenācchādanagandhamālyavilepanena yathā tathāgatopasthānaṃ tathā me
analyzed: paryupāsitāḥ me te tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ ābharaṇa prāvaraṇena ācchādana gandha mālya vilepanena yathā tathāgata upasthānam tathā me
translated: I served those tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened ones with ornaments, clothing, and unguents, as is the service to a tathāgata, and I received the prediction of unsurpassed perfect awakening from them.

original: ahaṃ ca tena kālena tena samayena prabrajito 'bhūvan tatraiva ca me
analyzed: aham ca tena kālena tena samayena prabrajitaḥ bhūvan tatra eva ca me
translated: I was the one who went forth at that time, and I received

original: vyākaraṇamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdhavān na cādyapi samayaṃ vyākaraṇāya na cireṇa kālena /
analyzed: vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdhavān na ca ādi api samayam vyākaraṇāya na cireṇa kālena
translated: the prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment there. But even now, the time for the prophecy has not come, not for a long time.

original: SaSū yaḥ paścimako vipaśyi loka utpannaḥ sa imaṃ saṃghāṭaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ bhāṣitavān
analyzed: yaḥ paścimakaḥ vipaśyi loke utpannaḥ saḥ imam saṃghāṭam dharmaparyāyam bhāṣitavān
translated: The last Vipaśyin who appeared in the world taught this Dharma discourse called Saṃghāṭa.

original: tamahaṃ jñātvā tasmin samaye jaṃbudvīpe saptaratnavarṣaṃ pravṛṣṭavān tadā te jāṃbudvīpakāḥ
analyzed: tam aham jñātvā tasmin samaye jaṃbudvīpe sapta ratna varṣam pravṛṣṭavān tadā te jāṃbudvīpakāḥ
translated: Knowing that, at that time I caused a rain of the seven jewels to fall in Jambudvīpa. Then those beings in Jambudvīpa

original: sattvā adaridrā saṃvṛttāḥ tatraiva cāhaṃ vyākaraṇamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdhavān
analyzed: sattvāḥ a daridrā saṃvṛttāḥ tatra eva ca aham vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabdhavān
translated: became free from poverty. There I received the prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tataścireṇa kālasamayenādyāpi ca
analyzed: tatas cireṇa kāla samayena adya api ca
translated: But even now, after a long time,

original: māṃ na vyākaroti anutpattikadharmakṣāntivyākaraṇena /
analyzed: mām na vyākaroti anutpattika dharma kṣānti vyākaraṇena
translated: he has not prophesied me with the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: SaSū āha / katamaḥ sa bhagavān kālaḥ katamaḥ sa samayaḥ bhagavān āha śṛṇu
analyzed: sasū āha katamaḥ sa bhagavān kālaḥ katamaḥ sa samayaḥ bhagavān āha śṛṇu
translated: Sarvaśūra said, What is that time, what is that occasion? The Blessed One said, Listen,

original: sarvaśūra tato dvyasaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpairdīpaṃkaro nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi /
analyzed: sarva śūra tatas dvi asaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpaiḥ dīpaṃkaraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi
translated: Sarvaśūra. After two incalculable eons, a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One named Dīpaṃkara appeared in the world.

original: tato 'haṃ sarvaśura tena kālena tena samayena megho nāma aṇavako bhūvan yadā ca bhagavan
analyzed: tatas ham sarvaśura tena kālena tena samayena meghaḥ nāma aṇavakaḥ bhūvan yadā ca bhagavan
translated: “Then, Sarvaśūra, at that time and in those days, I was a young boy named Megha. When the Blessed One,

original: dīpaṃkarastathāgato loka utpannaḥ tadāhamapi tasmin kāle tasmin samaye brahmacaryamacārṣaṃ
analyzed: dīpaṃkaraḥ tathāgataḥ loke utpannaḥ tadā aham api tasmin kāle tasmin samaye brahmacaryam acārṣam
translated: the Tathāgata Dīpaṃkara, appeared in the world, at that time and in those days I practiced celibacy,

original: māṇavakarūpeṇa tato 'haṃ bhagavantan dīpaṃkaran tathāgataṃ dṛṣṭvā prasāda pratilabdhaḥ
analyzed: māṇavaka rūpeṇa tatas ham bhagavantan dīpaṃkaran tathāgatam dṛṣṭvā prasāda pratilabdhaḥ
translated: in the form of a young brahmin. Then, Blessed One, having seen the Tathāgata Dīpaṃkara, I attained faith

original: saptabhirutpalairavakīrṇavāṃ tacca tathāgatāvaropitaṃ kuśalamūlamanuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: saptabhiḥ utpalaiḥ avakīrṇavām tat ca tathāgata avaropitam kuśala mūlam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: and scattered seven blue lotuses. That root of merit planted in the Tathāgata was dedicated to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: pariṇāmitam sa ca mān dīpaṃkarastathāgato vyākārṣīdbhaviṣyasi tvaṃ māṇavakānāgate
analyzed: pariṇāmitam sa ca mān dīpaṃkaraḥ tathāgataḥ vyākārṣīt bhaviṣyasi tvam māṇavaka anāgate
translated: And that Dīpaṃkara Tathāgata prophesied: 'Young brahmin, in the future,

original: 'dhvanyasaṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpaiḥ śākyamunirnāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddha iti /
analyzed: dhvanya saṃkhyeyaiḥ kalpaiḥ śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ iti
translated: after countless eons, you will become the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One named Śākyamuni.'

original: SaSū tato 'haṃ sarvaśūra dvādaśatālamātraṃ vihāyasamantarīkṣe sthitvānutpattikadharmakṣāntiṃ pratilabdhavān yacca me sarvaśūrāsaṃkhyeyeṣu 🔽kalpeṣu brahmacaryaṃ cīrṇaṃ /
analyzed: tatas ham sarva śūra dvādaśa tāla mātram vihāyasam antarīkṣe sthitvā anutpattikadharmakṣāntim pratilabdhavān yat ca me sarva śūra asaṃkhyeyeṣu 🔽kalpeṣu brahmacaryam cīrṇam
translated: Then, Sarvaśūra, I rose up into the sky to the height of twelve palm trees and, standing there in space, attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas. And, Sarvaśūra, the celibate life I practiced for countless eons,🔽 all that was not worth a sixteenth part of the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas that I attained at that time.

original: yacca pāramitāpratisaṃyuktaṃ kuśalamūlaṃ tatsarvamāmukhībhūtamivānusmarāmi yathādya śvo vā /
analyzed: yat ca pāramitā pratisaṃyuktam kuśala mūlam tat sarvam ā mukhībhūtam iva anusmarāmi yathā adya śvas vā
translated: And whatever roots of goodness I have gathered through practicing the perfections, I remember them all as if they were right in front of me, as if they were today or yesterday.

original: tatra mayā sarvaśūrānekāni sattvakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāni /
analyzed: tatra mayā sarva śūra anekāni sattva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāni
translated: There, Sarvaśūra, I established many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of sentient beings in wholesome dharmas.

original: kaḥ punarvāda sarvaśūra ya etarhyahama anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhaḥ sarvasattvahitaiṣiṇaḥ kāruṇikaḥ sattvānāṃ nirodhadharman deśayiṣyāmi
analyzed: kaḥ punar vāda sarva śūra yaḥ etarhi aham anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ sarva sattva hita eṣiṇaḥ kāruṇikaḥ sattvānām nirodha dharman deśayiṣyāmi
translated: To say nothing of now, Sarvaśūra, when I have attained supreme perfect enlightenment, I am benevolent to all beings, compassionate, and will teach the Dharma of cessation to beings.

original: SaSū naitatsthānaṃ vidyate /
analyzed: na etat sthānam vidyate
translated: This is not possible.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ bahuprakāraṃ cāhaṃ sarvaśūra sattvānān dharman deśayāmi /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ bahu prakāram ca aham sarva śūra sattvānān dharman deśayāmi
translated: Why is that? Sarvaśūra, I teach the Dharma to beings in many ways.

original: yathārūpavainayikānāṃ sattvānāṃ tathārūpeṇa dharman deśayāmi /🔽devarūpeṇa devaloke devānāṃ
analyzed: yathārūpa vainayikānām sattvānām tathārūpeṇa dharman deśayāmi  deva rūpeṇa deva loke devānām
translated: I teach the Dharma in such a way as to guide beings according to their dispositions.

original: dharman deśayāmi /🔽nāgabhavaṇe nāgarūpeṇa nāgānānaṃ
analyzed: dharman deśayāmi  nāga bhavaṇe nāga rūpeṇa nāga ānānam
translated: In the world of the gods, I teach the Dharma to the gods in the form of a god.

original: dharman deśayāmi /🔽yakṣabhavane yakṣarūpena yakṣānāṃ
analyzed: dharman deśayāmi  yakṣa bhavane yakṣa rūpena yakṣānām
translated: In the abode of the nāgas, I teach the Dharma to the nāgas in the form of a nāga.

original: dharman deśayāmi /🔽pretabhavane pretarūpeṇa pretānāṃ
analyzed: dharman deśayāmi  preta bhavane preta rūpeṇa pretānām
translated: In the abode of the yakṣas, I teach the Dharma to the yakṣas in the form of a yakṣa.

original: dharman deśayāmi /
analyzed: dharman deśayāmi
translated: In the abode of the pretas, I teach the Dharma to the pretas in the form of a preta.

original: manuṣyaloke manuṣyarūpena manuṣyāṇāṃ
analyzed: manuṣya loke manuṣya rūpena manuṣyāṇām
translated: in the human world, in human form, to humans,

original: dharman deśayāmi /
analyzed: dharman deśayāmi
translated: In the human world, I teach the Dharma to humans in human form.

original: buddhavainayikānāṃ sattvānāṃ buddharūpeṇa dharman deśayāmi /
analyzed: buddha vainayikānām sattvānām buddha rūpeṇa dharman deśayāmi
translated: For beings who are to be guided by the Buddha, I teach the Dharma in the form of the Buddha.

original: bodhisattvāvainayikānāṃ sattvānāṃ bodhisattvarūpeṇa dharman deśayāmi /
analyzed: bodhisattva avainayikānām sattvānām bodhisattva rūpeṇa dharman deśayāmi
translated: For beings who are to be guided by the bodhisattvas, I teach the Dharma in the form of a bodhisattva.

original: śrāvakavainayikānāṃ sattvānāṃ śrāvakarūpeṇa dharman deśayāmi /
analyzed: śrāvaka vainayikānām sattvānām śrāvaka rūpeṇa dharman deśayāmi
translated: For beings who are to be guided by the śrāvakas, I teach the Dharma in the form of a śrāvaka.

original: yena yena rūpeṇa sattvā vinayaṃ gacchanti tena tena rūpeṇāhaṃ sattvānān dharman deśayāmi /
analyzed: yena yena rūpeṇa sattvāḥ vinayam gacchanti tena tena rūpeṇa aham sattvānān dharman deśayāmi
translated: In whatever form beings are to be guided, in that form I teach the Dharma to beings.

original: evaṃ bahuprakāram ahaṃ sarvaśūra sattvānān dharman deśayāmi /
analyzed: evam bahu prakāram aham sarva śūra sattvānān dharman deśayāmi
translated: In this way, Sarvaśūra, I teach the Dharma to beings in many ways.

original: SaSū tatkasya hetoryathaiva sarvaśūra sattvā bahuprakāraṃ dharmaṃ śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ yathā eva sarva śūra sattvāḥ bahu prakāram dharmam śṛṇvanti
translated: Why is it so? Just as, Sarvaśūra, beings listen to the Dharma in many ways,

original: tathaiva te sattvasārāḥ bahuprakāraṃ sattvānān dharman deśayanti /
analyzed: tathā eva te sattva sārāḥ bahu prakāram dharman deśayanti
translated: in the same way, those beings of essence teach the Dharma to beings in many ways.

original: te ca sattvāsteṣu tathāgateṣu kuśalamūlānyavaropayanti /
analyzed: te ca sattvāḥ teṣu tathāgateṣu kuśala mūlāni avaropayanti
translated: And those beings plant roots of virtue in those Tathāgatas.

original: dānāni ca dadanti /
analyzed: dānāni ca dadanti
translated: They give gifts.

original: puṇyāni ca kurvanti /
analyzed: puṇyāni ca kurvanti
translated: They perform meritorious deeds.

original: svārthe ca pratijāgaranti /
analyzed: sva arthe ca pratijāgaranti
translated: They are vigilant in their own purpose.

original: maraṇānusmṛtiṃ ca bhāvayiṣyanti /
analyzed: maraṇa anusmṛtim ca bhāvayiṣyanti
translated: And they will cultivate mindfulness of death.

original: te caivaṃrūpaṃ kuśalaṃ karmābhisaṃskāramabhisaṃskariṣyanti /
analyzed: te ca evaṃrūpam kuśalam karma abhisaṃskāram abhisaṃskariṣyanti
translated: They will perform such wholesome actions.

original: tenaiva ca dharmaśravaṇakuśalamūlahetunā tat pūrvakaṃ kuśalamūlaṃ saṃsmariṣyanti /
analyzed: tena eva ca dharma śravaṇa kuśala mūla hetunā tat pūrvakam kuśala mūlam saṃsmariṣyanti
translated: And by the cause of the root of merit of listening to the Dharma, they will remember that previous root of merit.

original: teṣāṃ tad bhaviṣyati dīrgharātramarthāya hitāya sukhāya devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca /
analyzed: teṣām tat bhaviṣyati dīrgharātram arthāya hitāya sukhāya devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca
translated: That will be for their benefit, welfare, and happiness for a long time, for the gods and humans.

original: evaṃ hi sarvaśūra saṃghāṭasūtrasya dharmaparyāyasya sahaśravaṇamātreṇaivamaprameyāmasaṃkhyeyā
analyzed: evam hi sarva śūra saṃghāṭasūtrasya dharmaparyāyasya saha śravaṇa mātreṇa evam aprameyām asaṃkhyeyā
translated: Thus, Sarva-shura, by merely hearing the Dharma discourse of the Sanghata Sutra, immeasurable, incalculable

original: guṇānuśaṃsā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: guṇa anuśaṃsāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: meritorious virtues and benefits will arise.

original: SaSū atha te sattvāḥ parasparamevamāhuḥ astyanyaḥ kaścit kuśalo dharmaphalavipākaḥ
analyzed: atha te sattvāḥ parasparam evam āhuḥ asti anyaḥ kaścid kuśalaḥ dharma phala vipākaḥ
translated: Then those beings said to each other: Is there any other wholesome Dharma whose fruition and ripening

original: yasya kṛtatvādupacitatvādanuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃboddhyate sarvasattvāhitaiṣiṇaśca bhavanti //
analyzed: yasya kṛta tvāt upacita tvāt anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhyate sarva sattva ahita eṣiṇaḥ ca bhavanti
translated: by which, when performed and accumulated, one attains supreme perfect enlightenment and becomes one who wishes for the welfare of all beings?

original: SaSū atha bhagavaṃsteṣāṃ sattvānāṃ cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkamājñāya tānetadavocat
analyzed: atha bhagavan teṣām sattvānām cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya tān etat avocat
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing with his mind the thoughts that had arisen in the minds of those beings, said this to them:

original: asti kulaputrā ye dharmaṃ pattīyanti te evaṃ vakṣyanti asti dharmo yathābhūtaḥ
analyzed: asti kula putrāḥ ye dharmam pattīyanti te evam vakṣyanti asti dharmaḥ yathābhūtaḥ
translated: There are, O sons of noble family, those who have faith in the Dharma. They will say: 'There is the Dharma as it truly is.'

original: teṣāṃ mahāphalaṃ sukhavipākamanuttaraṃ dharmasukhaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: teṣām mahā phalam sukha vipākam anuttaram dharma sukham bhaviṣyati
translated: For them, there will be great fruits, pleasant results, and unsurpassed happiness in the Dharma.

original: SaSū ye sattvā mohamūḍhāsta evaṃ vakṣyanti /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ moha mūḍhāḥ te evam vakṣyanti
translated: Those beings who are deluded and confused will say thus:

original: na santi dharmāḥ na santi dharmānāṃ pāragaḥ sa teṣāṃ mahāphalaṃ kaṭukavipākamapāyeṣupapatsyate /
analyzed: na santi dharmāḥ na santi dharmānām pāragaḥ sa teṣām mahā phalam kaṭuka vipākam apāyeṣu upapatsyate
translated: There are no dharmas, and there is no one who has gone to the other shore of the dharmas. For them, there will be great fruits with bitter results, and they will be reborn in the lower realms.

original: punaḥ punaśca te mohapuruṣā
analyzed: punar punar ca te moha puruṣā
translated: Again and again, those deluded people

original: apāyabhūmiparāyaṇā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: apāya bhūmi parāyaṇāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: will be devoted to the grounds of the lower realms.

original: SaSū aṣṭau kalpān nairāyikān duḥkhaṃ vedanāmanubhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: aṣṭau kalpān nairāyikān duḥkham vedanām anubhaviṣyanti
translated: They will experience suffering for eight eons in the hells.

original: dvādaśa kalpāni pretayoniṣu duḥkhaṃ vedanāṃ vedayiṣyanti /
analyzed: dvādaśa kalpāni preta yoniṣu duḥkham vedanām vedayiṣyanti
translated: They will experience suffering for twelve eons in the realms of hungry ghosts.

original: ṣoḍaśa kalpānyasureṣūpapatsyante /
analyzed: ṣoḍaśa kalpāni asureṣu upapatsyante
translated: They will be reborn among the asuras for sixteen eons.

original: nava kalpasahasrāni bhūtapiśācayoniṣūpapatsyante /
analyzed: nava kalpa sahasrāni bhūta piśāca yoniṣu upapatsyante
translated: They will be reborn in the realms of spirits and demons for nine thousand eons.

original: caturdaśa kalpasahasrāṇi ajihvakā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: caturdaśa kalpa sahasrāṇi ajihvakāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: For fourteen thousand eons, they will be without tongues.

original: ṣoḍaśa kalpasahasrāṇi mātugarbhe kālaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: ṣoḍaśa kalpa sahasrāṇi mātu garbhe kālam kariṣyati
translated: For sixteen thousand eons, they will die in the womb.

original: dvādaśa kalpasahasrāṇi māṃsapiṇḍā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: dvādaśa kalpa sahasrāṇi māṃsa piṇḍāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: For twelve thousand eons, they will be lumps of flesh.

original: ekādaśa kalpasahasrāṇi jātyandhabhūtāḥ prajāsyanti /
analyzed: ekādaśa kalpa sahasrāṇi jāti andha bhūtāḥ
translated: For eleven thousand eons, they will be born blind,

original: duḥkhām vedanāṃ vedayamānā /
analyzed: duḥkhām vedanām vedayamānā
translated: experiencing painful feelings.

original: jātyandhaṃ ca dṛṣṭvā
analyzed: jāti andham ca dṛṣṭvā
translated: And seeing the blind man,

original: SaSū tadā mātāpitṛbhyāmevaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tadā mātā pitṛbhyām evam bhaviṣyati
translated: his parents will think thus:

original: nirāsvādamasmābhirduḥkhamanubhūtaṃ nirāsvādamasmākāṃ putro 'jātaḥ nirāsyādaṃ navā māsāḥ kukṣau dhāritaḥ śītoṣṇāṃ vedanāṃ vedayamānaiḥ kṣutpipāsāsuḥkhāṇi 🔽ca pratyanubhūtāni /
analyzed: nirāsvādam asmābhiḥ duḥkham anubhūtam nirāsvādam asmākām putraḥ jātaḥ nirāsyādam navāḥ māsāḥ kukṣau dhāritaḥ śīta uṣṇām vedanām vedayamānaiḥ kṣudh pipāsā suḥkhāṇi  ca pratyanubhūtāni
translated: 'We have experienced suffering without any joy. Our son was born without any joy. For nine months he was carried in the womb, experiencing cold and heat, hunger and thirst, and suffering.

original: bahūni ca dṛṣṭadharmavedanīyāni duḥkhāni dṛṣṭvā putro 'jātaḥ na ca gṛhe mātāpitrāvutsukau kṛtau na svakāyaṃ /
analyzed: bahūni ca dṛṣṭadharma vedanīyāni duḥkhāni dṛṣṭvā putraḥ jātaḥ na ca gṛhe mātā pitrau utsukau kṛtau na sva kāyam
translated: And having seen many sufferings to be experienced in this very life, our son was born. And he has not made his mother and father anxious in the house, nor his own body.

original: tato mātāpitṛbhyāṃ mahatī nirāśatā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tatas mātā pitṛbhyām mahatī nirāśa tā bhaviṣyati
translated: Then there will be great despair for the parents.

original: evameva sarvaśūra nirāśāḥ saddharmapratikṣepakāḥ sattvāḥ narakatiryakpretaparāyaṇāḥ te ca tasmin maraṇakālasamaye mahatā śokāśalyasamarpitā 🔽bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: evam eva sarva śūra nirāśāḥ saddharma pratikṣepakāḥ sattvāḥ naraka tiryak preta parāyaṇāḥ te ca tasmin maraṇa kāla samaye mahatā śoka aśalya samarpitā  bhaviṣyanti
translated: In the same way, Sarva-shura, those who reject the true Dharma are hopeless, devoted to hell, animal, and hungry ghost realms. And at the time of their death, they will be pierced by the great dart of sorrow.

original: SaSū ye sarvaśūra sattvā evaṃ vāgbhāṣante asti dharmaḥ asti dharmāṇāṃ pāragaḥ te tena kuśalamūlena viṃśāti kalpāṇyuttarakuruṣūpapatsyante
analyzed: ye sarva śūra sattvāḥ evam vāc bhāṣante asti dharmaḥ asti dharmāṇām pāragaḥ te tena kuśala mūlena viṃśāti kalpāṇi uttarakuruṣu upapatsyante
translated: Those beings, Sarva-shura, who speak thus: There is Dharma, there is one who has gone to the other shore of Dharma, by that root of goodness, they will be reborn in the Uttarakuru continent for twenty eons.

original: paṃcaviṃśati kalpasahasrāṇi trāyastriṃśānān devānāṃ sahabhāvyatāyāmupapatsyante /
analyzed: paṃcaviṃśati kalpa sahasrāṇi devānām sahabhāvya tāyām upapatsyante
translated: They will be reborn in the company of the gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three for twenty-five thousand eons.

original: trayastriṃśadbhyo devebhyaścyavitvā uttarakuruṣupapatsyante /
analyzed: trayastriṃśadbhyaḥ devebhyaḥ cyavitvā uttarakuruṣu upapatsyante
translated: Having fallen from the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, they will be reborn in Uttarakuru.

original: na ca mātuḥ kukṣāvupapatsyante /
analyzed: na ca mātuḥ kukṣau upapatsyante
translated: They will not be reborn in a mother's womb.

original: lokadhātuśatasahasraṃ ca drakṣyanti /
analyzed: lokadhātu śata sahasram ca drakṣyanti
translated: They will see a hundred thousand world systems.

original: sarve ca tāṃ lokadhātavaḥ
analyzed: sarve ca tām lokadhātavaḥ
translated: And all those world systems

original: sukhāvatīnāmānaḥ sarvabuddhakṣetrasandarśanan dṛṣṭvā tatraiva pratiṣṭhānāṃ kṛtvā tatraiva bodhimabhisambhotsyante /
analyzed: sukhāvatī nāmānaḥ sarva buddhakṣetra sandarśanan dṛṣṭvā tatra eva pratiṣṭhānām kṛtvā tatra eva bodhim abhisambhotsyante
translated: will be called Sukhāvatī. Having seen the display of all buddha-fields, they will establish themselves there and attain enlightenment there.

original: SaSū evaṃ hi sarvaśūra mahāprabhāvo yaṃ saṃghāṭo dharmaparyāyaḥ ye 'smiṃścittaprasādaṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: evam hi sarva śūra mahā prabhāvaḥ yam saṃghāṭaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ ye smin citta prasādam kariṣyanti
translated: Thus, Sarvaśūra, the Saṃghāṭa Dharma-Paryāya has great power. Those who have faith in it

original: na te jātu viṣamaparihāreṇa kālaṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: na te jātu viṣama parihāreṇa kālam kariṣyanti
translated: will never die without encountering misfortune.

original: pariśuddhaśīlasamavāgatāste sattvā
analyzed: pariśuddha śīla samavāgatāḥ te sattvā
translated: Those beings will attain pure morality.

original: bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be endowed with pure morality.
