original: SaSū santi sarvaśūra sattvā ya evaṃ vaksyanti rātrindivaṃ tathāgato bahūni sattvāni parimocayanti /
analyzed: santi sarvaśūra sattvāḥ ye evam vaksyanti rātrindivam tathāgataḥ bahūni sattvāni parimocayanti
translated: Sarvaśūra, there are beings who will say, 'The Tathāgata liberates many beings day and night.

original: adyāpi sattvadhātuḥ kṣayaṃ na gacchanti /
analyzed: adya api sattvadhātuḥ kṣayam na gacchanti
translated: Even now, the realm of beings does not diminish.'

original: bahavo bodhāya praṇidhānaṃ kurvati /
analyzed: bahavaḥ bodhāya praṇidhānam kurvati
translated: Many make aspirations for enlightenment.

original: bahavaḥ svargaloka upapadyante /
analyzed: bahavaḥ svarga loke upapadyante
translated: Many are reborn in the world of the gods.

original: bahavo nirvṛtimanuprāpnuvanti /
analyzed: bahavaḥ nirvṛtim anuprāpnuvanti
translated: Many attain nirvana.

original: atha kena hetunā sattvānāṃ kṣayo na bhavati //
analyzed: atha kena hetunā sattvānām kṣayaḥ na bhavati
translated: Now, by what means does the destruction of beings not occur?

analyzed: ii maitreya paripṛcchā

analyzed: atha anya tīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigranthānām etat abhavat gamiṣyāmaḥ vayam
translated: Then this occurred to the non-Buddhist practitioners, medical practitioners, wandering mendicants, and Jain ascetics: We will go

analyzed: śramaṇena gautamena sārdham vivādam kariṣyāmaḥ atha khalu caturnavati brāhmaṇāni atīrthika caraka paribrājakāḥ
translated: and debate with the ascetic Gautama. Then, indeed, ninety-four Brahmins, non-Buddhist practitioners, medical practitioners, wandering mendicants,

original: anekāni ca nigranthaśatāni yena rājagṛhaṃ mahānagaraṃ tenopasaṃkrāmanti /
analyzed: anekāni ca nigrantha śatāni yena rājagṛham mahā nagaram tena upasaṃkrāmanti
translated: and many hundreds of Jain ascetics approached the great city of Rajagriha.

analyzed: tena ca kālena tena samayena bhagavān smitām prāduṣcakāra
translated: At that time and on that occasion, the Blessed One manifested a smile.

analyzed: atha khalu maitreyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṃgam
translated: Then, indeed, the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Maitreya rose from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder,🔽placed his right knee on the ground, bowed with folded hands in the direction of the Blessed One,

original: kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃstenāṃjaliṃ praṇamya
analyzed: kṛtvā dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim praṇamya
translated: and said this to the Blessed One:

original: bhagavantametadavocat ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya prāduṣkaraṇāya /
analyzed: bhagavantam etat avocat kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya prāduṣkaraṇāya
translated: He said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, what is the cause, what is the condition, for the manifestation of a smile?

analyzed: na a hetum na a pratyayam tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ smitam prāduṣkurvanti
translated: The Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones do not manifest a smile without a cause, without a condition.

translated: The Blessed One said, Listen, son of noble family, today there will be a great gathering here in the great city of Rajagriha.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said,

original: ke bhagavan ihāyāsyanti /
analyzed: ke bhagavan iha āyāsyanti

analyzed: devāḥ vā nāgāḥ vā yakṣāḥ vā manuṣyāḥ vā amanuṣyāḥ vā

analyzed: bhagavān āha sarve ete maitreya adya iha āgamiṣyanti
translated: The Blessed One said, All of them will come here, Maitreya,

analyzed: deva nāga yakṣa manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ caturaśītim ca sahasrāṇi brāhmaṇānām iha āyāsyanti
translated: gods, nagas, yakshas, humans, and non-humans. And eighty-four thousand brahmins will come here.

analyzed: navati koṭī sahasrāṇi tīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigranthānām iha ā yāsyanti
translated: Ninety thousand kotis of thousands of tirthika charvakas, parivrajakas, and jainas will come here.

original: te mayā sārdhaṃ vivādaṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: te mayā sārdham vivādam kariṣyanti
translated: They will have a debate with me.

original: teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ vivādaśamanāya dharman deśayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: teṣām sarveṣām vivāda śamanāya dharman deśayiṣyāmi
translated: I will teach the Dharma to them all for the sake of resolving their disputes.

original: sarve ca te brāhmaṇā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksambodhau cittamutpādayiṣyanti /
analyzed: sarve ca te brāhmaṇāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksambodhau cittam utpādayiṣyanti
translated: And all those brahmins will generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: navati koṭī śata sahasrāṇi anya tīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigranthāḥ sarve srotaāpatti phalam prāpsyanti
translated: Ninety thousand koṭis of niyutas of other tīrthika carakas and parivrājakas will all attain the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: aṣṭādaśa koṭī sahasrāṇi nāga rājñām āgamiṣyanti
translated: Eighteen thousand koṭis of nāga kings will come.

original: ye mamāntikāddharmaṃ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: ye mama antikāt dharmam śroṣyanti
translated: They will listen to the Dharma from me.

analyzed: śrutvā ca tā

analyzed: dvātriṃśadbhiḥ koṭī sahasraiḥ māraḥ pāpīyān sa parivāraḥ āyāsyati

original: dvādaśa koṭīsahasrāṇi asurarājñāmāgamiṣyanti /
analyzed: dvādaśa koṭī sahasrāṇi asura rājñām āgamiṣyanti
translated: Twelve thousand koṭis of asura kings will come.

original: paṃcamātrāṇi ca
analyzed: paṃca mātrāṇi ca
translated: Five hundred

translated: kings with their retinues will come to listen to the Dharma.

analyzed: te sarve mama antikāt dharmam śrutvā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpādayiṣyanti
translated: All of them, having heard the Dharma from me, will generate the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: SaSū atha khalu maitreyo bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavantaṃ tṛṣ
analyzed: atha khalu maitreyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavantam
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Maitreya bowed his head to the feet of the Blessed One and circumambulated the Blessed One three times.

original: pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā tatraivāntardhitataḥ //
analyzed: pradakṣiṇīkṛtvā
translated: Having circumambulated, he disappeared right there.

analyzed: kṛtvā dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyam pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim praṇāmya

translated: the king named Sudarśana,

original: jayaseno nāma rājā /
analyzed: jayasenaḥ nāma rājā
translated: the king named Jaya-sena,

translated: the king named Bimbisāra,

analyzed: prasenajit nāma rājā
translated: the king named Prasenajit,

translated: Each king had a retinue of twenty thousand koṭis, all of them set out for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, except for King Virūḍhaka.

analyzed: dakṣiṇāyām diśāyām paṃcāśat koṭī sahasrāni bodhisattvānām āgacchanti  diśāyām koṭī sahasrāṇi bodhisattvānām āgacchanti

analyzed: ūrdhvāyān diśi koṭī sahasrāṇi bodhisattvānām āgacchanti
translated: In the upper direction, a hundred thousand koṭis of bodhisattvas came.

original: sarve ca daśabhūmipratiṣṭhitāḥ
analyzed: sarve ca daśa bhūmi pratiṣṭhitāḥ

analyzed: atha te sarve bodhisattvāḥ yena rājagṛham mahā nagaram yena ca gṛddhrakūṭa parvataḥ yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ bhagavataḥ darśanāya  /

translated: Go, Sarva-shura, to the worlds in the ten directions and tell the Bodhisattvas:

translated: Today the Tathagata will teach the Dharma in the great city of Rajagriha.

original: tadyūyaṃ sarve daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu sthitā añjalīn praṇāmayatha /
analyzed: tat yūyam sarve daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu sthitāḥ añjalīn praṇāmayatha
translated: Therefore, all of you who are in the worlds in the ten directions, bow your joined palms.

analyzed: anuśrāvya ca muhūrta mātreṇa ca punar eva āgaccha dharma śravaṇāya  atha khalu sarvaśūraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ utthāya āsanāt bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya bhagavantam tṛṣ
translated: And having heard it, return in an instant to listen to the Dharma.

analyzed: pradakṣiṇīkṛtya ṛddhi balena antardhitaḥ
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Sarva-shura rose from his seat, bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One three times, and disappeared by his magical power.

original: SaSū atha khalu sarvaśūro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu gatvā bodhisattvānāmārocayati /
analyzed: atha khalu sarvaśūraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu gatvā bodhisattvānām ārocayati
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Sarva-shura went to the worlds in the ten directions and announced to the Bodhisattvas:🔽Today the Tathagata will teach the Dharma in the great city of Rajagriha.🔽Therefore, all of you who are in the worlds in the ten directions, bow your joined palms.

original: adya mārṣā śākyamunistathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sahāyāṃ lokadhātau rājagṛhe mahānagare sattvānān dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: adya mārṣā śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sahāyām lokadhātau rājagṛhe mahā nagare dharmam deśayati
translated: Today, friends, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the Teacher, the Vanquisher, the Knower of the World, the Leader, the Trainer of Men, the Teacher of Gods and Men, the Buddha, the Blessed One, is teaching the Dharma to the beings in the Saha world system in the great city of Rajagriha.

original: tadyūyaṃ sādhukāramanuprayacchath /
analyzed: tat yūyam sādhukāram anuprayacchath
translated: Therefore, you should give your approval.

original: tadyuṣmākamadyaiva hitāya sukhāya mahālābho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tat yuṣmākam adya eva hitāya sukhāya mahā lābhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: That will be a great gain for your welfare and happiness right now.

original: SaSū atha khalu sarvaśūro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu gatvā sarvabuddhān paryupāsya bodhisattvānāmārocayati /
analyzed: atha khalu sarvaśūraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu gatvā sarva buddhān paryupāsya bodhisattvānām ārocayati
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvaśūra went to the world systems in the ten directions, attended on all the Buddhas, and announced to the bodhisattvas:

original: tadyathāpi nāma balavān puruṣo cchaṭāsaṃghāṭaṃ kuryādatrāntare sarvaśūro bodhisattvo
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma balavān puruṣaḥ chaṭā saṃghāṭam kuryāt atra antare sarva śūraḥ bodhisattvaḥ
translated: Just as a strong man might snap his fingers, in that time the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvaśūra

original: mahāsattvo yena rājagṛhaṃ mahānagaraṃ yena ca bhagavāṃstenāgatya bhagavataḥ purata
analyzed: mahāsattvaḥ yena rājagṛham mahā nagaram yena ca bhagavān tena āgatya bhagavataḥ puratas
translated: went to the great city of Rājagṛha, to where the Blessed One was, and stood

original: sthitaḥ tatra ca sarve brāhmaṇānyatīrthikacarakaparibrājakanigranthā sannipatitāḥ
analyzed: sthitaḥ tatra ca sarve sannipatitāḥ
translated: in front of the Blessed One. There all the brahmins, non-Buddhists, physicians, wandering mendicants, and Jains had assembled,

original: bahavaśca devanāgamanuṣyāmanuṣyāḥ paṃcamātrāṇi ca rājaśatāni saparivārāṇi sannipatitāni /
analyzed: bahavaḥ ca deva nāga manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ paṃca mātrāṇi ca rāja śatāni sa parivārāṇi sannipatitāni
translated: and many gods, nāgas, humans, non-humans, and five hundred kings with their retinues had assembled.

original: trayastriṃśatkoṭīsahasrāṇi mārāṇāṃ pāpīyasāṃ saparivārāḥ sannipatitā /
analyzed: trayastriṃśat koṭī sahasrāṇi mārāṇām pāpīyasām sa parivārāḥ sannipatitā
translated: Thirty-three thousand koṭis of evil Māras, together with their retinues, assembled.

original: SaSū atha khalu punaḥ tena samayena rājagṛhaṃ mahānagaraṃ prakaṃpitam atha khalu daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣi divyaṃ candanacūrṇaṃ pravarṣitaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu punar tena samayena rājagṛham mahā nagaram prakaṃpitam atha khalu daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣi divyam candana cūrṇam pravarṣitam
translated: Then at that time the great city of Rājagṛha shook. Then in the worlds of the ten directions a rain of divine sandalwood powder fell,

original: divyaṃ ca puṣpavarṣaṃ pravarṣitaṃ /
analyzed: divyam ca puṣpa varṣam pravarṣitam
translated: and a rain of divine flowers fell.

original: tad bhagavato mūrdhasandhau kūṭāgāraḥ saṃsthitaḥ tena khalu punaḥ samayena tathāgatasya purataḥ śakro devānāmindro vajraṃ parāhanat
analyzed: tat bhagavataḥ mūrdha sandhau kūṭāgāraḥ saṃsthitaḥ tena khalu punar samayena tathāgatasya puratas śakraḥ devānām indraḥ vajram parāhanat
translated: It formed a peaked dwelling on the crown of the Blessed One's head. Then at that time Śakra, lord of the gods, struck his thunderbolt in front of the Tathāgata.

original: SaSū atha khalu tasmin samaye caturdiśaṃ catvāro vātarājanaḥ saṃkṣubdhāḥ pravānti /
analyzed: atha khalu tasmin samaye caturdiśam catvāraḥ vātarājanaḥ saṃkṣubdhāḥ pravānti
translated: Then at that time the four great wind kings were disturbed and blew in the four directions.

original: yena ca rājagṛhe mahānagare saṃkarā vā paṃsavo vā bālikā vā tatsarvaṃ nagarādbahiḥ prakṣipanti /🔽daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu gandhodakavarṣaṃ pravarṣanti /
analyzed: yena ca rājagṛhe mahā nagare saṃkarāḥ vā paṃsavaḥ vā bālikāḥ vā tat sarvam nagarāt bahis prakṣipanti  daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu gandha udaka varṣam pravarṣanti
translated: They threw all the rubbish, dust, and dirt outside the city of Rājagṛha.🔽They rained down a rain of fragrant water in the worlds of the ten directions.

original: daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣūtpalapadmakumudapuṇḍarīkāni pravarṣanti /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu lokadhātuṣu utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīkāni pravarṣanti
translated: They rained down blue lotuses, red lotuses, white lotuses, and white water lilies in the worlds of the ten directions.

original: te ca puṣpāsteṣāṃ sattvānāmuparimurdhni puṣpacchatrāṇi tasthire /
analyzed: te ca puṣpāḥ teṣām sattvānām upari murdhni puṣpa chatrāṇi tasthire
translated: Those flowers hovered above the heads of those beings in the form of canopies.

original: tathāgatasya coparimurdhni uparyantarīkṣe caturaśītiḥ kūṭāgārasahasrāṇi saṃsthitāni /
analyzed: tathāgatasya ca upari murdhni upari antarīkṣe caturaśītiḥ kūṭāgāra sahasrāṇi saṃsthitāni
translated: Above the head of the Thus-Gone One, in the space above, eighty-four thousand kūṭāgāras appeared.

original: teṣu ca caturaśītiṣu puṣpakūṭāgārasahasreṣu caturaśīti sahasrāṇyāsanānāṃ prajñaptāni saptaratnamayāni prādurbhūtāni /
analyzed: teṣu ca caturaśītiṣu puṣpa kūṭāgāra sahasreṣu caturaśīti sahasrāṇi āsanānām prajñaptāni sapta ratna mayāni prādurbhūtāni
translated: In those eighty-four thousand flower kūṭāgāras, eighty-four thousand seats made of the seven precious substances were arranged.

original: sarvatra cāsane tathāgato niṣaṇṇo dharman deśayati /
analyzed: sarvatra ca āsane tathāgataḥ niṣaṇṇaḥ dharman deśayati
translated: On each seat, a Thus-Gone One was seated teaching the Dharma.

original: atha khalvayaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātuḥ ṣaḍvikāraṃ prakampitaḥ //
analyzed: atha khalu ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ ṣaṣ vikāram prakampitaḥ
translated: Then this great trichiliocosm shook in six ways.

original: SaSū atha khalu sarvaśūro bodhisattvo mahāsattvo yena bhagavāṃstenāṃjaliṃ praṇamya🔽bhagavantametadavocat ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo yadimānyevaṃrūpāṇi rājagṛhe
analyzed: atha khalu sarvaśūraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim praṇamya  bhagavantam etat avocat kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat imāni evaṃrūpāṇi rājagṛhe
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvaśūra, bowing with palms joined in the direction of the Blessed One,

original: mahānagare prātihāryāṇi /
analyzed: mahā nagare prātihāryāṇi
translated: said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, what is the cause, what is the reason, that such miracles are being seen in the great city of Rājagṛha?

original: sandṛśyante /
analyzed: sandṛśyante
translated: Why are they being seen?

original: bhagavān āha tadyathā kaścideva puruṣaḥ syāccañcalaścapalo 'haṃkāramamakārasthitaḥ
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat yathā kaścid eva puruṣaḥ syāt cañcalaḥ capalaḥ haṃkāra mamakāra sthitaḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, It is just as if there were a certain person who was fickle, unsteady, and remained in a state of egoism and possessiveness,

original: sa ca daridro bhavet tasya rājā śīrṣaṃ parimārjayedatha sa puruṣo 'dhimānādyāvādrājadvāraṃ
analyzed: sa ca daridraḥ bhavet tasya rājā śīrṣam parimārjayet atha sa puruṣaḥ
translated: And that poor man would become the king's head-anointed servant. Then that man, out of pride, would go to the king's gate from the sky,

original: gatvā balasā taṃ rājakulaṃ praveṣṭuṃ icchedatha te rājāmātyapārṣadyāstaṃ puruṣaṃ
analyzed: gatvā balasā tam rājakulam praveṣṭum icchet atha te rāja amātya pārṣadyāḥ tam puruṣam
translated: and out of strength would wish to enter that royal palace. Then those royal ministers and attendants would seize that man,

original: gṛhṇīyurbahubhiśca prakāraistāḍayeyur
analyzed: gṛhṇīyuḥ bahubhiḥ ca prakāraiḥ tāḍayeyuḥ
translated: and would beat him with many methods,

original: SaSū atha tena kālena tena samayena sa rājā śṛṇuyād etaṃ prakṛtiṃ sa daridrapuruṣo balasābhyantaraṃ praveṣṭukāma iti /
analyzed: atha tena kālena tena samayena sa rājā śṛṇuyāt etam prakṛtim sa daridra puruṣaḥ balasābhyantaram praveṣṭu kāmaḥ iti
translated: and at that time and at that moment that king would hear this report: That poor man wishes to enter by force.

original: śrutvā cāsyaivaṃ bhaved avaśyamayaṃ mama ghātayitukāmaḥ tataḥ sa rājā ruṣṭastān pārṣadyānevaṃ vaded gacchantu bhavanta etaṃ puruṣaṃ parvatavivaraṃ
analyzed: śrutvā ca asya evam bhavet avaśyam ayam mama ghātayitu kāmaḥ tatas sa rājā ruṣṭaḥ tān pārṣadyān evam vadet gacchantu bhavantaḥ etam puruṣam parvata vivaram
translated: And having heard it, he would think thus: He definitely wishes to kill me. Then that angry king would say to those attendants: Go, sirs, and having taken that man to a mountain cave,

original: nītvā jīvitādvyaparopayatha /
analyzed: nītvā jīvitāt vyaparopayatha
translated: deprive him of life.

original: sarvaparivāraṃ mātāpitṛputraduhitṛdāsīdāsakarmakarāṇāṃ ca vyasanamāpādayatha /
analyzed: sarva parivāram mātā pitṛ putra duhitṛ dāsī dāsa karmakarāṇām ca vyasanam āpādayatha
translated: And bring misfortune upon all his family, his mother, father, sons, daughters, male and female servants, and workers.

original: atha te sarve jīvitādvyavaropitāḥ tasya ca
analyzed: atha te sarve jīvitāt vyavaropitāḥ tasya ca
translated: Then all of them would be deprived of life, and

original: sarve svajanabandhuvargāḥ paramaśokaśalyasamarpitā bhaveyuḥ
analyzed: sarve sva jana bandhu vargāḥ parama śoka śalya samarpitāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: all his relatives and kinsmen would be filled with the utmost grief and pain.

original: SaSū evameva sarvaśūra tathāgato 'pyarhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sattvānān dharman deśayati /
analyzed: evam eva sarvaśūra tathāgataḥ pi arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sattvānān dharman deśayati
translated: In the same way, Sarva-shura, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, teaches the Dharma to beings.

original: tatra yathā sa puruṣo 'dhimānika evaṃ bālapṛthagjanāstathāgataṃ rūpavarṇaliṃgasaṃsthānato nimittamudgṛhya tathāgatakāyamiti saṃjānanti /
analyzed: tatra yathā sa puruṣaḥ dhimānikaḥ evam bāla pṛthagjanāḥ tathāgatam rūpa varṇa liṃga saṃsthānataḥ nimittam udgṛhya tathāgata kāyam iti saṃjānanti
translated: There, just as that conceited person, so the foolish ordinary people, having grasped the Tathagata as a sign of form, color, characteristics, and appearance, think This is the body of the Tathagata.

original: SaSū tatra te bahūn dharmaṃcchrutvādhimāne patanti nānāpralāpān pralapanti /
analyzed: tatra te bahūn dharman śrutvā adhimāne patanti nānā pralāpān pralapanti
translated: There, having heard many teachings, they fall into conceit and utter various babblings.

original: ahaṃkāramamakāreṇābhibhūtāḥ sattvāḥ
analyzed: ahaṃkāra mamakāreṇa abhibhūtāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: Beings, overcome by the notion of 'I' and 'mine',

original: svayameva dharmaṃ na śṛṇvanti na prakāśayanti /
analyzed: svayam eva dharmam na śṛṇvanti na prakāśayanti
translated: do not listen to the Dharma themselves and do not proclaim it.

original: yaḥ kaścit sūtraṃ vā gāthāṃ vāntaśo dṛṣṭāntaṃ vā teṣāṃ ārocayati /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid sūtram vā gāthām vā antaśas dṛṣṭāntam vā teṣām ārocayati
translated: Whoever teaches them a sutra, a verse, or even an example,

original: tatte na gṛhṇanti na śrotramavadadhanti /
analyzed: tat te na gṛhṇanti na śrotram avadadhanti
translated: they do not accept it, do not lend an ear.

original: vayaṃ svayaṃ jānīmaha iti /
analyzed: vayam svayam jānīmahe iti
translated: We know for ourselves.

original: tatkasya hetoryathāpīdamadhimānatvātte ca bāhuśrutyena pramādamāpadyante /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ yathā api idam adhimāna tvāt te ca bāhuśrutyena pramādam āpadyante
translated: What is the reason for this? It is because of their conceit that they become negligent due to their great learning.

original: SaSū ye bālapṛthagjanaiḥ sārdhaṃ samavadhānaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: ye bāla pṛthagjanaiḥ sārdham samavadhānam kurvanti
translated: Those who associate with the foolish ordinary people,

original: na te tathārūpaṃ dharmopasaṃhitaṃ vacanaṃ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: na te tathārūpam dharma upasaṃhitam vacanam śroṣyanti
translated: They will not hear such Dharma-related speech.

original: tettena bāhuśrutyena pramattā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: te id tena bāhuśrutyena pramattāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be heedless because of that great learning.

original: te tathārūpāḥ puruṣāḥ svakāvyāni sthāpayanti /
analyzed: te tathārūpāḥ puruṣāḥ sva kāvyāni sthāpayanti
translated: Those people will establish their own compositions.

original: svagranthāni dānāni sthāpayanti /
analyzed: sva granthāni dānāni sthāpayanti
translated: They will establish their own texts as gifts.

original: te sarvalokaṃ cātmānaṃ ca visaṃpādayanti /
analyzed: te sarva lokam ca ātmānam ca visaṃpādayanti
translated: They will deceive the whole world and themselves.

original: vyarthaṃ ca rāṣṭrapiṇḍaṃ prabhūtaṃ paribhokṣyanti /
analyzed: vyartham ca rāṣṭra piṇḍam prabhūtam paribhokṣyanti
translated: They will consume the country's alms in vain, in great quantity.

original: bhuktvā ca na samyak pariṇamayiṣyaṃti /
analyzed: bhuktvā ca na samyak pariṇamayiṣyanti
translated: Having consumed it, they will not digest it properly.

original: maraṇakālasamaye ca teṣāṃ mahāsantrāso bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: maraṇa kāla samaye ca teṣām mahā santrāsaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: At the time of death, they will have great fear.

original: SaSū te ca sattvāstaṃ vakṣyanti /
analyzed: te ca sattvāḥ tam vakṣyanti
translated: And those beings will say to him:

original: bahavastvayā vayaṃ śilpajñānaṃ śikṣāpitāḥ kathaṃ tvaṃ svamātmānaṃ na śaknuṣe parisaṃsthāpayituṃ /
analyzed: bahavaḥ tvayā vayam śilpa jñānam śikṣāpitāḥ katham tvam svam ātmānam na śaknuṣe parisaṃsthāpayitum
translated: 'You have taught us many crafts and skills. Why can you not now establish yourself?'

original: sa teṣāṃ evaṃ vadenna śakyaṃ mārṣā idānīmātmānaṃ parisaṃsthāpayituṃ /
analyzed: sa teṣām evam vadet na śakyam mārṣāḥ idānīm ātmānam parisaṃsthāpayitum
translated: He will say to them, 'Friends, it is not possible for me to establish myself now.'

original: SaSū tatra te sattvāstasya tadbhāṣitaṃ śrutvā
analyzed: tatra te sattvāḥ tasya tat bhāṣitam śrutvā
translated: Then those beings, having heard his words,

original: nānāprakāraṃ paridevayiṣyanti /
analyzed: nānā prakāram paridevayiṣyanti
translated: will lament in various ways.

original: yathā tasyaikapudgalasyarthena bahavo jñatṛsaṃghā jīvitādvyavaropitā anaparādhinaḥ svakarmapratyayena /
analyzed: yathā tasya eka pudgalasya arthena bahavaḥ jñatṛ saṃghāḥ jīvitāt vyavaropitāḥ anaparādhinaḥ sva karma pratyayena
translated: Just as for the sake of that one person, many innocent assemblies of knowers were deprived of life by the power of their own karma.

original: evameva te sattvā maraṇakālasamaye teṣāṃ paridevatāṃ narakatiryagyoniparāyaṇaṃ ātmānaṃ
analyzed: evam eva te sattvāḥ maraṇa kāla samaye teṣām paridevatām naraka tiryagyoni parāyaṇam ātmānam
translated: In the same way, those beings, at the time of death, seeing themselves lamenting, going to the hells, animal wombs, or the realm of hungry ghosts,

original: samanupaśyantaḥ akalyāṇamitrahetoḥ evameva yuṣmākaṃ brāhmaṇānāmanyatīrthikacarakaparibrājakanigranthānāmevaṃ vadāmi /
analyzed: samanupaśyantaḥ akalyāṇa mitra hetoḥ evam eva yuṣmākam brāhmaṇānām anya tīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigranthānām evam vadāmi
translated: due to the cause of bad friends, I say the same to you Brahmins, non-Buddhists, doctors, wandering mendicants, and Jains.

original: mā yūyaṃ pramattā bhavathaḥ tadyathāpināmājātapakṣaḥ śakunirna śaknotyākāśe prakramituṃ devalokagamanāya /
analyzed: mā yūyam pramattāḥ bhavathaḥ tat yathā api nāma ajāta pakṣaḥ śakuniḥ na śaknoti ākāśe prakramitum deva loka gamanāya
translated: Do not be heedless, just as a bird with unfledged wings is unable to fly in the sky to go to the world of the gods.

original: evameva yuṣmābhirahaṃkāramamakārasthitair
analyzed: evam eva yuṣmābhiḥ ahaṃkāra mamakāra sthitaiḥ
translated: In the same way, you who abide in the notions of 'I' and 'mine,'

original: na śakyaṃ nirvāṇaṃ anuprāptuṃ na yuṣmākaṃ tathā ṛddhiḥ saṃvidyate /
analyzed: na śakyam nirvāṇam anuprāptum na yuṣmākam tathā ṛddhiḥ saṃvidyate
translated: it is not possible for you to attain nirvana, you do not have such spiritual power.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ karmaprakaraṇena yūyaṃ kukkuṭayonyā ivotpannāḥ na cireṇāyaṃ kāyo bhedanadharmā maraṇaparyavasāno bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ karma prakaraṇena yūyam kukkuṭa yonyāḥ iva utpannāḥ na cireṇa ayam kāyaḥ bhedana dharmā maraṇa paryavasānaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Why is that? By the power of karma, you have been born like a chicken, and this body will soon be subject to destruction, ending in death.

original: maraṇakālasamaye nirāsvādanatā paritasyanatā ca bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: maraṇa kāla samaye nirāsvādana tā paritasyana tā ca bhaviṣyati
translated: At the time of death, there will be a lack of enjoyment and anxiety.

original: SaSū kimayaṃ asmābhirātmabhāvaḥ sandhārito ye vayaṃ na devasukhaṃ na manuṣyalokasukhaṃ pratyanubhaviṣyāma /
analyzed: kim ayam asmābhiḥ ātmabhāvaḥ sandhāritaḥ ye vayam na deva sukham na manuṣya loka sukham pratyanubhaviṣyāma
translated: What is the use of this body that we have maintained, since we will not experience the happiness of the gods or the happiness of the human world?

original: nāpi nirvāṇapadasthā bhaviṣyāma /
analyzed: na api nirvāṇa pada sthāḥ bhaviṣyāma
translated: Nor will we attain the state of nirvana.

original: nirarthakamasmābhiḥ śarīramudbūḍhaṃ /🔽kā gatirasmābhiḥ kaḥ parāyaṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: nirarthakam asmābhiḥ śarīram udbūḍham  kā gatiḥ asmābhiḥ kaḥ parāyaṇam bhaviṣyati
translated: Our body has been raised in vain.

original: kutropapattiḥ kutra vā
analyzed: kutra upapattiḥ kutra vā
translated: What is our destination? What will be our refuge? Where will we be reborn?

original: nirodho bhaviṣyati /🔽SaSū atha khalu🔽bhagavāṃspunarapi
analyzed: nirodhaḥ bhaviṣyati  atha khalu  bhagavān punar api
translated: Where will there be cessation?

original: teṣāṃ anyatīrthikacarakaparibrājakanigranthabrāhmaṇānamantrayati /
analyzed: teṣām anya tīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigrantha brāhmaṇān āmantrayati
translated: Then the Blessed One again addressed those non-Buddhist ascetics, naked ascetics, and brahmins:

original: mā yūyaṃ mārṣā ratnamayājjaṃbūdvīpānnirāśā bhaviṣyadhve /
analyzed: mā yūyam mārṣāḥ ratna mayāt jaṃbūdvīpāt nirāśāḥ bhaviṣyadhve
translated: Do not, friends, be disappointed in this Jambudvipa, which is made of jewels.

original: mā yāyaṃ dharmaratnāt paribāhyā bhaviṣyatheti /
analyzed: mā yāyam dharma ratnāt paribāhyāḥ bhaviṣyatha iti
translated: Do not be excluded from this jewel of the Dharma.

original: pṛcchatha yūyaṃ mārṣāstathāgataṃ yadyadevākāṃkṣathāhaṃ yuṣmākaṃ sarvābhiprāyān paripūrayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: pṛcchatha yūyam mārṣāḥ tathāgatam yat yat eva ākāṃkṣatha aham yuṣmākam sarva abhiprāyān paripūrayiṣyāmi
translated: Friends, ask the Tathagata whatever you wish. I will fulfill all your intentions.

original: SaSū atha khalu te sarve brāhmaṇānyatīrthikacarakaparibrājakanigranthā utthāyāsanebhyaḥ ekāṃsāni cīvarāṇi pravṛtyāṃjalayaḥ pragṛhya bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu te sarve brāhmaṇāḥ anya tīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigranthāḥ utthāya āsanebhyaḥ eka aṃsāni cīvarāṇi pravṛtya aṃjalayaḥ pragṛhya bhagavantam
translated: Then all those Brahmins, non-Buddhists, physicians, wandering mendicants, and Jains rose from their seats, draped their upper robes over one shoulder, placed their palms together, and said to the Blessed One:

original: paripṛcchanti sma /
analyzed: paripṛcchanti sma
translated: Then all those Brahmins, non-Buddhists, physicians, wandering mendicants, and Jains rose from their seats, draped their upper robes over one shoulder, placed their palms together, and asked the Blessed One:

original: bahūni bhagavaṃ sattvāni rātrindivastathāgataḥ saṃsārā parimocayati /
analyzed: bahūni bhagavan sattvāni rātrindivaḥ tathāgataḥ saṃsārā parimocayati
translated: Blessed One, many beings are liberated from saṃsāra by the Tathāgata day and night.

original: na ca sattvadhātorūnatvaṃ vā pūrṇatvaṃ vā prajñāyate /
analyzed: na ca sattvadhātoḥ ūna tvam vā pūrṇa tvam vā prajñāyate
translated: Yet the realm of beings is not seen to decrease or increase.

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yatte sattvā samānā utpādanirodhaṃ darśayanti ////
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat te sattvā samānāḥ utpāda nirodham darśayanti
translated: Blessed One, what is the cause and what is the condition for those beings, who are the same, to demonstrate arising and cessation?

original: saṃghāṭe mahādharmaparyāye sarvaśūraparipṛcchā samāptā // ////
analyzed: saṃghāṭe mahā dharmaparyāye sarva śūra paripṛcchā samāptā
translated: In the great Dharma discourse called Saṃghata, the questions of Sarvaśūra are concluded.

original: IV / bhaiṣajyasenaparipṛcchā /
analyzed: iv bhaiṣajyasena paripṛcchā
translated: Chapter IV: The Questions of Bhaiṣajyasena

original: SaSū tatra khalu bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamāmantrayati sma /
analyzed: tatra khalu bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āmantrayati sma
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajyasena:

original: mahāsannāhaṃ sannahyanti tīrthyā /
analyzed: mahā sannāham sannahyanti tīrthyā
translated: The tīrthikas put on the great armor.

original: mahākaukṛtyavinodanārthāya /
analyzed: mahā kaukṛtya vinodana arthāya
translated: In order to dispel great remorse,

original: mahādharmolkājvālanāya /
analyzed: mahā dharma ulkā jvālanāya
translated: to ignite the great Dharma torch,

original: mahāpraśnanidānaṃ paripṛcchanti /
analyzed: mahāpraśna nidānam paripṛcchanti
translated: they ask the great question.

original: śṛṇutha yūyaṃ kulaputrā ihānantāparyanta pṛthivīdhāturabdhātustejodhāturvāyudhāturato nāṃtataraḥ sattvadhātuḥ santi ca sattvāḥ ye sattvahitārthamutpādanirodhaṃ
analyzed: śṛṇutha yūyam kula putrāḥ pṛthivī dhātuḥ ap dhātuḥ tejaḥ dhātuḥ vāyu dhātuḥ atas na aṃtataraḥ sattvadhātuḥ santi ca sattvāḥ ye sattva hita artham utpāda nirodham
translated: Listen, you sons of noble family! Here, the realm of earth is infinite, the realm of water is infinite, the realm of fire is infinite, and the realm of wind is infinite. Even more infinite is the realm of beings. There are beings who, for the sake of the welfare of beings, will bring about origination and cessation.

original: paścime tu kāle bhaviṣyanti daharā sattvā vṛddhā vā ye utpādanirodhaṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: paścime tu kāle bhaviṣyanti sattvāḥ vṛddhāḥ vā ye utpāda nirodham kariṣyanti
translated: But in the later times, there will be young beings or old beings who will bring about origination and cessation.

original: santi bhaiṣajyasena vṛddhā sattvā daharā iva na kiṃcijjānanti /
analyzed: santi bhaiṣajyasena sattvāḥ daharāḥ iva na kiṃcid jānanti
translated: There are, O Bhaiṣajyasena, old beings who know nothing, like young ones.

original: SaSū tadyathāpi nāma bhaiṣajyasena kaścideva puruṣaḥ śiraṃ śocayeta navakāni ca vastrāṇi pravṛṇuyāt sa ca gṛhādbahirniṣkrameta /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhaiṣajyasena kaścid eva puruṣaḥ śiram śocayeta navakāni ca vastrāṇi pravṛṇuyāt sa ca gṛhāt bahis niṣkrameta
translated: For example, O Bhaiṣajyasena, suppose some man would anoint his head and put on new clothes, and he would go out of his house.

original: tamenaṃ sattvā āmantrayanti /
analyzed: tam enam sattvāḥ āmantrayanti
translated: Then other beings would say to him:

original: suprāvṛtāni te navakāni vastrāṇīti /
analyzed: su prāvṛtāni te navakāni vastrāṇi iti
translated: You have put on your new clothes very well.

original: atha kaścidevāparaḥ sattvo bhavet sa śiraḥ śocayeta purāṇakāni ca vastrāṇi śocayitvā🔽prāvṛṇuyāt tāni ca śithilakāni bhavanti na ca śobhante /
analyzed: atha kaścid eva aparaḥ sattvaḥ bhavet sa śiraḥ śocayeta purāṇakāni ca vastrāṇi śocayitvā  prāvṛṇuyāt tāni ca śithilakāni bhavanti na ca śobhante
translated: Then suppose there were another being who would anoint his head and put on old clothes,🔽which would be loose and not look good.

original: sa ca puruṣaḥ susnātaśirā bhavati vastraṃ cāsya na śobhate /
analyzed: sa ca puruṣaḥ su snāta śirāḥ bhavati vastram ca asya na śobhate
translated: And that man would have his head well-bathed, but his clothes would not look good.

original: evameva bhaiṣajyasena saṃti vṛddhā sattvā ye jaṃbūdvīpaṃ na śobhayanti /
analyzed: evam eva bhaiṣajyasena saṃti vṛddhā sattvāḥ ye jaṃbūdvīpam na śobhayanti
translated: In the same way, Bhesajyasena, there are old beings who do not beautify Jambudvīpa.

original: daharāstu sattvā utpādanirodhaṃ darśayanti /
analyzed: daharāḥ tu sattvāḥ utpāda nirodham darśayanti
translated: But young beings demonstrate arising and cessation.

original: SaSū atha khalu te sarve 'nyatīrthikacarakaparibrājakanigranthabrāhmaṇā utthāyasanād
analyzed: sasū atha khalu te sarve nyatīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigrantha brāhmaṇāḥ uttha āyasanāt
translated: Then all those non-Buddhist practitioners, mendicants, and brahmins rose from their seats

original: bhagavantametadavocan ko bhagavannasmākaṃ vṛddho vā daharo vā bhagavān āha vṛddhā
analyzed: bhagavantam etat avocan kaḥ bhagavan asmākam vṛddhaḥ vā daharaḥ vā bhagavān āha vṛddhā
translated: and said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, who among us is old and who is young? The Blessed One said, You are old

original: yūyaṃ punaḥ punarnarakatiryakpreteṣu duḥkhāṃ vedanāṃ dṛṣṭvā tadadyāpi yūyaṃ tṛptiṃ nādhigacchatha /
analyzed: yūyam punar punar naraka tiryak preteṣu duḥkhām vedanām dṛṣṭvā tat adya api yūyam tṛptim na adhigacchatha
translated: but still you do not attain satisfaction, having seen the suffering of hell, animals, and hungry ghosts again and again.

original: SaSū atha khalu te sarve brāhmaṇānyatīrthikacarakaparibrājakanigranthāḥ sarve
analyzed: atha khalu te sarve brāhmaṇa anya tīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigranthāḥ sarve
translated: Then all those brahmins, non-Buddhist practitioners, mendicants, and brahmins,

original: ca nāgarājāno bhagavantametadavocan na bhūyo bhagavannutsahāma saṃsāre duḥkhāṃ🔽vedanāmanubhavituṃ te cānyatīrthikacarakaparibrājakanigranthabrāhmaṇā evamāhuḥ na
analyzed: ca nāga rājānaḥ bhagavantam etat avocan na bhūyas bhagavan utsahāma saṃsāre duḥkhām  vedanām anubhavitum te ca anya tīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigrantha brāhmaṇāḥ evam āhuḥ na
translated: and all the nāga kings said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, we no longer have the courage to experience suffering

original: santi daharā sattvā ye śaknuyurdharmatāṃ sākṣāt kartum //
analyzed: santi sattvāḥ ye śaknuyuḥ dharmatām sākṣāt kartum
translated: in saṃsāra. And those non-Buddhist practitioners, mendicants, and brahmins said, There are no young beings who could realize the truth.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃjīva said this to the Blessed One:

original: paśya bhadanta bhagavan kiyadduradhimocyā ime sattvāḥ bhagavān āha śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena
analyzed: paśya bhadanta bhagavan kiyat duradhimocyāḥ ime sattvāḥ bhagavān āha śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena
translated: Look, Venerable Blessed One, how difficult it is for these beings to understand. The Blessed One said, Listen, Bhaiṣajya-saṃjīva.

original: saṃprataṃ tathāgataḥ sarvalokapratyakṣaṃ karoti /
analyzed: saṃpratam tathāgataḥ sarva loka pratyakṣam karoti
translated: Right now the Tathāgata is making himself directly perceptible to the whole world.

original: SaSū atha khalu catunavati koṭīsahasrāṇi navakānāṃ sattvānāṃ te tathāgatasya purataḥ sthitāḥ na ca tathāgataṃ bandanti nālapanti na saṃlapanti
analyzed: atha khalu catunavati koṭī sahasrāṇi navakānām sattvānām te tathāgatasya puratas sthitāḥ na ca tathāgatam bandanti na ālapanti na saṃlapanti
translated: Then ninety-four koṭi-s of young beings stood in front of the Tathāgata, but they did not bow to the Tathāgata, they did not speak, they did not converse.

original: tūṣṇīṃbhāvenādhivāsayanti /
analyzed: tūṣṇīṃbhāvena adhivāsayanti
translated: They remained silent.

original: atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat ko bhagavan
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat  kaḥ bhagavan
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃjīva said this to the Blessed One: What is the cause, Blessed One,

original: hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo yadete sattvā bhagavantaṃ nālapanti na saṃlapanti na vandanti
analyzed: hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat ete sattvāḥ bhagavantam na ālapanti na saṃlapanti na vandanti
translated: what is the condition, that these beings do not speak to the Blessed One, do not converse with him, do not bow to him,

original: na ca bhagavantaṃ paripṛcchanti /
analyzed: na ca bhagavantam paripṛcchanti
translated: and do not ask the Blessed One questions?

original: bhagavān āha śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena ye sattvā evaṃ vadanti na śakyaṃ navakaiḥ sattvairdharmatā sākṣāt kartum //
analyzed: bhagavān āha śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena ye sattvāḥ evam vadanti na śakyam navakaiḥ sattvaiḥ dharmatā sākṣāt kartum
translated: The Blessed One said, Listen, Bhaiṣajya-saṃjīva. Those beings who say, 'It is not possible for young beings to directly realize the nature of dharmas,'

original: ta ete bhaiṣajyasena navakāḥ sattvā yuṣmābhirdraṣṭavyāḥ te ca sattvā evaṃ āhurvayaṃ bhadanta bhagavan navakāḥ sattvā vayaṃ bhadanta sugata
analyzed: te ete bhaiṣajyasena navakāḥ sattvāḥ yuṣmābhiḥ draṣṭavyāḥ te ca sattvāḥ evam āhuḥ vayam bhadanta bhagavat navakāḥ sattvāḥ vayam bhadanta sugata
translated: Those beings said, Venerable Blessed One, we are new beings. Venerable Well-Gone One,

original: navakāḥ sattvā /
analyzed: navakāḥ sattvāḥ
translated: we are new beings.

original: bhagavān āha eṣāṃ bho sattvānāṃ lokapratyakṣaṃ sāṃprataṃ svaśarīrāllokasya pramānaṃ darśayatha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha eṣām bho sattvānām loka pratyakṣam sāṃpratam sva śarīrāt lokasya pramānam darśayatha
translated: The Blessed One said, You beings, now in the present world, should show the world the measure of your own bodies.

original: SaSū tena khalu punaḥ kālena tena samayena caturnavati koṭīsahasrāṇi navakānāṃ🔽sattvānāṃ kāyasya bhedādantarikṣe sthitvā daśabhūmipratilabdhā abhūvan atha khalu🔽bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat sulabdhā lābhā bhagavannīdṛśāḥ
analyzed: tena khalu punar kālena tena samayena caturnavati koṭī sahasrāṇi navakānām  sattvānām kāyasya bhedāt antarikṣe sthitvā daśa bhūmi pratilabdhāḥ abhūvan atha khalu  bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat su labdhāḥ lābhāḥ bhagavan īdṛśāḥ
translated: Then at that time, ninety-four koṭi-s of thousands of new beings,

original: sattvāḥ ye saṃsāre parikṣayāya paryadānāya vīryamārabhante /
analyzed: sattvāḥ ye saṃsāre parikṣayāya paryadānāya vīryam ārabhante
translated: having split their bodies, stood in the sky and attained the ten grounds. Then the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-senā said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, those beings who exert vigor for the destruction and exhaustion of saṃsāra have gained a great gain.

original: adyaiva bhagavannime sattvā utpannāḥ adyaiva bhagavannime sattvāḥ parimuktāḥ adyaiva
analyzed: adyā eva bhagavan ime sattvāḥ utpannāḥ adyā eva bhagavan ime sattvāḥ parimuktāḥ adyā eva
translated: Blessed One, these beings were born today, Blessed One, these beings were liberated today, Blessed One,

original: sarve daśabhūmipratiṣṭhitā dṛṣṭāḥ //
analyzed: sarve daśa bhūmi pratiṣṭhitāḥ dṛṣṭāḥ
translated: all of them were seen established in the ten grounds.

original: SaSū atha khalu sarvabrāhmaṇānyatīrthikacarakaparibrājakanigranthā nāgarājāno 'pi mārāśca pāpīyānaṃ saparivāraṃ upasaṃkrāntaṃ vicakṣuṣkaraṇāya /
analyzed: atha khalu sarva brāhmaṇāni atīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigranthāḥ nāga rājānaḥ pi mārāḥ ca pāpīyānam sa parivāram upasaṃkrāntam vicakṣuṣkaraṇāya
translated: Then all the Brahmins, non-Buddhists, physicians, wandering mendicants, Jains, Naga kings, and Mara the evil one, together with his retinue, approached to have their eyes opened.

original: sarve ca te bhagavantametadavocanniha vayaṃ bhagavan tathāgatasyāntikamupasaṃkrāntā vicakṣuṣkaraṇāya /
analyzed: sarve ca te bhagavantam etat avocan iha vayam bhagavan tathāgatasya antikam upasaṃkrāntāḥ vicakṣuṣkaraṇāya
translated: And they all said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, we have come here to the Tathagata to have our eyes opened.

original: te vayaṃ bhagavanniman dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvā prasādapratilabdhā abhūvan buddhe ca dharme ca /
analyzed: te vayam bhagavan iman dharmaparyāyam śrutvā prasāda pratilabdhāḥ abhūvan buddhe ca dharme ca
translated: Blessed One, having heard this Dharma discourse, we have attained faith in the Buddha and the Dharma.

original: tatrāsmākaṃ bhagavan sarveṣāṃ evaṃ bhagavatyevaṃrūpaṃ buddhasukhaṃ pratilabhema / //
analyzed: tatra asmākam bhagavan sarveṣām evam bhagavati evaṃrūpam buddha sukham pratilabhema
translated: Blessed One, may we all attain such Buddha bliss in the Blessed One.

original: evaṃrūpāśca tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā loke bhavema /
analyzed: evaṃrūpāḥ ca tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ loke bhavema
translated: May we become such Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones in the world.

original: SaSū bhagavān āhaivametadbhadramukhā evametadyathā yūyaṃ tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyāntikamupasaṃkrāntāḥ tairyuṣmābhirimaṃ saṃghāṭaṃ
analyzed: bhagavān āha evam etat bhadra mukhāḥ evam etat yathā yūyam tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya antikam upasaṃkrāntāḥ taiḥ yuṣmābhiḥ imam saṃghāṭam
translated: The Blessed One said, Good sirs, it is so, it is so, just as you have come to the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: dharmaparyāyaṃ śrutvānuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheścittānyutpāditāni /
analyzed: dharmaparyāyam śrutvā anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ cittāni utpāditāni
translated: Having heard this Dharma discourse on the Collection of the Aggregates, you have generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tena yūyaṃ bhadramukhāḥ kuśalamūlena na cireṇa kālenānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbhotsyadhve /
analyzed: tena yūyam bhadra mukhāḥ kuśala mūlena na cireṇa kālena anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyadhve
translated: By that root of merit, you will, O good faces, in no long time, attain the highest complete enlightenment.

original: atha samantarabhāṣitā ca bhagavateyaṃ vāg
analyzed: atha samantara bhāṣitā ca bhagavatā iyam vāc
translated: Then, immediately after the Blessed One spoke these words,

original: SaSū atha tāvadeva teṣāṃ sarveṣāmanyatīrthikacarakaparibrājakanigranthabrāhmaṇānāmanutpattikadharmakṣāntipraitlabdho
analyzed: atha tāvat eva teṣām sarveṣām anya tīrthika caraka paribrājaka nigrantha brāhmaṇānām anutpattikadharmakṣāntipraitlabdhaḥ
translated: all those non-Buddhist ascetics, naked ascetics, and brahmins attained receptivity to the non-arising of dharmas,

original: 'bhūvat sarve ca daśabhūmipratiṣṭhitā bodhisattvāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ sarve ca te bodhisattvā
analyzed: bhū vat sarve ca daśa bhūmi pratiṣṭhitāḥ bodhisattvāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ sarve ca te bodhisattvāḥ
translated: and all of them became established on the ten grounds, and all those bodhisattvas

original: uparyantarīkṣe sapta tālān vaihāyasamabhyudgamya saptaratnamayāni kūṭāgārāṇi tathāgatasyopanāmayanti /
analyzed: upari antarīkṣe sapta tālān vaihāyasam abhyudgamya sapta ratna mayāni kūṭāgārāṇi tathāgatasya upanāmayanti
translated: rose up into the sky above to the height of seven palm trees and offered to the Thus-Gone One palaces made of the seven precious substances.

original: sarve ca nānāvikurvādhiṣṭhānardhyabhisaṃkārān abhisaṃskurvanti /
analyzed: sarve ca nānā vikurva adhiṣṭhāna ṛdhi abhisaṃkārān abhisaṃskurvanti
translated: And all of them manifested various miraculous transformations and blessings.

original: atha tāvadeva te sarve bhagavata uparimūrdhni sthitvā bhagavantaṃ nānāpuṣpairabhyavakiranti /
analyzed: atha tāvat eva te sarve bhagavataḥ upari mūrdhni sthitvā bhagavantam nānā puṣpaiḥ abhyavakiranti
translated: Then, immediately, all of them, standing above the Blessed One's head, scattered various flowers upon the Blessed One,

original: tathāgatāṃśca manasi kurvanti /
analyzed: tathāgatān ca manasi kurvanti
translated: and they kept the Thus-Gone Ones in mind.

original: svakāye ca buddhasaṃjñāmutpādayantyanekāni ca devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi divyapuṣpSaSū ais
analyzed: sva kāye ca buddha saṃjñām utpādayanti anekāni ca devaputra koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi divya puṣpsasū ais
translated: And they generate the perception of the Buddha in their own bodies. Many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devas scatter divine flowers, incense,

original: tathāgatamabhyavakiranti smaḥ /
analyzed: tathāgatam abhyavakiranti smaḥ
translated: perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, garments, parasols, banners, and flags over the Tathāgata.

original: SaSū evaṃ ca vācamabhāśanta /🔽mahālābhaḥ śramaṇo gautamaḥ mahākṣetraṃ lokanāthaḥ samādhibalādhānaprāptaḥ vijño🔽vijñārthikaḥ yaḥ īdṛśān sattvān saṃsārādanupūrveṇopāyakauśalyena parimocayatyekena🔽subhāṣitamātreṇa etāvanti sattvāni saṃsārāt parimucyante //🔽SaSū atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattva utthāyāsanādekāṃsamuttarāsaṃgaṃ
analyzed: evam ca vācam abhāśanta  mahālābhaḥ śramaṇaḥ gautamaḥ mahā kṣetram loka nāthaḥ samādhi bala ādhāna prāptaḥ vijño  vijña arthikaḥ yaḥ īdṛśān sattvān saṃsārāt anupūrveṇa upāya kauśalyena parimocayati ekena  su bhāṣita mātreṇa etāvanti sattvāni saṃsārāt parimucyante  atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṃgam
translated: And they speak these words:

original: kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃs tenāṃjaliṃ praṇamya🔽bhagavantametadavocat ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo ya eta devaputrā evaṃ vānniścārayanti /🔽bahūni cardhyabhisaṃskāraṃ kurvanti /
