original: bahubhiśca guṇavarṇastavaistathāgatamabhistavanti sma /
analyzed: bahubhiḥ ca guṇa varṇa stavaiḥ tathāgatam abhistavanti sma
translated: and with many praises of qualities and eulogies, they praised the Tathāgata.

original: bhagavān āha śṛṇu kulaputra na hi te māṃ stunvanti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha śṛṇu kula putra na hi te mām stunvanti
translated: The Blessed One said, Listen, son of noble family! They do not praise me,

original: svakāyameva stunvanti /🔽svakāyameva dharmarājāsane sthāpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: sva kāyam eva stunvanti  sva kāyam eva dharmarāja āsane sthāpayiṣyanti
translated: but they praise their own bodies.🔽They will establish their own bodies on the Dharma throne of a Dharma king.

original: svakāyamevagradharmāsane pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyanti /
analyzed: sva kāyam eva gra dharma āsane pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyanti
translated: They will establish their own bodies on the Dharma throne of the foremost Dharma.

original: svakāyādeva dharmaraśmin niścārayiṣyanti /
analyzed: sva kāyāt eva dharmaraśmin niścārayiṣyanti
translated: They will emit the rays of Dharma from their own bodies.

original: sarvabuddhaparigṛhītāśca bhaviṣyantyanuttarāsyāḥ samyaksaṃbodherabhisaṃbodhāyābhisaṃbudhya ca dharman deśayiṣyanti ca //
analyzed: sarva buddha parigṛhītāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti anuttarā asyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ abhisaṃbodhāya abhisaṃbudhya ca dharman deśayiṣyanti ca
translated: They will be accepted by all the Buddhas, for the sake of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. Having attained perfect enlightenment, they will teach the Dharma.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃgha said this to the Blessed One:

original: bahavo bhadanta bhagavan sattvāḥ bahavo bhadanta sugataḥ sattvā rātrindivaṃ parimucyante
analyzed: bahavaḥ bhadanta bhagavan sattvāḥ bahavaḥ bhadanta sugataḥ sattvāḥ rātrindivam parimucyante
translated: Blessed One, many beings, Blessed One, many beings, Sugata, are being liberated day and night,

original: tadadyāpi sattvānāṃ kṣayo na bhavati /
analyzed: tat adya api sattvānām kṣayaḥ na bhavati
translated: yet still the end of beings is not reached.

original: bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu bhaiṣajyasena yastvaṃ tathāgatametamarthaṃ paripraṣṭavyaṃ manyase /
analyzed: bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu bhaiṣajyasena yaḥ tvam tathāgatam etam artham paripraṣṭavyam manyase
translated: The Blessed One said, Excellent, excellent, Bhaiṣajya-saṃgha, that you think to ask the Tathāgata about this matter.

original: śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena tadyathāpi nāma bhaiṣajyasena kaścideva puruṣo bhavedāḍhyo mahādhano
analyzed: śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena tat yathā api nāma bhaiṣajyasena kaścid eva puruṣaḥ bhavet āḍhyaḥ mahā dhanaḥ
translated: Listen, Bhaiṣajyasena, it is just as, for example, Bhaiṣajyasena, some man would be wealthy, of great wealth,

original: mahābhogaḥ prabhūtabhogaḥ bahudhanadhānyakośakoṣṭhāgārasamanvāgataḥ bahudāsadāsīkarmakarapauruṣeyāni
analyzed: mahā bhogaḥ prabhūta bhogaḥ bahu dhana dhānya kośa koṣṭhāgāra samanvāgataḥ bahu dāsa dāsī karmakara pauruṣeyāni
translated: of great enjoyment, of many enjoyments, endowed with much wealth, grain, treasure, and storehouses, with many male and female slaves, servants, and workmen,

original: cāsya syuḥ bahūni ca dhanaskandhāni bhaveyuḥ bahūni ca kṣetrārāmāṇi saṃvidyeran bahūni ca dhanadhānyāni /
analyzed: ca asya syuḥ bahūni ca dhana skandhāni bhaveyuḥ bahūni ca kṣetra ārāmāṇi saṃvidyeran bahūni ca dhana dhānyāni
translated: and he would have many great stores of wealth, and he would have many fields and parks, and he would have much wealth and grain,

original: tadyathā yavagodhumaśālitilamāṣamudgādīni sa ca puruṣo vasantakāle sarvāni tāni dhanadhānyāni vāpayeta /
analyzed: tat yathā yava godhuma śāli tila māṣa mudga ādīni sa ca puruṣaḥ vasanta kāle sarvāni tāni dhana dhānyāni vāpayeta
translated: such as barley, wheat, rice, sesame, beans, and lentils, and that man in the spring season would sow all those wealth and grain,

original: atha yāvadapareṇa kālasamayena sarvāṇi tāni dhanadhānyāni paripadyaran sa paripakvānīti viditvā sa yāvadabhyantaragṛhe praveśayeta /
analyzed: atha yāvat apareṇa kāla samayena sarvāṇi tāni dhana dhānyāni sa paripakvāni iti viditvā sa yāvat abhyantara gṛhe praveśayeta
translated: and then after some time all those wealth and grain would ripen, and knowing that they are ripe, he would bring them inside the house.

original: sa puruṣastāni dhanadhānyāni gṛhasyābhyantare pṛthak pṛthak sthāpayati /
analyzed: sa puruṣaḥ tāni dhana dhānyāni gṛhasya abhyantare pṛthak pṛthak sthāpayati
translated: That man would keep those wealth and grain separately inside the house.

original: sthāpayitvā paribhuṃkte /
analyzed: sthāpayitvā paribhuṃkte
translated: Having kept them, he would enjoy them.

original: yāvadvasantakāle samaye
analyzed: yāvat vasanta kāle samaye
translated: And so on, in the spring season,

original: punareva tāni bījāni vāpayati /
analyzed: punar eva tāni bījāni vāpayati
translated: he would again sow those seeds.

original: SaSū evameva bhaiṣajyasena ime sattvāḥ pūrvaṃ śubhaṃ karma kṛtvā paścāt teṣāṃ karmaṇāṃ parikṣayāt punaḥ punarapi puṇyakṣetrameṣante kuśalamūlānyavaropayanti
analyzed: evam eva bhaiṣajyasena ime sattvāḥ pūrvam śubham karma kṛtvā paścāt teṣām karmaṇām parikṣayāt punar punar api puṇya kṣetram eṣante kuśala mūlāni avaropayanti
translated: Bhaiṣajya-senā, it is just like this: these beings, having first done good actions, then, due to the exhaustion of those actions, again and again seek a field of merit, and plant roots of goodness.

original: kuśalamūlānyavaropayitvā tatra ca kuśaladharme pratipatya saṃpādayanti /
analyzed: kuśala mūlāni avaropayitvā tatra ca kuśala dharme pratipatya saṃpādayanti
translated: Having planted roots of goodness, they practice in accordance with those wholesome dharmas.

original: pratipattisaṃpannā sarvadharmān vardhayanti /
analyzed: pratipatti saṃpannā sarva dharmān vardhayanti
translated: Having perfected practice, they increase all dharmas.

original: sarvadharmān vardhayitvā prītiprāmodyamutpādayanti /
analyzed: sarva dharmān vardhayitvā prīti prāmodyam utpādayanti
translated: Having increased all dharmas, they give rise to joy and delight.

original: tena ca prītiprāmodyacittena bhaiṣajyasenānekāni kalpakoṭīsahasrāṇi na nāśyante /
analyzed: tena ca prīti prāmodya cittena bhaiṣajya senā anekāni kalpa koṭī sahasrāṇi na nāśyante
translated: Bhaiṣajya-senā, by that mind of joy and delight, for many thousands of koṭīs of kalpas they are not destroyed.

original: evameva bhaiṣajyasena prathamacittotpādiko bodhisattvo na kadācid vināśadharmā bhavati /
analyzed: evam eva bhaiṣajyasena prathama citta utpādikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ na kadācid vināśa dharmā bhavati
translated: Bhaiṣajya-senā, in the same way, a bodhisattva who has first given rise to the mind of enlightenment is never subject to destruction.

original: saṃkṣiptena sarvadharmān prajānāti /
analyzed: saṃkṣiptena sarva dharmān prajānāti
translated: In brief, he knows all dharmas.

original: SaSū āha / kathaṃ bhagavan prathamacittotpādiko bodhisattvaḥ svapnaṃ paśyati /
analyzed: āha katham bhagavan prathama citta utpādikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ svapnam paśyati
translated: Bhaiṣajya-senā said, Blessed One, how does a bodhisattva who has first given rise to the mind of enlightenment see a dream?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: bahūni bhaiṣajyasena prathamacittotpādiko bodhisattvaḥ svapnāntare bhayāni paśyati /
analyzed: bahūni bhaiṣajyasena prathama citta utpādikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ svapna antare bhayāni paśyati
translated: “Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, the bodhisattva who has generated the mind of awakening for the first time sees many fears in his dreams.

original: tatkasya hetoryadā svapnāntare bhayāni paśyati /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ yadā svapna antare bhayāni paśyati
translated: What is the reason for that? When he sees fears in his dreams,

original: tadā sarvapāpakāni karmāṇi pariśodhayati /
analyzed: tadā sarva pāpakāni karmāṇi pariśodhayati
translated: he purifies all his evil actions.

original: na śakyaṃ bhaiṣajyasena pāpakarmaṇā sattvena tīvraṃ duḥkhamapanayituṃ na ca pāpena svapnena dṛṣṭenāsya bhayaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na śakyam bhaiṣajyasena pāpa karmaṇā sattvena tīvram duḥkham apanayitum na ca pāpena svapnena dṛṣṭena asya bhayam bhavati
translated: Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, it is not possible for a being with evil actions to remove intense suffering, and he does not have fear when he sees an evil dream.

original: SaSū bhaiṣajyasena āha katamāni bhagavan prathamacittotpādiko bodhisattvaḥ svapnāntare bhayāni paśyati /
analyzed: sasū bhaiṣajyasenaḥ āha katamāni bhagavan prathama citta utpādikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ svapna antare bhayāni paśyati
translated: Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada said, “Blessed One, what fears does the bodhisattva who has generated the mind of awakening for the first time see in his dreams?”

original: bhagavān āha agniṃ bhaiṣajyasena prajvalitaṃ paśyati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha agnim bhaiṣajyasena prajvalitam paśyati
translated: The Blessed One said, “Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, he sees a blazing fire.

original: tatra tena bodhisattvenaivaṃ cittaṃ utpādayitavyaṃ sarvakleśāni me dagdhāḥ dvitīyaṃ bhaiṣajyasena udakaṃ paśyati luḍitaṃ saṃpraluḍitaṃ /
analyzed: tatra tena bodhisattvena evam cittam utpādayitavyam sarva kleśāni me dagdhāḥ dvitīyam bhaiṣajyasena udakam paśyati luḍitam saṃpraluḍitam
translated: There the bodhisattva should generate the thought, ‘All my afflictions have been burned.’ Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, he sees water for a second time, agitated and turbulent.

original: tatra tena prathamacittotpādikena bodhisattvena na bhettavyaṃ /
analyzed: tatra tena prathama cittotpādikena bodhisattvena na bhettavyam
translated: There the bodhisattva who has generated the mind of awakening for the first time should not be frightened.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ evaṃ hi bhaiṣajyasena bodhisattvena sarvamohabandhanāni vinivartya sarvapāpakṣayaṃ kṛtaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ evam hi bhaiṣajyasena bodhisattvena sarva moha bandhanāni vinivartya sarva pāpa kṣayam kṛtam bhavati
translated: What is the reason for that? Thus, Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, the bodhisattva should remove all the bonds of delusion and destroy all evil.

original: tṛtīyaṃ bhaiṣajyasena prathamacittotpādiko bodhisattvaḥ svapnaṃ paśyati mahābhayaṃ /
analyzed: tṛtīyam bhaiṣajyasena prathama citta utpādikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ svapnam paśyati mahā bhayam
translated: Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, the bodhisattva who has generated the mind of enlightenment for the third time sees a great fear in a dream.

original: āha katamaṃ bhagavan
analyzed: āha katamam bhagavan
translated: He said, Bhagavān, what is it?

original: SaSū bhagavān āha svaśarīre śīrṣaṃ muṇḍitaṃ paśyati /
analyzed: bhagavān āha sva śarīre śīrṣam muṇḍitam paśyati
translated: The Bhagavān said, He sees his own head shaved.

original: tatra tena bhaiṣajyasena prathamacittotpādikena bodhisattvena na bhettavyaṃ tatkasya hetoḥ tenaivaṃ cittamutpādayitavyaṃ rāgadveṣamohāni me
analyzed: tatra tena bhaiṣajyasena prathama citta utpādikena bodhisattvena na bhettavyam tat kasya hetoḥ tena evam cittam utpādayitavyam rāga dveṣa mohāni me
translated: There, Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, the bodhisattva who has generated the mind of enlightenment for the first time should not be frightened. What is the reason for that? He should generate the mind of enlightenment, thinking, 'My attachment, aversion, and delusion

original: muṇḍitāni bhavanti /
analyzed: muṇḍitāni bhavanti
translated: are shaved off.

original: ṣaḍgatikaṃ ca me saṃsāraṃ parājitaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ṣaṣ gatikam ca me saṃsāram parājitam bhaviṣyati
translated: And my six destinies of saṃsāra will be conquered.'

original: na hi tasya narakāvāso bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: na hi tasya naraka āvāsaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will not have a dwelling in hell.

original: na tiryakṣu na preteṣu vā
analyzed: na tiryakṣu na preteṣu vā
translated: Not among animals, not among hungry ghosts,

original: nāsureṣu vā
analyzed: na asureṣu vā
translated: not among the asuras,

original: na nāgeṣu na deveṣu pariśuddheṣu bhaiṣajyasena buddhakṣetreṣu prathamacittotpādiko bodhisattvaḥ upapattiṃ pratigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: na nāgeṣu na deveṣu pariśuddheṣu bhaiṣajyasena buddhakṣetreṣu prathama citta utpādikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ upapattim pratigṛhṇāti
translated: not among the nāgas, not among the pure gods, Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, the bodhisattva who has generated the mind of enlightenment for the first time accepts rebirth.

original: SaSū bhaviṣyati
analyzed: sasū bhaviṣyati
translated: He will not have

original: bhaiṣajyasena paścime kāle paścime samaye yadi kaścit sattvo bodhau cittaṃ pariṇamayiṣyati /
analyzed: bhaiṣajyasena paścime kāle paścime samaye yadi kaścid sattvaḥ bodhau cittam pariṇamayiṣyati
translated: Bhaiṣajyasena, in the later times, in the later era, if there are any beings who will turn their minds toward enlightenment,

original: tena mahatī paribhāṣaṇā draṣṭavyā /
analyzed: tena mahatī paribhāṣaṇā draṣṭavyā
translated: they should expect great criticism.

original: paribhūtavāsaśca bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: paribhūta vāsaḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: They will have a life of being criticized.

original: tatratena bhaiṣajyasena prathamacittotpādikena bodhisattvena na parikhedacittamutpādayitavyaṃ na vyavasitavyaṃ /
analyzed: tatra tena bhaiṣajyasena prathamacittotpādikena bodhisattvena na parikheda cittam utpādayitavyam na vyavasitavyam
translated: Bhaiṣajyasena, the bodhisattva who has first generated the mind of enlightenment should not give rise to a mind of weariness, should not be discouraged.

original: SaSū bahavo bhaiṣajyasena mayā dharmā deśitāḥ mayā ca bhaiṣajyasenānekāni kalpaniyutaśatasahasrāni
analyzed: bahavaḥ bhaiṣajyasena mayā dharmāḥ deśitāḥ mayā ca bhaiṣajyasena anekāni kalpa niyuta śata sahasrāni
translated: Bhaiṣajyasena, I have taught many dharmas. And by me, Bhaiṣajyasena, for many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭīs of kalpas,

original: duṣkaracaryā cīrṇā na mayā bhaiṣajyasena rājyabhogārthāya vā vṛttibhogārthāya vā
analyzed: duṣkara caryā cīrṇā na mayā bhaiṣajyasena rājya bhoga arthāya vā vṛtti bhoga arthāya vā
translated: the practice of austerities has been practiced. Bhaiṣajyasena, the practice of austerities has not been practiced by me for the sake of enjoying kingdoms, for the sake of enjoying livelihood,

original: aiśvaryabhogārthāya vā duṣkaracaryā cīrṇāḥ svabhāvadharmāvabodhāya bhaiṣajyasena
analyzed: aiśvarya bhoga arthāya vā duṣkara caryā cīrṇāḥ svabhāva dharma avabodhāya bhaiṣajyasena
translated: for the sake of enjoying sovereignty, Bhaiṣajyasena, but for the realization of the inherent nature of dharmas.

original: mayā duṣkaracaryā cīrṇāḥ na ca me tāvadanuttarā samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhā yāvanna
analyzed: mayā duṣkara caryā cīrṇāḥ na ca me tāvat anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhā yāvat na
translated: The practice of austerities has been practiced by me, but as long as I have not

original: mayāyaṃ dharmaparyāyaḥ śrutaḥ yasminstu bhaiṣajyasena kālasamaye mayāyaṃ saṃghāṭo
analyzed: mayā ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ śrutaḥ yasmin stu bhaiṣajyasena kāla samaye mayā ayam saṃghāṭaḥ
translated: heard this Dharma discourse, as long as I have not heard this Dharma discourse, Bhaiṣajyasena, at that time when this Saṃghata

original: dharmaparyāya śrutaḥ tatraiva me divase anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhimabhisaṃbuddhā gaṃbhīro🔽yaṃ bhaiṣajyasena dharmaparyāyaḥ durlabho 'sya bhaiṣajyasena dharmaparyāyasya kalpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrairapi🔽śravaḥ paramadurlabho bhaiṣajyasena tathāgatānāmutpādaḥ paramadurlabhā bhaiṣajyasenāsya
analyzed: dharmaparyāya śrutaḥ tatra eva me divase anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhā gaṃbhīro  yam bhaiṣajyasena dharmaparyāyaḥ bhaiṣajyasena dharmaparyāyasya kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ api  śravaḥ parama durlabhaḥ bhaiṣajyasena tathāgatānām utpādaḥ parama durlabhā bhaiṣajyasenā asya
translated: I heard that Dharma teaching there on that very day, and I fully awakened to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.🔽This profound Dharma teaching is difficult to find, Bhaiṣajya-rāja. Even in hundreds of thousands of quintillions of eons, it is extremely difficult to find, Bhaiṣajya-rāja, the appearance of a Tathāgata.

original: dharmaparyāyasya dhārakaḥ
analyzed: dharmaparyāyasya dhārakaḥ
translated: Bhaiṣajya-rāja, it is extremely difficult to find a person who upholds this Dharma teaching.

original: SaSū ye te iman dharmaparyāyaṃ śroṣyanti /
analyzed: ye te iman dharmaparyāyam śroṣyanti
translated: Those who will hear this Dharma teaching,

original: sarve te nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante /
analyzed: sarve te nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: all of them will fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: kalpaśatasahasraṃ bhaiṣajyasena sattvā saṃsārāt paścānmukhaṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: kalpa śata sahasram bhaiṣajyasena sattvā saṃsārāt paścānmukham kariṣyanti
translated: For a hundred thousand eons, Bhaiṣajya-rāja, beings will turn away from saṃsāra.

original: pariṣuddhaṃ ca buddhakṣetraṃ pratilapsyante /
analyzed: pariṣuddham ca buddhakṣetram pratilapsyante
translated: They will attain a completely pure buddha-field.

original: nirodhamārgaṃ ca prajñasyanti /
analyzed: nirodha mārgam ca prajñasyanti
translated: They will understand the path of cessation.

original: bhavyāś ca te niśrayaṃ prajñātuṃ /🔽bhavyāḥ kuśalasthānaṃ prajñatuṃ /
analyzed: bhavyāḥ ca te niśrayam prajñātum  bhavyāḥ kuśala sthānam
translated: They are capable of knowing the basis.🔽They are capable of knowing the basis of skillful means.

original: bhavyā abhijñākuśalasthānaṃ prajñatum bhavyāḥ kuśalasthānanirodhaṃ prajñātum
analyzed: bhavyāḥ abhijñā kuśala sthānam bhavyāḥ kuśala sthāna nirodham prajñātum
translated: They are capable of knowing the basis of skillful means that is the cessation of the basis.

original: SaSū nirodhameva bhaiṣajyasena kimarthamucyate /
analyzed: nirodham eva bhaiṣajyasena kimartham ucyate
translated: What is the meaning of the word 'cessation,' Bhaisajyasena?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: artha ucyate bhagavan dharmasthānam bhagavānāha katamaṃ bhaiṣajyasena dharmasthānaṃ /
analyzed: arthaḥ ucyate bhagavan dharma sthānam bhagavān āha katamam bhaiṣajyasena dharma sthānam
translated: Blessed One, the meaning of the word 'Dharma' is said to be 'stable.' The Blessed One said, 'Bhaiṣajyasena, what is the stable Dharma?'

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: dharma ucyate bhagavannārabdhavīryatā /
analyzed: dharmaḥ ucyate bhagavan ārabdha vīrya tā
translated: Blessed One, the word 'Dharma' is said to mean 'exertions begun,'

original: ārabdhaśīlatā /
analyzed: ārabdha śīla tā
translated: 'virtue begun,'

original: śīlasamanvāgamatā dharmanidhānamityucyate /
analyzed: śīla samanvāgama tā dharma nidhānam iti ucyate
translated: 'endowed with virtue.' It is said to be a treasure of the Dharma.

original: idaṃ bhagavan dharmanidhānaṃ saṃbhavati /🔽bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu bhaiṣajyasena yastvaṃ
analyzed: idam bhagavan dharma nidhānam saṃbhavati  bhagavān āha sādhu sādhu bhaiṣajyasena yaḥ tvam
translated: Blessed One, this is the treasure of the Dharma that is possible.

original: tathāgatametamarthaṃ paripraṣṭavyaṃ manyase /
analyzed: tathāgatam etam artham paripraṣṭavyam manyase
translated: The Blessed One said, Good, good, Bhaiṣajyasena, that you think to ask the Tathāgata about this matter.

original: SaSū āha / kena kāreṇana bhagavan tathāgatā loka utpadyante /
analyzed: āha kena kāreṇana bhagavan tathāgatāḥ loke utpadyante
translated: He said, For what reason, Blessed One, do the Tathāgatas appear in the world?

original: bhagavān āha ye bhaiṣajyasena bāhuśrutyasamanvāgamaṃ prajānanti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha ye bhaiṣajyasena bāhuśrutya samanvāgamam prajānanti
translated: The Blessed One said, Bhaiṣajyasena, those who understand the attainment of great learning,

original: te tathāgatānāmutpādaṃ prajānanti /
analyzed: te tathāgatānām utpādam prajānanti
translated: they understand the appearance of the Tathāgatas.

original: te tathāgatānāmutpādaṃ jñātvā idaṃ tathāgatānāmutpādasukhasthānaṃ prajānanti /
analyzed: te tathāgatānām utpādam jñātvā idam tathāgatānām utpāda sukha sthānam prajānanti
translated: Having understood the appearance of the Tathāgatas, they understand this place of happiness in the appearance of the Tathāgatas.

original: yadā ca tathāgatā loka utpadyante tadā sattvā sarvadharmān prajānanti /
analyzed: yadā ca tathāgatāḥ loke utpadyante tadā sattvāḥ sarva dharmān prajānanti
translated: When the Tathāgatas appear in the world, then beings understand all dharmas.

original: upāyakuśalān dharmān prajānanti /
analyzed: upāya kuśalān dharmān prajānanti
translated: They know the skillful means of the Dharma.

original: laukikalokottarān dharmān prajānanti /
analyzed: laukika lokottarān dharmān prajānanti
translated: They know the worldly and transcendent Dharmas.

original: laukikalokottarāṇi jñānāni prajānanti /
analyzed: laukika lokottarāṇi jñānāni prajānanti
translated: They know the worldly and transcendent wisdoms.

original: SaSū āha jñānamevaṃ jñātvā katamaṃ nirvāṇaṃ prajānanti /
analyzed: āha jñānam evam jñātvā katamam nirvāṇam prajānanti
translated: Bhaiṣajya-rāja said, Knowing wisdom in this way, which nirvāṇa do they know?

original: bhagavānāha dharmameva bhaiṣajyasena prajānanti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha dharmam eva bhaiṣajyasena prajānanti
translated: The Blessed One said, Bhaiṣajya-rāja, they know the Dharma itself.

original: dharmameva jñātvā evameva
analyzed: dharmam eva jñātvā evam eva
translated: Having known the Dharma in this way,

original: bhaiṣajyasena dharmasaṃgrahaṃ prajānatāṃ prathamo lābha utpadyate /
analyzed: bhaiṣajyasena dharma saṃgraham prajānatām prathamaḥ lābhaḥ utpadyate
translated: Bhaiṣajya-rāja, those who know the collection of the Dharma will obtain the first gain.

original: yathāśrutaṃ gṛhya dhārmikameva lābho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yathāśrutam gṛhya dhārmikam eva lābhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: As heard, taking up the Dharma, there will be gain.

original: SaSū tadyathāpi nāma bhaiṣajyasena kaścideva puruṣo vāṇijako bhavet sa lābhahetorgacchan
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhaiṣajyasena kaścid eva puruṣaḥ vāṇijakaḥ bhavet sa lābha hetoḥ gacchan
translated: Bhaiṣajya-rāja, it is just as if there were a certain merchant who, for the sake of profit, would go

original: parakyasvakasya suvarṇasya puruṣabhārasahasraṃ gṛhītvā gacchet tasya gacchatastau
analyzed: parakya svakasya suvarṇasya puruṣa bhāra sahasram gṛhītvā gacchet tasya gacchataḥ tau
translated: taking with him a thousand human loads of gold, both his own and others', and while he was going

original: mātāpitarāvevamāhutuḥ śṛṇu kulaputra idaṃ suvarṇasya puruṣabhārasahasraṃ gṛhītaṃ parakyasvakasya ca /
analyzed: mātā pitarau evam āhutuḥ śṛṇu kula putra idam suvarṇasya puruṣa bhāra sahasram gṛhītam parakya svakasya ca
translated: his parents would say to him, 'Listen, son of good family, this thousand human loads of gold, both his own and others',

original: ta tvayedaṃ suvarṇaṃ sugṛhītaṃ kartavyaṃ na ca kiṃcidato vināśayitavyaṃ mahālābhaṃ kṛtvā suvarṇaṃ eva sugṛhītaṃ kuru tadasmākaṃ mahālābho bhaviṣyati
analyzed: ta tvayā idam suvarṇam su gṛhītam kartavyam na ca kiṃcid atas vināśayitavyam mahā lābham kṛtvā suvarṇam eva su gṛhītam kuru tat asmākam mahā lābhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: You should properly take this gold and not destroy any of it. Having made a great profit, properly take the gold. That will be a great gain for us.

original: sukhaṃ ca jīviṣyāmaḥ sa ca putrastau mātāpitarāvevaṃ vadedevaṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: sukham ca jīviṣyāmaḥ sa ca putraḥ tau mātā pitarau evam vadet evam kariṣyāmi
translated: And we will live happily. The son would say to his parents, I will do as you say.

original: ityuktvā sa vāṇijakaḥ suvarṇaṃ gṛhītvā gacchedatha sa vāṇijakaḥ pramādādyāvan māsamātreṇa sarvaṃ suvarṇaṃ vināśayedvilayaṃ kuryāt
analyzed: iti uktvā sa vāṇijakaḥ suvarṇam gṛhītvā gacchet atha sa vāṇijakaḥ pramādāt yāvat māsa mātreṇa sarvam suvarṇam vināśayet vilayam kuryāt
translated: Having said that, the merchant would take the gold and leave. Then, due to carelessness, the merchant would destroy all the gold in just one month, reduce it to nothing.

original: SaSū atha sa puruṣaḥ paramacintāmāpannaḥ śokaśalyenāviddhahṛdayaḥ sahrīravatrāpyena ca svagṛhaṃ na paraviśeta /
analyzed: atha sa puruṣaḥ parama cintām āpannaḥ śoka śalyena āviddha hṛdayaḥ ca sva gṛham na paraviśeta
translated: Then that man, having fallen into great anxiety, with his heart pierced by the dart of sorrow, with shame and fear, would not enter his own house, let alone another's.

original: tasya tau mātāpitarau śṛṇuyātāṃ evaṃ yuvābhyāṃ putreṇa tat suvarṇaṃ sarvaṃ vināśitamiti
analyzed: tasya tau mātā pitarau śṛṇuyātām evam yuvābhyām putreṇa tat suvarṇam sarvam vināśitam iti
translated: His parents would hear that All that gold of your son has been destroyed by him.

original: śrutvā nirāśībhūtau śokaśalyenābhyāhatahṛdayau vastrāṇi pāṭayataḥ śocataḥ krandataḥ
analyzed: śrutvā nirāśībhūtau śoka śalyena abhyāhata hṛdayau vastrāṇi pāṭayataḥ śocataḥ krandataḥ
translated: Having heard that, they would become hopeless, their hearts struck by the dart of sorrow, they would tear their clothes, lament and weep.

original: evaṃ ca paridevataḥ duṣputro 'smākaṃ gṛhe putrarūpeṇotpannaḥ sakalaṃ eva gṛhaṃ vināśītavān
analyzed: evam ca paridevataḥ duṣputraḥ smākam gṛhe putra rūpeṇa utpannaḥ sakalam eva gṛham
translated: And while lamenting, he said, This bad son of ours has appeared in the form of a son in our house and has destroyed everything.

original: asmākamanāthaṃ kṛtvā dāsau karmakarau kṛtau /
analyzed: asmākam anātham kṛtvā dāsau karmakarau kṛtau
translated: Having made us helpless, he has made us slaves and servants.

original: tasya tau mātāpitarau cintāparigatahṛdayau nirāśau kālagatau tatastena putreṇa śrutaṃ matāpitarau me nirāśau kālagatau /🔽so 'pi putro nirāśa eva kālagataḥ
analyzed: tasya tau mātā pitarau cintā parigata hṛdayau nirāśau kālagatau tatas tena putreṇa śrutam matā pitarau me nirāśau kālagatau  saḥ pi putraḥ nirāśaḥ eva kālagataḥ
translated: When his parents heard that their parents had died in despair, he too died in despair.

original: SaSū evameva bhaiṣajyasena tathāgato 'pyetamarthaṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: evam eva bhaiṣajyasenaḥ tathāgataḥ pi etam artham bhāṣate
translated: Just so, Bhaisajyasena, the Tathagata also teaches this meaning.

original: ye sattvā mama śasane na prasīdanti te nirāśībhūtā maraṇakālasamaye śokaśalyābhyāhatahṛdayā mahādharmaratnabahiṣkṛtāḥ kālaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ mama śasane na prasīdanti te nirāśībhūtāḥ maraṇa kāla samaye śoka śalya abhyāhata hṛdayāḥ mahā dharma ratna bahiṣkṛtāḥ kālam kurvanti
translated: Those beings who do not delight in my teaching, they, having become hopeless, at the time of death, their hearts struck by the dart of sorrow, excluded from the great jewel of the Dharma, die.

original: yathā tau mātāpitarau nirāśau śocataḥ paridevataḥ suvarṇahetoḥ śokaśalyābhyāhatahṛdayau parakyasvakena suvarṇena śokaśalyaparigatau cintāmāpadya
analyzed: yathā tau mātā pitarau nirāśau śocataḥ paridevataḥ suvarṇa hetoḥ śoka śalya abhyāhata hṛdayau parakya svakena suvarṇena śoka śalya parigatau cintām āpadya
translated: Just as those parents, hopeless, lamenting, their hearts struck by the dart of sorrow for the sake of the gold, with their own gold belonging to others, struck by the dart of sorrow, fell into thought.

original: SaSū evameva bhaiṣajyasena ye mama śasane na prasīdante paścān maraṇakālasamaye paritapyamānāḥ paridevanto duḥkhāṃ vedanāṃ vedayanti
analyzed: evam eva bhaiṣajyasena ye mama śasane na prasīdante paścāt maraṇa kāla samaye paritapyamānāḥ paridevantaḥ duḥkhām vedanām vedayanti
translated: “Bhaiṣajya-senā, it is the same way. Those who do not delight in my teaching later, at the time of death, are tormented and lament, and experience painful feelings.

original: pūrvakṛtāni ca puṇyāni paribhuktvā na bhūyo 'nyāni puṇyāni kurvanti sukṣetragatāni /
analyzed: pūrva kṛtāni ca puṇyāni paribhuktvā na bhūyas nyāni puṇyāni kurvanti su kṣetra gatāni
translated: Having enjoyed the previously created merits, they do not create any new merits in a good field.🔽There, when their merits are exhausted, their hearts pierced by the stake of grief, at that time and on that occasion, they see the terrible and fearful births in the hells, animal wombs, and the world of Yama.

original: tatra teṣāṃ puṇyaparikṣīṇānāṃ śokaśalyaparigatahṛdayānāṃ tena kālena tena samayena narakatiryagyoniyamalokopapattiṃ ghorāṃ dāruṇān dṛṣṭvā maraṇakālasamaye 🔽evaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tatra teṣām puṇya parikṣīṇānām śoka śalya parigata hṛdayānām tena kālena tena samayena naraka tiryagyoni yama loka upapattim ghorām dāruṇān dṛṣṭvā maraṇa kāla samaye  evam bhavati
translated: At the time of death, they think like this:

original: ko me trātā bhavedyadahaṃ naraka gati
analyzed: kaḥ me trātā bhavet yat aham
translated: 'Who will be my protector so that I do not go to the realm of the hells,

original: tiryakpretayamalokaviṣayaṃ na paśyeyan na ca tāṃ duḥkhāṃ vedanāṃ vedayeyaṃ /🔽SaSū tasyaivaṃ pralapataḥ paralokamākramataḥ tau mātāpitarāvevamāhataḥ kiṃ kariṣyāma putraka /
analyzed: tiryak preta yama loka viṣayam na paśyeyat na ca tām duḥkhām vedanām vedayeyam  tasya evam pralapataḥ para lokam ākramataḥ tau mātā pitarau evam āhataḥ kim kariṣyāma putraka
translated: the animal world, the world of hungry ghosts, and Yama, and so that I do not experience that painful feeling?'🔽Bhaiṣajya-senā, when he is lamenting like this, about to enter the next world, his parents say to him like this: 'What shall we do, dear son?'

original: gāthābhiścāddhyābhāṣataḥ
analyzed: gāthābhiḥ ca addhyā ābhāṣataḥ
translated: And they speak this verse:

original: grahītuṃ śakyate naiva vyādhirduḥkhaṃ mahābhayaṃ /
analyzed: grahītum śakyate nā eva vyādhiḥ duḥkham mahā bhayam
translated: 'The disease, the great fear of suffering, cannot be grasped.

original: nāsti te maraṇaṃ putra glānasya maraṇādbhayaṃ /
analyzed: na asti te maraṇam putra glānasya maraṇāt bhayam
translated: You have no death, son, fear of death for the sick,

original: mokṣo bhaviṣyate tubhyaṃ vyādherhi bhayabhairavāt
analyzed: mokṣaḥ bhaviṣyate tubhyam vyādheḥ hi bhaya bhairavāt
translated: but liberation will come to you from the fear and terror of the disease.

original: dhṛtiṃ kuruṣva he putra tataḥ siddhirbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: dhṛtim kuruṣva he putra tatas siddhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Have patience, son, then success will come.

original: putra āha
analyzed: putraḥ āha
translated: The son said:

original: niruddhyate me vijñānaṃ kāyo me pīḍyate bhṛśam
analyzed: me vijñānam kāyaḥ me pīḍyate bhṛśam
translated: My consciousness is obstructed, my body is severely afflicted,

original: sarve aṅgāni duḥkhanti mṛtyuṃ paśyāmi ātmanaḥ
analyzed: sarve aṅgāni duḥkhanti mṛtyum paśyāmi ātmanaḥ
translated: all the limbs are suffering, I see death for myself.

original: na paśyataścakṣuṣī me karṇau me na śṛṇonti ca /
analyzed: na paśyataḥ cakṣuṣī me karṇau me na śṛṇonti ca
translated: The eyes do not see for me, the ears do not hear for me,

original: śrotraṃ punarna lapsyāmi na kāyaḥ saṃsahiṣyati /
analyzed: śrotram punar na lapsyāmi na kāyaḥ saṃsahiṣyati
translated: I will not obtain the hearing again, the body will not endure,

original: aṅgamaṃgāni duḥkhanti kāṣṭhā iva acetanāḥ
analyzed: aṅgamaṃgāni kāṣṭhāḥ iva acetanāḥ
translated: the limbs and parts suffer, like unconscious pieces of wood.

original: visvādayasi me amba nāgataṃ maraṇaṃ tava /
analyzed: visvādayasi me amba na āgatam maraṇam tava
translated: You deceive me, mother, death has not come for you.

original: mātā āha
analyzed: mātā āha
translated: The mother said:

original: vaktuṃ nārhasi putraivaṃ mā me trāsaparāṃ kuru /
analyzed: vaktum nā arhasi putra evam mā me trāsa parām kuru
translated: You should not speak thus, son, do not make me fearful.

original: kāyaṃ tava jvarākrāntaṃ viprakārāṇi paśyasi /
analyzed: kāyam tava jvara ākrāntam viprakārāṇi paśyasi
translated: Your body is afflicted by fever, you see distortions.

original: putra āha 🔽na paśyāmi jvaraṃ kāyerna ca vyādhirna duḥkhati /🔽paśyāmi maranaṃ ghoraṃ hataṃ kāyaṃ ca me bhṛśam
analyzed: putraḥ āha  na paśyāmi jvaram na ca vyādhiḥ na  paśyāmi maranam ghoram hatam kāyam ca me bhṛśam
translated: The son said:🔽I do not see fever in the body, nor does the body suffer from disease or pain.🔽I see terrible death, and my body is severely struck down.

original: paśyāmi ātmanā sarvaṃ kāyaṃ duḥkhaprapīḍitaṃ /
analyzed: paśyāmi ātmanā sarvam kāyam duḥkha prapīḍitam
translated: I see all the body, myself, afflicted by suffering.

original: gacchāmi kasya śaraṇaṃ ko me trātā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: gacchāmi kasya śaraṇam kaḥ me trātā bhaviṣyati
translated: To whom shall I go for refuge? Who will be my protector?

original: mātāpitā vadet putra devakrodhaṃ hi te bhavet
analyzed: mātā pitā vadet putra deva krodham hi te bhavet
translated: His parents said, Son, it may be the anger of the gods.

original: devebhyo yajanaṃ kṛtvā tataḥ svastirbhaviṣyati /
analyzed: devebhyaḥ yajanam kṛtvā tatas svastiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Having made offerings to the gods, then well-being will come.

original: putrā āha
analyzed: putraḥ āha
translated: The son said,

original: kariṣyathā yūyameva yena svastirbhaven mama /🔽śīghraṃ śīghraṃ ca gatvā vai pṛcchathā devapālakam
analyzed: kariṣyathāḥ yūyam eva yena svastiḥ bhavet mama  śīghram śīghram ca gatvā vai pṛcchathāḥ devapālakam
translated: You yourselves do what will bring well-being to me.🔽Having quickly gone, ask the god's caretaker.

original: SaSū atha tasya tau mātāpitarau devakukaṃ gatvā devasya dhūpaṃ dāpayanti /
analyzed: atha tasya tau mātā pitarau devakukam gatvā devasya dhūpam dāpayanti
translated: Then his parents, having gone to the god's temple, cause incense to be offered to the god.

original: atha sa devapālakaḥ devasya dhūpaṃ datvaivaṃ vācaṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: atha sa devapālakaḥ devasya dhūpam da tvā evam vācam bhāṣate
translated: Then that god's caretaker, having offered incense to the god, speaks thus:

original: devaste kruddhaḥ devasyopakāraḥ kartavyaḥ yajanaṃ kartavyaṃ /
analyzed: devaḥ te kruddhaḥ devasya upakāraḥ kartavyaḥ yajanam kartavyam
translated: The god is angry with you. A favor to the god must be done. A sacrifice must be performed.

original: tatra paśurghātayitavyaḥ puruṣaśca ghātayitavyaḥ tataste putro vyādheḥ parimokṣyate /
analyzed: tatra paśuḥ ghātayitavyaḥ puruṣaḥ ca ghātayitavyaḥ tatas te putraḥ vyādheḥ parimokṣyate
translated: There a beast must be killed and a man must be killed. Then your son will be released from the illness.

original: atha tau mātāpitarau tasyām velāyāmevaṃ cintayataḥ kiṃ kariṣyāmo daridrāścāsma /
analyzed: atha tau mātā pitarau tasyām velāyām evam cintayataḥ kim kariṣyāmaḥ daridrāḥ ca āsma
translated: Then at that time his parents think thus: What shall we do? We are poor.

original: yadi devo na parasīdiṣyati tadasmākaṃ putraḥ kālaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: yadi devaḥ na parasīdiṣyati tat asmākam putraḥ kālam kariṣyati
translated: If the god does not forgive, then our son will die.

original: atha vā prasādaṃ kuryāttadvayaṃ paramadaridrāḥ paśuṃ puruṣaṃ cānayāma /
analyzed: atha vā prasādam kuryāt tat vayam parama daridrāḥ paśum puruṣam ca anayāma
translated: Or, if he shows mercy, we will bring him a beast and a man, for we are extremely poor.”

original: SaSū atha tau śīghraśīghraṃ svagṛhaṃ gatvā yatkiṃcidgṛhe pariṣkāraṃ saṃvidyate tatsarvaṃ vikrīya /
analyzed: atha tau śīghra śīghram sva gṛham gatvā yat kiṃcid gṛhe pariṣkāram saṃvidyate tat sarvam vikrīya
translated: Then they quickly went to their own house and sold everything they had in the house,

original: paśukrayārthe gacchataḥ atha tāvadanyataraṃ puruṣaṃ evaṃ vadeyuḥ dehi bhoḥ puruṣaḥ
analyzed: paśu kraya arthe gacchataḥ atha tāvat anyataram puruṣam evam vadeyuḥ dehi bhoḥ puruṣaḥ
translated: and went to buy a beast. Then they would say to another man, “Give us gold, good man,

original: suvarṇamasmākaṃ yācitaṃ yadi śaknumo daśame divase punarapi dātuṃ tacchobhanamatha
analyzed: suvarṇam asmākam yācitam yadi śaknumaḥ daśame divase punar api dātum tat śobhanam atha
translated: on loan. If we are able to repay it in ten days, that would be good.

original: na śaknumo dātuṃ tadvayaṃ tava dāsā bhaviṣyāmaḥ karmakarāḥ tau ca taṃ suvarṇaṃ gṛhītvā
analyzed: na śaknumaḥ dātum tat vayam tava dāsāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ karmakarāḥ tau ca tam suvarṇam gṛhītvā
translated: But if we are not able to repay it, then we will become your slaves, your servants.” And they would take that gold

original: gaccheyuḥ paśuṃ puruṣaṃ krotuṃ /
analyzed: gaccheyuḥ paśum puruṣam krotum
translated: and go to buy a beast and a man.

original: SaSū atha tābhyāṃ ca paśuḥ puruṣa krītaḥ sa ca puruṣo na jānīyādyan māmete jīvitādvyavaropayiṣyanti /
analyzed: atha tābhyām ca paśuḥ puruṣa krītaḥ sa ca puruṣaḥ na jānīyāt yat mām ete jīvitāt vyavaropayiṣyanti
translated: Then that man whom they bought as a beast and a man would not know that they would deprive him of life.

original: atha tau mātāpitarau saṃmohamāpannau na bhūyaḥ svagṛhaṃ praviṣṭau /
analyzed: atha tau mātā pitarau saṃmoham āpannau na bhūyas sva gṛham praviṣṭau
translated: Then those two, the mother and father, having fallen into confusion, would not enter their own house again.

original: tau devakulaṃ gatvā taṃ devapalakamāmantrayanti /
analyzed: tau devakulam gatvā tam deva palakam āmantrayanti
translated: They would go to the temple and invite that image of the god,🔽saying,

original: śīghramidānīṃ yajanaṃ kuruṣva /
analyzed: śīghram idānīm yajanam kuruṣva
translated: Quickly perform the sacrifice now.

original: atha tau mātāpitarau svayameva taṃ paśuṃ ghātayataḥ taṃ ca puruṣaṃ jīvitādvyavaropayataḥ tataḥ sa devapālaka ārabdho yajñaṃ yajanāya medaṃ
analyzed: atha tau mātā pitarau svayam eva tam paśum ghātayataḥ tam ca puruṣam jīvitāt vyavaropayataḥ tatas sa devapālakaḥ ārabdhaḥ yajñam yajanāya mā idam
translated: Then the parents themselves slaughtered the animal and killed the man. Then Devapāla began the sacrifice to make an offering.

original: tataḥ sa devo 'vatīrya evaṃ kathayati /
analyzed: tatas sa devaḥ vatīrya evam kathayati
translated: Then the god descended and said:

original: tava putro mayā parigṛhītā iti /
analyzed: tava putraḥ mayā parigṛhītaḥ iti
translated: Your son has been accepted by me.

original: tatastau mātāpitarau prītiprāmodyena sphuṭāvāhatuḥ varaṃ putro jīvatu vayaṃ dāsā
analyzed: tatas tau mātā pitarau prīti prāmodyena sphuṭau āhatuḥ varam putraḥ jīvatu vayam dāsā
translated: Then the parents, filled with joy and delight, said: It is better that the son lives. We will become slaves.

original: bhaviṣyāmaḥ tatastau mātāpitarau nivartya suyaṣṭāṃ devaṃ kṛtvā yāvat svagṛhaṃ gatvā
analyzed: bhaviṣyāmaḥ tatas tau mātā pitarau nivartya suyaṣṭām devam kṛtvā yāvat sva gṛham gatvā
translated: Then the parents turned back, made a good offering to the god, and went home.

original: tadā taṃ putraṃ kālagataṃ paśyanti /
analyzed: tadā tam putram kālagatam paśyanti
translated: Then they saw their son dead.

original: tatastau mātāpitarau mahatā duḥkhadaurmanasyena śokaśalyenāviddhahṛdayau nirāśībhūtau /
analyzed: tatas tau mātā pitarau mahatā duḥkha daurmanasyena śoka śalyena āviddha hṛdayau nirāśībhūtau
translated: Then the parents, with great sorrow and grief, their hearts pierced by the dart of grief, became hopeless.

original: tatraiva kālagatau /
analyzed: tatra eva kālagatau
translated: They died right there.

original: evameva bhaiṣajyasenākalyāṇamitrasaṃsargatā draṣṭavyāḥ
analyzed: evam eva bhaiṣajya senā kalyāṇa mitra saṃsarga tāḥ draṣṭavyāḥ
translated: In the same way, Bhaiṣajya-senā, the association with an unwholesome friend should be seen.

original: SaSū āha / pṛcchāmi tāvad
analyzed: āha pṛcchāmi tāvat
translated: Bhaiṣajya-senā said: I ask,

original: bhagavan pṛcchāmi sugata / āha /
analyzed: bhagavan pṛcchāmi sugataḥ āha
translated: Blessed One, I ask, Sugata. He said:

original: pṛccha bhaiṣajyasena /
analyzed: pṛccha bhaiṣajyasena
translated: Ask, Bhaiṣajya-senā.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:🔽Blessed One, what is the name of this discourse on the Dharma? How should it be remembered?

original: kutra bhagavan teṣāṃ sattvānāmupapattiḥ ko 'bhisaṃparāyaḥ āha /
analyzed: kutra bhagavan teṣām sattvānām upapattiḥ kaḥ bhisaṃparāyaḥ āha
translated: Where, Blessed One, is the rebirth of those beings? What is their future state? He said:

original: alaṃ bhaiṣajyasena kin tavānenārthena paripṛṣṭena /
analyzed: alam bhaiṣajyasena kim tava anena arthena paripṛṣṭena
translated: Enough, Medicine King! What need is there for you to ask about this matter?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: pṛcchāmi bhagavan pṛcchāmi sugata /
analyzed: pṛcchāmi bhagavan pṛcchāmi sugata
translated: I ask, Blessed One, I ask, Well-Gone One!

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tatra bhaiṣajyasena mātā raurave mahānarake upapannā /
analyzed: tatra bhaiṣajyasena mātā raurave mahā narake upapannā
translated: There, Medicine King, the mother has been reborn in the Raurava great hell,

original: pitā saṃghāte mahānarake upapannaḥ putrastapane mahānarake upapannaḥ devapālako mahāvicau mahānarake upapannaḥ
analyzed: pitā saṃghāte mahā narake upapannaḥ putraḥ tapane mahā narake upapannaḥ deva pālakaḥ mahāvicau mahā narake upapannaḥ
translated: the father has been reborn in the Saṃghāta great hell, the son has been reborn in the Tapana great hell, and Devapāla has been reborn in the Mahāvīci great hell.

original: SaSū āha / anaparādhikasya bhagavan puruṣasya kutropapattiḥ ko 'syābhisaṃparāyaḥ /
analyzed: āha anaparādhikasya bhagavan puruṣasya kutra upapattiḥ kaḥ sya abhisaṃparāyaḥ
translated: He said: Blessed One, where is the rebirth of a man who has not committed any offense? What is his future state?

original: bhagavān āha iha bhaiṣajyasenānaparādhikasya puruṣasya trāyastriṃśānan devanāṃ sahabhāvyatāyāmupapattirdraṣṭavyā / āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha iha bhaiṣajyasena anapara adhikasya puruṣasya trāyastriṃśa ānan devanām sahabhāvya tāyām upapattiḥ draṣṭavyā āha
translated: The Blessed One said: Here, Medicine King, the rebirth of a man who has not committed any offense should be seen as in the company of the Thirty-Three gods. He said:

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo yat sa puruṣastrāyastriṃśatā devānāṃ sahabhāvyatāyāmupapannaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat sa puruṣaḥ trāyastriṃśatā devānām sahabhāvya tāyām upapannaḥ
translated: What is the cause, Blessed One, what is the condition for that man being reborn in the company of the Thirty-Three gods?

original: bhagavān āha śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena sa puruṣo maraṇakālasamaye jīvitādvyavaropyamāṇastathāgatasyopari
analyzed: bhagavān āha śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena sa puruṣaḥ maraṇa kāla samaye jīvitāt vyavaropyamāṇaḥ tathāgatasya upari
translated: The Blessed One said, Listen, Bhaiṣajya-senā! At the time of death, that man, while being deprived of life,

original: cittaṃ prasādyaivaṃ vācamabhāṣataḥ namastasya bhagavate tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyetyekavārākṛtaṃ /
analyzed: cittam prasādya evam vācam abhāṣataḥ namaḥ tasya bhagavate tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya iti eka vārākṛtam
translated: having faith in the Tathāgata, spoke these words: 'Homage to that Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One,' once.

original: sa tena bhaiṣajyasena kuśalamūlena ṣaṣṭiḥ kalpān trāyastriṃśatāṃ devānāṃ sukhamanubhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sa tena bhaiṣajyasena kuśala mūlena ṣaṣṭiḥ kalpān trāyastriṃśatām devānām sukham anubhaviṣyati
translated: By that root of merit, Bhaiṣajya-senā, he will experience the happiness of the Thirty-Three Gods for sixty eons.

original: aśītiḥ kalpāṃ jātyā jātismaro bhaviṣyati /🔽jātau jātau ca sarvaśokavigato bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: aśītiḥ jātyāḥ jātismaraḥ bhaviṣyati  jātau jātau ca sarva śoka vigataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: For eighty eons he will be reborn with the memory of past lives.🔽In every rebirth he will be free from all sorrow.

original: jātamātraśca sarvaduḥkhāni nirvāpayiṣyati /
analyzed: jāta mātraḥ ca sarva duḥkhāni nirvāpayiṣyati
translated: As soon as he is born, he will extinguish all suffering.

original: na hi te sarvasattvā śakyaṃ parinirvāpayitum
analyzed: na hi te sarva sattvā śakyam parinirvāpayitum
translated: For you cannot liberate all beings.

original: SaSū evamukte bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat
analyzed: evam ukte bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-senā said to the Blessed One,

original: kathaṃ bhagavan na śakyaṃ sarvasattvāḥ parinirvāpayitum bhagavān āha vīryaṃ bhaiṣajyasenārabdhavyam āha /
analyzed: katham bhagavat na śakyam sarva sattvāḥ parinirvāpayitum bhagavān āha  vīryam bhaiṣajyasena ārabdhavyam āha
translated: Blessed One, how is it that all beings cannot be liberated? The Blessed One said, Bhaiṣajya-senā, one should undertake vigor. He said,

original: katamo bhagavan vīryāraṃbhaḥ bhagavān āha /
analyzed: katamaḥ bhagavan vīrya āraṃbhaḥ bhagavān āha
translated: Blessed One, what is the undertaking of vigor? The Blessed One said,

original: śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena vīryamucyate phalānāṃ darśanaṃ /🔽yaduta srotaāpattiphalaṃ nāma vīryasthānaṃ /
analyzed: śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena vīryam ucyate phalānām darśanam  yat uta srotaāpatti phalam nāma vīrya sthānam
translated: Listen, Bhaiṣajyasena, the fruits are said to be the manifestation of vīrya.🔽Namely, the fruit of stream-entry is the place of vīrya.

original: sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ nāma vīryasthānaṃ /🔽anāgāmiphalaṃ nāma vīryasthānaṃ /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi phalam nāma vīrya sthānam  anāgāmi phalam nāma vīrya sthānam
translated: The fruit of once-returning is the place of vīrya.🔽The fruit of non-returning is the place of vīrya.

original: arhatvaphalamarhannirodhaśca nāma vīryasthānaṃ /
analyzed: arhatva phalam arhat nirodhaḥ ca nāma vīrya sthānam
translated: The fruit of arhatship and the cessation of an arhat is the place of vīrya.

original: pratyekabuddhaphalaṃ pratyekabuddhaphalajñānaṃ nāma vīryasthānaṃ /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha phalam pratyekabuddha phala jñānam nāma vīrya sthānam
translated: The fruit of a pratyekabuddha and the knowledge of the fruit of a pratyekabuddha is the place of vīrya.

original: bodhisattvabhūmiphalaṃ ca bodhisthānaṃ vīryasthānaṃ nāma /
analyzed: bodhisattva bhūmi phalam ca bodhisthānam vīrya sthānam nāma
translated: The fruit of the stage of a bodhisattva and the stage of enlightenment is called the place of vīrya.

original: ime bhaiṣajyasena vīryasthānānāṃ nāmāni /
analyzed: ime bhaiṣajyasena vīryasthānānām nāmāni
translated: These, Bhaiṣajyasena, are the names of the places of vīrya.

original: SaSū āha / kathaṃ bhagavan srotaāpanno darśayitavyaḥ srotaāpattiphalañca /
analyzed: āha katham bhagavan srotaāpannaḥ darśayitavyaḥ srotaāpatti phalam ca
translated: Bhaiṣajyasena said: How should one display the stream-enterer and the fruit of stream-entry, Blessed One?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tadyathāpi nāma kaścideva bhaiṣajyasena puruṣa vṛkṣaṃ vāpayeta /🔽vāpitasya vṛkṣasya tatraiva divase aṅkuraṃ viruhyeta /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kaścid eva bhaiṣajyasena puruṣa vṛkṣam vāpayeta  vāpitasya vṛkṣasya tatra eva divase aṅkuram viruhyeta
translated: It is just as if, Bhaiṣajyasena, some man were to plant a tree.🔽On the very day that the tree is planted, a sprout would grow.

original: yatraiva divase aṅkuraṃ viruhyanta tatraiva divase tadaṅkuraṃ yojanamadhastādgacchete /
analyzed: yatra eva divase aṅkuram viruhyanta tatra eva divase tad aṅkuram yojanam adhastāt gacchete
translated: On the very day that the sprout grows, that sprout would go down a yojana below.

original: dvitīyaśca puruṣa evameva vṛkṣaṃ vāpayeta /
analyzed: dvitīyaḥ ca puruṣaḥ evam eva vṛkṣam vāpayeta
translated: And a second man would plant a tree in the same way.

original: atha tatraivadivase vātakṣobhena tasya vṛkṣasya nāṅkurāni viruhyeranatha sa puruṣastasmāt
analyzed: atha tatra eva divase vāta kṣobhena tasya vṛkṣasya na aṅkurāni viruhyeran atha sa puruṣaḥ tasmāt
translated: Then on that very day, by the disturbance of the wind, the sprouts of that tree would not grow. Then that man would uproot that tree from that place.

original: sthānāt taṃ vṛkṣaṃ uddharetathānyataraśca puruṣaḥ kalahabhaṇḍanavigrahavivādaṃ kuryāt
analyzed: sthānāt tam vṛkṣam uddhara itathā anyataraḥ ca puruṣaḥ kalaha bhaṇḍana vigraha vivādam kuryāt
translated: And another man would quarrel, fight, dispute, and argue,

original: kimarthaṃ me bhūmiṃ khanasīti /
analyzed: kimartham me bhūmim khanasi iti
translated: saying, Why are you digging up my land?

original: SaSū tena ca kālena tena samayena rājā aśrauśīdevaṃ dvau puruṣau parasparakalahabhaṇḍanavigrahajātau🔽vivadataḥ tena ca rājñā tayordūtaḥ preṣitaḥ gaccha bhoḥ puruṣa tau dvau puruṣāvānaya /
analyzed: tena ca kālena tena samayena rājā aśrauśīdevam dvau puruṣau paraspara kalaha bhaṇḍana vigraha jātau  vivadataḥ tena ca rājñā tayoḥ dūtaḥ preṣitaḥ gaccha bhoḥ puruṣa tau dvau puruṣau ānaya
translated: At that time and at that moment, the king heard that those two men were quarreling, fighting, disputing, and arguing with each other.🔽And the king sent a messenger to them, saying, Go, good man, and bring those two men here.

original: evaṃ deveti sa puruṣastasya rājñaḥ pratiśrutya tvaramāṇarūpaḥ pradhātvā tau puruṣāvetadavocat rājā yuvayorāmantrayati /
analyzed: evam deva iti sa puruṣaḥ tasya rājñaḥ pratiśrutya tvaramāṇa rūpaḥ pradhātvā tau puruṣau etat avocat rājā yuvayoḥ āmantrayati
translated: Yes, Your Majesty, said that man, and having received the king's order, he quickly went and said this to those two men, The king summons you two.

original: atha tāvadeva tatraiva puruṣa bhītastrasta dvitīyaśca puruṣo 'bhīto 'nutrastaḥ yena sa rājā tenopanītāvupanīya rājña purataḥ sthāpitāvatha
analyzed: atha tāvat eva tatra eva puruṣa bhītaḥ trasta dvitīyaḥ ca puruṣaḥ bhītaḥ yena sa rājā tena upanītau upanīya rājña puratas sthāpitau atha
translated: Then at that very moment, one of the men was frightened and terrified, while the second man was unafraid and not terrified. They were brought before the king, and having been brought, they were placed in front of the king.

original: sa rājā tayorevamāha /
analyzed: sa rājā tayoḥ evam āha
translated: The king said to them:

original: kimidaṃ bho yuvayoḥ kalahabhaṇḍanavigrahavivādo jātaḥ
analyzed: kim idam bho yuvayoḥ kalaha bhaṇḍana vigraha vivādaḥ jātaḥ
translated: What is this, sirs, that you have a quarrel, dispute, contention, and strife?

original: SaSū atha khalu tau dvau puruṣāvutthāya taṃ rājānametadavocatāṃ śṛṇu mahārājāsmākaṃ na kiṃcit pṛthivīpradeśaḥ saṃvidyate /
analyzed: atha khalu tau dvau puruṣau utthāya tam rājānam etat avocatām śṛṇu mahā rāja asmākam na kiṃcid pṛthivī pradeśaḥ saṃvidyate
translated: Then those two men rose up and said to that king: Listen, great king, we have no land at all.

original: yācitake pṛthivīpradeśe vṛkṣo vāpitaḥ tatraiva divase vāpitastatraiva divase 'ṅkuraṃ patrāṇi puṣpāṇi phalāṇi ca prādurbhūtāni āmārdhaṃ pakvārdhaṃ 🔽ca /
analyzed: yācitake pṛthivī pradeśe vṛkṣaḥ vāpitaḥ tatra eva divase vāpitaḥ tatra eva divase ṅkuram patrāṇi puṣpāṇi phalāṇi ca prādurbhūtāni āma ardham pakva ardham  ca
translated: On a borrowed piece of land, a tree was planted on the same day, and on that same day, sprouts, leaves, flowers, and fruits appeared, half raw and half ripe.

original: etena ca dvitīyena puruṣeṇa tatraiva divase tasmin pṛthivīpradeśe vṛkṣo vāpita /
analyzed: etena ca dvitīyena puruṣeṇa tatra eva divase tasmin pṛthivī pradeśe vṛkṣaḥ vāpita
translated: And by that second man, on that same day, a tree was planted on that piece of land.

original: tasya ca vṛkṣasya nāṃkurāṇi rohanti /
analyzed: tasya ca vṛkṣasya na aṃkurāṇi rohanti
translated: And no sprouts grew from that tree.

original: vātena kṣubhitena na patrāṇi na puṣpāṇi na phalāni prādurbhūtāni /
analyzed: vātena kṣubhitena na patrāṇi na puṣpāṇi na phalāni prādurbhūtāni
translated: By the wind stirred up, no leaves, flowers, or fruits appeared.

original: na ca mahārāja yojanamadhastādasya mūlaṃ gacchati /
analyzed: na ca mahā rāja yojanam adhastāt asya mūlam gacchati
translated: And, great king, its root does not go down a yojana.

original: sa eṣa puruṣo mayā sārdhaṃ vivadati tavāparādha iti /
analyzed: saḥ eṣa puruṣaḥ mayā sārdham vivadati tava aparādhaḥ iti
translated: That man disputes with me, saying 'It is your fault.'

original: api tu ca deva svayameva parīkṣya jānīyān nātra mama kiṃcidaparādhaḥ saṃvidyate /
analyzed: api tu ca deva svayam eva parīkṣya jānīyāt na atra mama kiṃcid aparādhaḥ saṃvidyate
translated: But, Your Majesty, you should examine it yourself and know that I am in no way at fault here.

original: SaSū atha khalu sa rājā triṃśatkoṭyo 'mātyānāmāhūyaikadhye 'saṃpātyaivamāha /
analyzed: atha khalu sa rājā triṃśat koṭyaḥ mātyānām āhūya ekadhye saṃpātya evam āha
translated: Then the king summoned thirty koṭis of ministers, assembled them in one place, and said this:

original: kathayatha yūyaṃ /
analyzed: kathayatha yūyam
translated: Tell me, what do you think?

original: āmātyā āhuḥ kiṃ kathayāma mahārāja rājāha /
analyzed: āmātyāḥ āhuḥ kim kathayāma mahā rāja rājā āha
translated: The ministers said, What should we say, great king? The king said:

original: kva yuṣmābhi dṛṣṭaṃ vā śrutaṃ vā yatraiva divase vṛkṣo vāpitastatraiva divase 'ṅkuraṃ viruhyate /
analyzed: kva yuṣmābhi dṛṣṭam vā śrutam vā yatra eva divase vṛkṣaḥ vāpitaḥ tatra eva divase ṅkuram viruhyate
translated: Where have you seen or heard that a tree is planted on one day and its sprouts grow on the same day,

original: patrāṇi puṣpāni phalāni ca jāyante /
analyzed: patrāṇi puṣpāni phalāni ca jāyante
translated: and its leaves, flowers, and fruits are born?

original: pakvardhamāmārdhāni niścayamidaṃ bhavadbhiḥ kartavyaṃ /
analyzed: pakva ardha māma ardhāni niścayam idam bhavadbhiḥ kartavyam
translated: Half of them are ripe and half are unripe. You must make a definite statement about this.

original: atha khalu te amātya utthāyāsanāt taṃ rājānamevamāhuḥ asmākaṃ mahārāja niścayamidaṃ na śobhate kartuṃ na ca śakṣyāmo 'sya niścayaṃ vaktuṃ /
analyzed: atha khalu te amātyaḥ utthāya āsanāt tam rājānam evam āhuḥ asmākam mahā rāja niścayam idam na śobhate kartum na ca śakṣyāmaḥ u sya niścayam vaktum
translated: Then those ministers rose from their seats and said to the king: Great king, it is not fitting for us to make such a definite statement, and we will not be able to make a definite statement about this.

original: vismayamidaṃ mahārāja eṣa eva puruṣastāvatpraṣṭavyaḥ vada bhoḥ puruṣa kiṃ satyametamarthaṃ yadvadasi /
analyzed: vismayam idam mahā rāja eṣaḥ eva puruṣaḥ tāvat praṣṭavyaḥ vada bhoḥ puruṣa kim satyam etam artham yat vadasi
translated: This is amazing, great king. This man himself should be asked: 'Tell me, man, is it true what you say?'

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: satyaṃ mahārājaitamarthaṃ / rājāha /
analyzed: satyam mahā rāja etam artham rājā āha
translated: It is true, great king, this is the meaning. The king said:

original: na śrutaṃ naiva ca puṣyāma duḥśrāddheyaṃ vacastava /
analyzed: na śrutam nā eva ca puṣyāma duḥśrāddheyam vacaḥ tava
translated: We have neither heard nor experienced such an inauspicious statement of yours.

original: vṛkṣo yatra dine vuptastatraivāṅkurito dine /
analyzed: vṛkṣaḥ yatra dine vuptaḥ tatra eva aṅkuritaḥ dine
translated: The tree that was planted on one day has sprouted on the same day,

original: patrāḥ puṣpaṃ phalaṃ dattaṃ dine tatraiva bhāṣasi /
analyzed: patrāḥ puṣpam phalam dattam dine tatra eva bhāṣasi
translated: The leaves, flowers and fruit have been given on the same day, you speak thus.

original: kṛtāṃjāliḥ sa puruṣastaṃ rājānamathāvravīt
analyzed: kṛtāṃjāliḥ sa puruṣaḥ tam rājānam atha avravīt
translated: The man, with folded hands, then said to the king, Go yourself and plant the tree, see the sprout grows.

original: gaccha svayam vāpaya taruṃ paśya ruhyati aṅkuram //
analyzed: gaccha svayam vāpaya tarum paśya ruhyati aṅkuram
translated: Plant the tree yourself, see the sprout grows.

original: SaSū atha khalu sa rājā tṛṃśatkoṭibhiramātyaiḥ sārdhaṃ bahirniṣkrāmati /
analyzed: atha khalu sa rājā tṛṃśat koṭibhiḥ amātyaiḥ sārdham bahis niṣkrāmati
translated: Then indeed that king, together with thirty koṭis of ministers, goes out.

original: tau ca dvau puruṣau cārakāvarodhaṃ kārayati /
analyzed: tau ca dvau puruṣau cāraka avarodham kārayati
translated: And those two men are put in prison.

original: tataḥ sa rājā svayameva vṛkṣaṃ vāpayati /
analyzed: tatas sa rājā svayam eva vṛkṣam vāpayati
translated: Then that king himself plants the tree.

original: na ca sa vṛkṣo aṅkurāṇi dadāti na patrāṇi na puṣpāṇi na phalāni /
analyzed: na ca sa vṛkṣaḥ aṅkurāṇi dadāti na patrāṇi na puṣpāṇi na phalāni
translated: And that tree does not give sprouts, nor leaves, nor flowers, nor fruit.

original: atha sa rājā ruṣṭa evamāha /
analyzed: atha sa rājā ruṣṭaḥ evam āha
translated: Then that king, being angry, says thus:

original: gacchantu bhavantaḥ śīghramānayantu dārupāṭakāni kuṭhārāṇi /
analyzed: gacchantu bhavantaḥ śīghram ānayantu dāru pāṭakāni kuṭhārāṇi
translated: Go, sirs, quickly bring wood, axes.

original: yāvadānayitvā yastena puruṣeṇa vāpito vṛkṣaḥ sapatrāṇi puṣpaphalaḥ prādurbhūtaḥ taṃ vṛkṣaṃ roṣācchedayati /
analyzed: yāvat ānayitvā yaḥ tena puruṣeṇa vāpitaḥ vṛkṣaḥ sa patrāṇi puṣpa phalaḥ prādurbhūtaḥ tam vṛkṣam roṣāt chedayati
translated: Having brought, cut down that tree which was planted by that man, with leaves, flowers and fruit appeared, out of anger.

original: SaSū taṃ caikaṃ vṛkṣaṃ cchinnaṃ dvādaśa vṛkṣāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ dvādaśa vṛkṣā cchinnāścaturviṃśati
analyzed: tam ca ekam vṛkṣam chinnam dvādaśa vṛkṣāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ dvādaśa vṛkṣāḥ chinnāḥ caturviṃśati
translated: And when that one tree was cut down, twelve trees appeared. When the twelve trees were cut down, twenty-four trees

original: vṛkṣāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ saptaratnamayāḥ samūlāḥ sapatrāḥ sapahalāḥ sāṃkurāḥ atha tebhyāścaturviṃśati
analyzed: vṛkṣāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ sapta ratna mayāḥ sa mūlāḥ sa patrāḥ sa pahalāḥ sa aṃkurāḥ atha tebhyāḥ caturviṃśati
translated: appeared. They were made of the seven precious substances, with roots, leaves, flowers, and sprouts. Then from those twenty-four

original: vṛkṣebhyaścaturviṃśati pakṣiṇaḥ kurkuṭāḥ prādurbhūtāni /
analyzed: vṛkṣebhyaḥ caturviṃśati pakṣiṇaḥ kurkuṭāḥ prādurbhūtāni
translated: trees, twenty-four birds appeared, chickens.

original: suvarṇacūḍāni suvarṇatuṇḍāni saptaratnamayāni pakṣmāṇi /
analyzed: suvarṇa cūḍāni suvarṇa tuṇḍāni sapta ratna mayāni pakṣmāṇi
translated: They had golden crests and golden beaks, and their feathers were made of the seven precious substances.

original: atha khalu sa rājā roṣābhibhūtaḥ svahastena kuṭhāraṃ gṛhya taṃ vṛkṣaṃ parāhanati /
analyzed: atha khalu sa rājā roṣa abhibhūtaḥ sva hastena kuṭhāram gṛhya tam vṛkṣam parāhanati
translated: Then indeed that king, overcome with anger, took a hatchet in his own hand and struck that tree.

original: tataśca vṛkṣātparāhatādamṛtodakaṃ pravahati /
analyzed: tatas ca vṛkṣāt parāhatāt amṛta udakam pravahati
translated: And from that tree, when struck, nectar water flowed.

original: SaSū atha khalu
analyzed: atha khalu
translated: Then indeed that

original: sa rājā saṃvignamanā ājñāpayati /🔽gacchatha tau puruṣau tataścārakābandhanān mocayadhvamevam deveti /
analyzed: sa rājā saṃvigna manāḥ ājñāpayati  gacchatha tau puruṣau tatas cārakā bandhanāt mocayadhvam evam deva iti
translated: king, with a troubled mind, ordered,🔽Go and release those two men from their prison bonds. So be it, Your Majesty.

original: tatkṣanameva pradhāvitvā tau puruṣau tataścārakabandhanān mokṣayitvā yena taṃ vṛkṣaṃ tenopanīyataḥ atha sa rājā papriccha /
analyzed: tad kṣanam eva pradhāvitvā tau puruṣau tatas cāraka bandhanāt mokṣayitvā yena tam vṛkṣam tena upanīyataḥ atha sa rājā papriccha
translated: They immediately ran and released those two men from their prison bonds and led them to that tree. Then that king asked,

original: kim ayaṃ vṛkṣastvadvāpitaḥ eko bhūtvā cchidyamāno dviguṇaviddhyābhvardhamānaḥ yāvaccaturviṃśatudhā
analyzed: kim ayam vṛkṣaḥ tvad vāpitaḥ ekaḥ bhūtvā chidyamānaḥ dviguṇa viddhyā abhvardhamānaḥ yāvat caturviṃśatudhā
translated: When cut, it grows back twice as thick. It has become twenty-four times as thick.

original: gataḥ madvāpitastu vṛkṣo nāṃkurāṇi na patrāṇi na puṣpāṇi na phalāni dattavān tataḥ sa puruṣa evamāha /
analyzed: gataḥ mad vāpitaḥ tu vṛkṣaḥ na aṃkurāṇi na patrāṇi na puṣpāṇi na phalāni dattavān tatas sa puruṣaḥ evam āha
translated: But the tree I planted has not produced shoots, leaves, flowers, or fruits. Then that man said,

original: yādṛśāni mahārāja mama puṇyāṇi na tava tādṛśāni puṇyāni saṃvidyante /🔽SaSū atha khalu te triṃśadamātyakoṭyastasya puruṣasyobhau jānumaṇḍalau pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpyaivamāhuḥ tvayā rājyaṃ kārayitavyaṃ nāyaṃ
analyzed: yādṛśāni mahā rāja mama puṇyāṇi na tava tādṛśāni puṇyāni saṃvidyante  atha khalu te triṃśat amātya koṭyaḥ tasya puruṣasya ubhau jānu maṇḍalau pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya evam āhuḥ tvayā rājyam kārayitavyam na ayam
translated: Your merits are not like mine, great king.

original: pūrvimako rājā śobhate /
analyzed: pūrvimakaḥ rājā śobhate
translated: Then those thirty koṭis of ministers, placing both their knees on the ground, said this: You should rule the kingdom. This former king is not glorious.

original: atha khalu sa puruṣastān amātyān gāthābhiḥ pratyabhāṣata / //
analyzed: atha khalu sa puruṣaḥ tān amātyān gāthābhiḥ pratyabhāṣata
translated: Then that man replied to those ministers in verses:

original: rājyabhogaiśca me nārtho na dhānyena dhanena vā /
analyzed: rājya bhogaiḥ ca me nā arthaḥ na dhānyena dhanena vā
translated: I have no use for the enjoyments of a kingdom, nor for grain or wealth.

original: prasādo mama buddhebhyo bhaveyaṃ dvipadottamaḥ //
analyzed: prasādaḥ mama buddhebhyaḥ bhaveyam dvipada uttamaḥ
translated: I have faith in the Buddhas, may I become the best of two-legged beings.

original: brajennirvāṇadhātau hi śānte yatra tathāgataḥ
analyzed: brajet nirvāṇa dhātau hi śānte yatra tathāgataḥ
translated: I would go to the realm of nirvana, where the Tathagata is at peace,

original: deśeya dharmaṃ yuṣmākaṃ nirvāṇapuragāminaṃ //
analyzed: deśeya dharmam yuṣmākam nirvāṇa pura gāminam
translated: and teach you the Dharma that leads to the city of nirvana.

original: paryaṃkamabandhitvā pratijñāṃ akarottataḥ
analyzed: paryaṃkam a bandhitvā pratijñām akarot tatas
translated: He then made a vow, saying:

original: pūrvaṃ mayā kṛtaṃ pāpaṃ rājño bandhanamāgataḥ
analyzed: pūrvam mayā kṛtam pāpam rājñaḥ bandhanam āgataḥ
translated: The evil I have done in the past has brought me to this, being bound by the king.

original: idan tu kṛtvā praṇidhiṃ mama pāpakṣayo bhavet //
analyzed: idam tu kṛtvā praṇidhim mama pāpa kṣayaḥ bhavet
translated: But by making this vow, may my evil be destroyed.

original: SaSū atha khalu te caturviṃśati pakṣiṇakukkuṭakoṭyo vajratuṇḍena tūryāṇi parāhanati sma //
analyzed: atha khalu te caturviṃśati pakṣiṇa kukkuṭa koṭyaḥ vajratuṇḍena tūryāṇi parāhanati sma
translated: Then those twenty-four koṭis of birds struck the musical instruments with their vajra-like beaks.

original: atha khalu tena kālena tena samayena dvātriṃśati kūṭāgārasahasrāṇi prādurbhūtāni /
analyzed: atha khalu tena kālena tena samayena dvātriṃśati kūṭāgāra sahasrāṇi prādurbhūtāni
translated: Then at that time and at that moment, thirty-two thousand kūṭāgāras appeared.

original: ekaikaṃ ca kūṭāgāraṃ paṃcaviṃśatiyojanapramāṇaṃ prādurabhavat ekaikasmiṃśca kūṭāgāre paṃcaviṃśati pakṣiṇakukkuṭāḥ prādurbhūtāni /
analyzed: ekaikam ca kūṭāgāram paṃcaviṃśati yojana pramāṇam prādurabhavat ekaikasmin ca kūṭāgāre paṃcaviṃśati pakṣiṇa kukkuṭāḥ prādurbhūtāni
translated: And each kūṭāgāra appeared to be twenty-five yojanas in size. And in each kūṭāgāra, twenty-five birds appeared,

original: suvarṇacūḍāni suvarṇatuṇḍāni suvarṇamukhāni /
analyzed: suvarṇa cūḍāni suvarṇa tuṇḍāni suvarṇa mukhāni
translated: with golden crests, golden beaks, and golden faces.

original: te mānuṣyakaṃ vācaṃ niścārayanti /
analyzed: te mānuṣyakam vācam niścārayanti
translated: They spoke in human language:

original: asādhuste mahārāja yadbṛkṣa ccheditastvayā /
analyzed: asādhuḥ te mahā rāja yat bṛkṣa cheditaḥ tvayā
translated: Great king, it is not good that you have cut down this tree.

original: koṭīśatāni vṛkṣāṇāṃ caturviṃśat sthitāḥ punaḥ
analyzed: koṭī śatāni vṛkṣāṇām caturviṃśat sthitāḥ punar
translated: Twenty-four hundred koṭis of trees have appeared again.

original: pāpena karmaṇānena aniṣṭhaṃ bhokṣyase phalam
analyzed: pāpena karmaṇā anena aniṣṭham bhokṣyase phalam
translated: By this evil deed, you will experience the fruit to the end.

original: na jānīṣe kīdṛśaḥ sattvo yenāyaṃ vāpito drumaḥ
analyzed: na jānīṣe kīdṛśaḥ sattvaḥ yena ayam vāpitaḥ drumaḥ
translated: You do not know what kind of being this tree was planted by.

original: rājāha
analyzed: rājā āha
translated: The king said:

original: na jānāmi imaṃ arthaṃ vyakurudhavaṃ mahātapā /🔽kīdṛśo 'sau mahāsattvo yenāyaṃ vāpito drumaḥ pakṣiṇa āhuḥ
analyzed: na jānāmi imam artham vyakurudhavam mahā tapā  kīdṛśaḥ asau mahāsattvaḥ yena ayam vāpitaḥ drumaḥ pakṣiṇaḥ āhuḥ
translated: I do not know this meaning. Explain it, O great ascetic.🔽The birds said:

original: eṣo hi lokapradyoto utpatsyati vināyakaḥ
analyzed: eṣaḥ hi loka pradyotaḥ utpatsyati vināyakaḥ
translated: This one will be the Light of the World, the Leader,

original: mocakaḥ sarvasattvānāṃ saṃsārabhavabandhanāt //
analyzed: mocakaḥ sarva sattvānām saṃsāra bhava bandhanāt
translated: The liberator of all beings from the bondage of existence in the cycle of rebirth.

original: rājāha
analyzed: rājā āha
translated: The king said:

original: katamo dvitīyaḥ sattvo yasya vṛkṣaṃ na rūhati /
analyzed: katamaḥ dvitīyaḥ sattvaḥ yasya vṛkṣam na rūhati
translated: What is the second being for whom the tree does not grow?

original: kiṃ vā karma kṛtaṃ tena pāpamācakṣva me dvijāḥ
analyzed: kim vā karma kṛtam tena pāpam ācakṣva me dvijāḥ
translated: What evil deed has he done? Tell me, O birds.

original: pakṣiṇa āhuḥ
analyzed: pakṣiṇaḥ āhuḥ
translated: The birds said:

original: devadatto hi mūḍho 'sau yasya vṛkṣaṃ na rūhati /
analyzed: devadattaḥ hi mūḍhaḥ sau yasya vṛkṣam na rūhati
translated: Devadatta is the deluded one for whom the tree does not grow.

original: na kṛtaṃ kuśalaṃ kiṃcid ruhyate sya kathaṃ druma //
analyzed: na kṛtam kuśalam kiṃcid ruhyate sya katham druma
translated: He has not done any good, so how can a tree grow for him?🔽Then at that time, thirty koṭis of ministers,

original: SaSū atha khalu tena kālena tena samayena tṛṃśatkoṭya āmātyānāmiman dharmaparyāyaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu tena kālena tena samayena tṛṃśat koṭyaḥ āmātyānām iman dharmaparyāyam
translated: having heard this Dharma discourse,

original: śrutvā sarve daśabhūmipratiṣṭhitā bodhisattvā abhijñāpratilabdhāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ sa ca
analyzed: śrutvā sarve daśa bhūmi pratiṣṭhitāḥ bodhisattvāḥ abhijñā pratilabdhāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ sa ca
translated: all became established in the ten grounds, bodhisattvas who had attained the higher knowledges, and that king

original: rājā daśabhūmipratiṣṭhitaḥ kuśaladharmābhisamayamanuprāptaḥ //
analyzed: rājā daśa bhūmi pratiṣṭhitaḥ kuśala dharma abhisamayam anuprāptaḥ
translated: became established in the ten grounds and attained the realization of wholesome dharmas.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃgha said this to the Blessed One:

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo yattriṃśatkoṭyo janānāṃ daśabhūmipratiṣṭhitā abhijñāpratilabdhā
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat triṃśat koṭyaḥ janānām daśa bhūmi pratiṣṭhitāḥ abhijñā pratilabdhā
translated: What is the cause, Blessed One, what is the condition, that thirty koṭis of people, established in the ten grounds, have attained the higher knowledges?

original: saṃvṛttāḥ bhagavān āha śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena vyākariṣyāmi /
analyzed: saṃvṛttāḥ bhagavān āha śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena vyākariṣyāmi
translated: The Blessed One said, Listen, Bhaiṣajya-saṃgha, I will explain.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāṃ smitaṃ prāduṣcakāra /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām smitam prāduṣcakāra
translated: Then at that time the Blessed One manifested a smile.

original: yadacetane vṛkṣe manuṣyā jāyaṃte /
analyzed: yat acetane vṛkṣe manuṣyāḥ jāyaṃte
translated: that humans are born from an unconscious tree.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: na me bhagavan dṛṣṭaṃ na śrutaṃ yadacetane vṛkṣe manuṣyā jāyante /
analyzed: na me bhagavan dṛṣṭam na śrutam yat acetane vṛkṣe manuṣyāḥ jāyante
translated: Blessed One, I have neither seen nor heard that humans are born from an unconscious tree.

original: sa bhagavān āha icchasi tvaṃ bhaiṣajyasena draṣṭuṃ tadahaṃ sāṃprataṃ darśayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: sa bhagavān āha icchasi tvam bhaiṣajyasena draṣṭum tat aham sāṃpratam darśayiṣyāmi
translated: The Blessed One said, Do you wish to see that, Bhaiṣajyasena? I will show it to you now.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: icchāmi bhagavannicchāmi sugata /
analyzed: icchāmi bhagavan icchāmi sugata
translated: I wish to, Blessed One, I wish to, Sugata.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhagavāṃścandrāvatikṣetrastathāgatastasyāṃ velāyāṃ śatapuṇyavicitritaṃ svaṃ bāhuṃ prasārayati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān candrāvatikṣetraḥ tathāgataḥ tasyām velāyām śata puṇya vicitritam svam bāhum prasārayati sma
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathagata of the Candravati field, at that time extended his arm adorned with a hundred merits.

original: tataśca bāhutaḥ koṭīśatasahasraṃ janakāyānāṃ prādurabhavatekaikaśca janakāyo bāhuśataṃ prasārya nānāgandhavilepanaistathāgatamabhyavakiranti
analyzed: tatas ca bāhutaḥ koṭī śata sahasram jana kāyānām prādurabhavat ekaikaḥ ca jana kāyaḥ bāhu śatam prasārya nānā gandha vilepanaiḥ tathāgatam abhyavakiranti
translated: From that arm, a multitude of people appeared, each with a hundred arms, scattering various fragrances and ointments on the Tathagata.

original: atha sa bhagavāṃścandrāvatikṣetrastathāgato bhaiṣajyasenaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamāmantrayati /
analyzed: atha sa bhagavān candrāvatikṣetraḥ tathāgataḥ bhaiṣajyasenam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āmantrayati
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathagata of the Candravati field, addressed the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Bhaisajyasena:

original: paśyasi tvaṃ bhaiṣajyasena eṣa janakāyastathāgataṃ nānāgandhamālyavilepanairabhyavakiranti /
analyzed: paśyasi tvam bhaiṣajyasena eṣa jana kāyaḥ tathāgatam nānā gandha mālya vilepanaiḥ abhyavakiranti
translated: Do you see, Bhaisajyasena, this multitude of people scattering various fragrances, garlands, and ointments on the Tathagata?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: paśyāmi bhagavan paśyāmi sugata /
analyzed: paśyāmi bhagavan paśyāmi sugata
translated: I see, Blessed One, I see, Sugata.

original: sa bhagavān āha ete acetanā janakāyāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ eta acetanā manuṣyāḥ pratyājātāḥ //
analyzed: sa bhagavān āha ete acetanāḥ jana kāyāḥ prādurbhūtāḥ eta acetanāḥ manuṣyāḥ pratyājātāḥ
translated: The Blessed One said: These are the mindless multitudes that have appeared, these are the mindless humans that have been reborn.

original: atha khalu teṣāṃ koṭīśatasahasrāṇāmekaikasya yadbāhuśataṃ te sarve vikīryante /
analyzed: atha khalu teṣām koṭī śata sahasrāṇām ekaikasya yat bāhu śatam te sarve vikīryante
translated: Then all the hundred arms of each of those kotis of people were scattered.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvastaṃ dṛṣṭvā bhagavantametadavocat
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tam dṛṣṭvā bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃjīva, having seen that, said this to the Blessed One:

original: kimidaṃ bhagavan kimidaṃ sugataḥ yan manuṣyāṇāṃ muhūrtamātreṇa bāhuśataṃ vikīrṇam
analyzed: kim idam bhagavan kim idam sugataḥ yat manuṣyāṇām muhūrta mātreṇa bāhu śatam vikīrṇam
translated: What is this, Blessed One? What is this, Sugata? That in just a moment of humans, a hundred arms have been scattered.

original: yadi bhagavaṃcchatabāhavo na mucyante kaḥ punarvādo dvibāhukā manuṣyā mokṣyante /
analyzed: yadi bhagavaṃt śata bāhavaḥ na mucyante kaḥ punar vādaḥ dvi bāhukāḥ manuṣyāḥ mokṣyante
translated: If, Blessed One, those with a hundred arms are not liberated, what to speak of those with two arms, humans will not be liberated.

original: bhagavān āha evameva bhaiṣajyasenācetanāḥ sattvā jāyante /
analyzed: bhagavān āha evam eva bhaiṣajya senā cetanāḥ sattvāḥ jāyante
translated: The Blessed One said, It is just so, Bhaiṣajya-saṃjīva. Sentient beings are born without consciousness.

original: acetanā niruddhyante /
analyzed: acetanāḥ niruddhyante
translated: They cease without consciousness.

original: asmākamapi bhaiṣajyasena śarīramacetanabhūtaṃ manyitavyaṃ /
analyzed: asmākam api bhaiṣajyasena śarīram acetana bhūtam manyitavyam
translated: Bhaiṣajya-saṃjīva, our bodies also should be considered to be without consciousness.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: katame bhagavan sattvā ye daharāḥ katame vṛddhāḥ bhagavān āha santi bhaiṣajyasena daharāḥ sattvā santi vṛddhāḥ āha /
analyzed: katame bhagavan sattvāḥ ye daharāḥ katame vṛddhāḥ bhagavān āha santi bhaiṣajyasena daharāḥ sattvā santi vṛddhāḥ āha
translated: Blessed One, which sentient beings are young and which are old? The Blessed One said, Bhaiṣajya-saṃjīva, there are young sentient beings and there are old ones. He said:

original: katame bhagavan daharā katame vṛddhāḥ āha /
analyzed: katame bhagavan daharā katame vṛddhāḥ āha
translated: Blessed One, which are the young and which are the old? He said:

original: ye te sāmprataṃvikīrṇā te vṛddhāḥ ye te vṛkṣebhyo nirjātāste daharā /
analyzed: ye te sāmpratam vikīrṇā te vṛddhāḥ ye te vṛkṣebhyaḥ nirjātāḥ te daharā
translated: Those that have just been scattered are the old ones. Those that have emerged from the trees are the young ones.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: icchāmi bhagavan daharāṇi sattvāni draṣṭum
analyzed: icchāmi bhagavan daharāṇi sattvāni draṣṭum
translated: Blessed One, I wish to see the young sentient beings.

original: SaSū atha khalu sa bhagavāṃścandrāvatikṣetrastathāgato dakṣiṇaṃ pāṇitalaṃ prasārayati /
analyzed: atha khalu sa bhagavān candrāvatikṣetraḥ tathāgataḥ dakṣiṇam pāṇi talam prasārayati
translated: Then that Blessed One, the Tathagata of the Candravati field, extended his right palm.

original: atha daśabhyo digbhyaḥ koṭīśatasahasraṃ janakāyānāṃ āgacchanti /
analyzed: atha daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ koṭī śata sahasram jana kāyānām āgacchanti
translated: Then from the ten directions, a multitude of one hundred thousand kotis came.

original: adhastādūrdhvāyān diśi paṃcāśat koṭī janakāyasyāgacchanti /
analyzed: diśi paṃcāśat koṭī jana kāyasya āgacchanti
translated: From the upper direction, fifty kotis of people came.

original: āgatvā ca te janakāyā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya na ca tathāgatamālapanti na saṃlapanti tūṣṇīṃbhāvenādhivāsayanti sma /
analyzed: āgatvā ca te jana kāyāḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya na ca tathāgatam ālapanti na saṃlapanti tūṣṇīṃbhāvena adhivāsayanti sma
translated: And having come, those multitudes bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, and did not converse with the Tathagata, did not converse, but remained silent.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat kimete bhagavan sattvāstathāgataṃ nālapanti na saṃlapanti
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kim ete bhagavan sattvāḥ tathāgatam na ālapanti na saṃlapanti  /
translated: Then the Bodhisattva mahasattva Bhaisajyasena said this to the Blessed One: Why, Blessed One, do these beings not converse with the Tathagata, do not converse,

original: tūṣṇīṃbhāvenādhivāsayanti /
analyzed: tūṣṇīṃbhāvena adhivāsayanti
translated: but remain silent?

original: bhagavān āha na jānāsi bhaiṣajyasena acetanaḥ pṛthivīpradeśo nālapanti na saṃlapanti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha na jānāsi bhaiṣajyasena acetanaḥ pṛthivī pradeśaḥ na ālapanti na saṃlapanti
translated: The Blessed One said: Bhaisajyasena, you do not know that an insensate region of earth does not converse, does not converse,

original: na dharmaskandhaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: na dharma skandham prajānāti
translated: and does not understand the aggregate of the Dharma.

original: tatkasya hetoḥ ihaikatyā bhaiṣajyasena daharā sattvāḥ notpādaṃ jānanti na nirodhaṃ jānanti /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ iha ekatyāḥ bhaiṣajyasena daharā sattvāḥ na utpādam jānanti na nirodham jānanti
translated: Why is that? Here, some young beings do not know about arising, do not know about cessation.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca na jarā na vyādhirna śoko na paridevaḥ na priyaviprayogo nāpriyasaṃprayogaḥ na priyādvinābhāvaḥ na maraṇaṃ nākālamṛtyu /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca na jarā na vyādhiḥ na śokaḥ na paridevaḥ na priya viprayogaḥ na apriya saṃprayogaḥ na priyāt vinābhāvaḥ na maraṇam na akāla mṛtyu
translated: And having seen, there is no old age, no disease, no sorrow, no lamentation, no separation from what is loved, no association with what is not loved, no suffering from the loss of what is loved, no death, no untimely death.

original: nāpi tāni sarvakaṭukāni duḥkhāṇi dṛṣṭvā udyogamāpadyante kutaste jñāsyanti /
analyzed: na api tāni sarva kaṭukāni duḥkhāṇi dṛṣṭvā udyogam āpadyante kutas te jñāsyanti
translated: And having seen all those bitter sufferings, they do not strive. How will they know?

original: punaḥ punaste bhaiṣajyasena śikṣayitavyāni /
analyzed: punar punar te bhaiṣajyasena śikṣayitavyāni
translated: Again and again, Bhaisajyasena, they must be taught.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat kuto bhagavan daharā sattvā āgacchanti /🔽kutaścyavanti /
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kutas bhagavan daharāḥ sattvāḥ āgacchanti  kutas cyavanti
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahasattva Bhaisajyasena said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, from where do young beings come?🔽And from where do they pass away?

original: kutropapadyante /
analyzed: kutra upapadyante
translated: Where are they reborn?

original: ye dharmaṃ na jānanti na buddhyanti /
analyzed: ye dharmam na jānanti na buddhyanti
translated: Those who do not know the Dharma, who do not understand it?

original: bhagavān āha śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena yan mānuṣyakamātmabhāvaṃ pratigṛhṇanti /🔽tanna rupyakāreṇa kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: bhagavān āha śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena yat mānuṣyakam ātmabhāvam pratigṛhṇanti  tat na rupyakāreṇa kṛtam
translated: The Blessed One said, Listen, Bhaisajyasena, to the human body that they take on.🔽It is not made by a goldsmith.

original: na cīmarakāreṇa kṛtaṃ /🔽na kāṣṭhakāreṇa kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: na cīmarakāreṇa kṛtam  na kāṣṭhakāreṇa kṛtam
