translated: It is not made by a potter.🔽It is not made by a woodworker.

original: na kulālena kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: na kulālena kṛtam
translated: It is not made by a potter.

original: na rājabhayenotpadyate /
analyzed: na rāja bhayena utpadyate
translated: It does not arise from fear of the king.

original: strīpuruṣasaṃyogāt pāpena karmaṇā saṃyuktaṃ saṃbhavati /
analyzed: strī puruṣa saṃyogāt pāpena karmaṇā saṃyuktam saṃbhavati
translated: It arises from the union of a man and a woman, and from being connected with evil actions.

original: punaḥ punaśca teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ śilpāni śikṣāpayanti /
analyzed: punar punar ca teṣām sattvānām śilpāni śikṣāpayanti
translated: And they repeatedly teach those beings the crafts.

original: anantaṃ ca teṣāṃ kaṭukaṃ duḥkhaṃ saṃbhavati /
analyzed: anantam ca teṣām kaṭukam duḥkham saṃbhavati
translated: And for them there is endless and bitter suffering.

original: kaṭukā vedanāḥ tatra teṣāṃ pūrvakṛtānāṃ pāpakānāṃ karmaṇāṃ vipākamanubhavanti /
analyzed: kaṭukāḥ vedanāḥ tatra teṣām pūrva kṛtānām pāpakānām karmaṇām vipākam anubhavanti
translated: They experience the ripening of their previously done evil actions there, with bitter feelings.

original: ihaiva te bhaiṣajyasena daharāḥ sattvā āgatā ya ete nālapanti na saṃlapanti
analyzed: iha eva te bhaiṣajyasena daharāḥ sattvāḥ āgatāḥ ye ete na ālapanti na saṃlapanti
translated: Here, Bhaisajyasena, those young beings who have come but do not speak, do not converse,

original: nottiṣṭhanti ya īdṛśān duḥkhāṃ vedanāmanubhavanti /
analyzed: na uttiṣṭhanti ye īdṛśān duḥkhām vedanām anubhavanti
translated: who experience such suffering, do not speak, do not converse.

original: anena kāraṇena bhaiṣajyasena nālapanti na saṃlapanti /
analyzed: anena kāraṇena bhaiṣajyasena na ālapanti na saṃlapanti
translated: For this reason, Bhaisajyasena, they do not speak, do not converse.

original: evaṃ te bhaiṣajyasena daharāḥ sattvāḥ kuśalamajānānāḥ notpādaṃ jānanti na nirodhaṃ jānanti /
analyzed: evam te bhaiṣajyasena daharāḥ sattvāḥ kuśalam a jānānāḥ na utpādam jānanti na nirodham jānanti
translated: Thus, Bhaisajyasena, those young beings, not knowing what is wholesome, do not know arising, do not know cessation.

original: na ca te mānuṣyakamātmabhāvaṃ pratilapsyante /
analyzed: na ca te mānuṣyakam ātmabhāvam pratilapsyante
translated: And they will not obtain a human body.

original: ime ucyante bhaiṣajyasena daharāḥ sattvā /
analyzed: ime ucyante bhaiṣajyasena daharāḥ sattvā
translated: These, Bhaisajyasena, are called young beings.

original: SaSū āha / kathaṃ bhagavan daharāḥ sattvā utpadyante kathaṃ nirudhyante /
analyzed: āha katham bhagavan daharāḥ sattvāḥ utpadyante katham nirudhyante
translated: Bhaiṣajya-saṃpratī-śa says: How, Blessed One, do young beings arise? How do they cease?

original: bhagavān āha tadyathāpi nāma bhaiṣajyasena kaścideva puruṣa agniṃ kāṣṭhena parimārjayetta tasyānupūrveṇa taṃ kāṣṭhamagninā pradīpyeta /
analyzed: bhagavān āha tat yathā api nāma bhaiṣajyasena kaścid eva puruṣa agnim kāṣṭhena tasya anupūrveṇa tam kāṣṭham agninā pradīpyeta
translated: The Blessed One said, Just as, Bhaisajyasena, if some man were to rub a fire stick on a piece of wood, gradually that piece of wood would be set on fire by the fire stick.

original: evameva bhaiṣajyasena mānuṣyātmabhāvaṃ prathamaṃ saṃjāyate /
analyzed: evam eva bhaiṣajyasena mānuṣya ātmabhāvam prathamam saṃjāyate
translated: In the same way, Bhaisajyasena, the human body is first born.

original: jātaṃ ca san vedanāṃ vedayati /
analyzed: jātam ca san vedanām vedayati
translated: And being born, it experiences feeling.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: ko trābhijāto jātaḥ kaḥ parinirvṛtaḥ bhagavān āha buddha eva bhaiṣajyasenābhijāto jātaḥ tathāgata eva parinirvṛtaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ tra abhijātaḥ jātaḥ kaḥ parinirvṛtaḥ bhagavān āha buddhaḥ eva bhaiṣajyasena abhijātaḥ jātaḥ tathāgataḥ eva parinirvṛtaḥ
translated: Who is born as a noble birth? Who is completely liberated? The Blessed One said, The Buddha, Bhaisajyasena, is born as a noble birth. The Tathagata alone is completely liberated.

original: SaSū tadyathāpi nāma bhaiṣajyasena kasmiṃcidandhakāragṛhe timirāgāre rājñā
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma bhaiṣajyasena kasmiṃcid andhakāra gṛhe timira āgāre rājñā
translated: Just as, Bhaisajyasena, in some dark house, in a house of darkness, the king

original: puruṣo bandhanāvarodhaḥ kṛtaḥ syāt tatra sa puruṣo 'ndhakāragṛhe praviṣṭaḥ antargṛhe
analyzed: puruṣaḥ bandhana avarodhaḥ kṛtaḥ syāt tatra sa puruṣaḥ ndhakāra gṛhe praviṣṭaḥ antargṛhe
translated: has a man imprisoned. There, that man, having entered the dark house, in the inner house

original: timiraṃ timirāgāraṃ paśyet athānyaḥ ka kaścit puruṣaḥ pūrvaduḥkhavedanābhirdṛṣṭaścintayennaṣṭa
analyzed: timiram timirāgāram paśyet atha anyaḥ ka kaścid puruṣaḥ pūrva duḥkha vedanābhiḥ dṛṣṭaḥ cintayet naṣṭa
translated: sees darkness, a house of darkness. Then some other man, having seen him before, thinks, 'Lost

original: eṣa puruṣaḥ anabhyasitaḥ duḥkho jīvite vināśaṃ yāsyati /
analyzed: eṣa puruṣaḥ an abhyasitaḥ duḥkhaḥ jīvite vināśam yāsyati
translated: is this man, unpracticed, will perish in life through suffering.'

original: sa tatrāgnimānayitvā tatrābhyantargṛhe sukṣmamagnim cchorayet sa ca puruṣaścārakāvaruddhastamagniraśmiṃ
analyzed: sa tatra agnim ānayitvā tatra abhyantargṛhe sukṣmam agnim chorayet sa ca puruṣaḥ cāraka avaruddhaḥ tam agni raśmim
translated: There he should bring fire and place it inside the house, and that man confined in the prison should see that ray of fire.

original: paśyeddṛṣṭvā cāśvasto bhaved utsāhaṃ ca vardhayet sa cāgniḥ kenacideva hetunā prajvaleta /
analyzed: paśyet dṛṣṭvā ca āśvastaḥ bhavet utsāham ca vardhayet sa ca agniḥ kenacid eva hetunā prajvaleta
translated: Having seen it, he would be reassured and increase his enthusiasm. And that fire, for some reason, would blaze up.

original: tena cāgninjvālena tadgṛhaṃ samantataḥ prajvalet sa ca puruṣastatraiva dahyet taṃ ca dagdhaṃ rājā śrutvā cintāyāsamāpadyeta /
analyzed: tena ca agninjvālena tat gṛham samantataḥ prajvalet sa ca puruṣaḥ tatra eva dahyet tam ca dagdham rājā śrutvā cintā āyāsam āpadyeta
translated: And by that flame of fire, the house would be completely ablaze. And that man would be burned right there. And the king, having heard that he was burned, would fall into a state of worry.

original: tasyaivaṃ bhavenna bhūyo 'haṃ svaviṣaye kaṃcit sattvaṃ cārakāvarodhaṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: tasya evam bhavet na bhūyas ham sva viṣaye kaṃcid sattvam cāraka avarodham kariṣyāmi
translated: He would think like this: I will no longer imprison any being in my realm.

original: atha sa rājā teṣāṃ svaviṣayanivāsināṃ sattvānāmevaṃ samāśvāsayet mā yūyaṃ bhavantaḥ sattvā bhāyatha mā utrasatha /
analyzed: atha sa rājā teṣām sva viṣaya nivāsinām sattvānām evam samāśvāsayet mā yūyam bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ bhāyatha mā utrasatha
translated: Then that king would reassure those beings living in his realm like this: You beings, do not be afraid, do not be terrified.

original: abhayaṃ yuṣmākaṃ bhavatuḥ na mama viṣaye bhūyo daṇḍopacāraṃ vā
analyzed: abhayam yuṣmākam bhavatuḥ na mama viṣaye bhūyas daṇḍa upacāram vā
translated: Let there be safety for you. From now on, there will be no more punishment or

original: bandhanāvarodhaṃ vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bandhana avarodham vā bhaviṣyati
translated: imprisonment in my realm.

original: na ca kasyacit sattvasya jīvitavināśaṃ kariṣyāmi /
analyzed: na ca kasyacid sattvasya jīvita vināśam kariṣyāmi
translated: And I will not destroy the life of any being.

original: nirbhayā bhavantaḥ sattvā yūyaṃ bhavatha /
analyzed: nirbhayāḥ bhavantaḥ sattvāḥ yūyam bhavatha
translated: Be fearless, beings!

original: SaSū evameva bhaiṣajyasena tathāgataḥ sarvakleśadagdhaḥ sarvavyādhipraśāntaḥ yathā sa puruṣo gṛhadāhāt svakāyaṃ dahati /🔽sarvasattvānāmarthāya hitāya sukhāya ca
analyzed: evam eva bhaiṣajyasena tathāgataḥ sarva kleśa dagdhaḥ sarva vyādhi praśāntaḥ yathā sa puruṣaḥ gṛha dāhāt sva kāyam dahati  sarva sattvānām arthāya hitāya sukhāya ca
translated: You should be so, O Bhaiṣajyasena! In the same way, the Tathāgata, having burned all afflictions and pacified all illnesses, is like that man who burns his own body out of fear of fire in the house.

original: pratipanno bhavati /🔽sattvān vadhabandhanāvarodheṣu parimocayedevameva tathāgato rāgadveṣamohamalaprahīṇaḥ🔽sarvasattvānān dīpa iva loka utpannaḥ sattvān mocayati narakatiryakpretāsurakāyebhyaḥ
analyzed: pratipannaḥ bhavati  sattvān vadha bandhana avarodheṣu parimocayet evam eva tathāgataḥ rāga dveṣa moha mala prahīṇaḥ  dīpaḥ iva loke utpannaḥ sattvān mocayati naraka tiryak preta asura kāyebhyaḥ
translated: He is engaged for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of all beings.🔽He liberates beings from being killed, bound, and imprisoned. In the same way, the Tathāgata, having abandoned the impurities of desire, hatred, and delusion,

original: daharāṃśca sattvāṃ
analyzed: daharān ca sattvān
translated: like a lamp for the world, has appeared for the sake of liberating beings from the realms of hell-beings, animals, hungry ghosts, and asuras.🔽He liberates young beings

original: vṛddhāṃśca sattvān mocayati /
analyzed: vṛddhān ca sattvān mocayati
translated: and old beings.

original: SaSū atha tāvadevoparyantarīkṣādimā gāthā niścacārā / //
analyzed: atha tāvat eva upari antarīkṣāt imāḥ gāthāḥ niścacārā
translated: Then, at that very moment, these verses resounded from the sky above:

original: aho kṣetraṃ jinakṣetraṃ sukṣtremabhisaṃskṛtaṃ /
analyzed: aho kṣetram jina kṣetram
translated: Ah! The Buddha-field is the Victor's field, well-purified by the Victor.

original: vuptāni yatra bījāni na vināśaṃ brajanti hi /
analyzed: vuptāni yatra bījāni na vināśam brajanti hi
translated: Here, seeds that are sown do not perish.

original: buddhakṣetraṃ jinakṣetraṃ praśastaṃ jinaśāsanaṃ /
analyzed: buddhakṣetram jina kṣetram praśastam jina śāsanam
translated: The Buddha-field is the Victor's field, praised is the Victor's teaching.

original: śāstā karotyupāyaṃ hi sarvasattvaparigrahe /
analyzed: śāstā karoti upāyam hi sarva sattva parigrahe
translated: The Teacher employs skillful means in accepting all beings.

original: sthito nirvānadhātau san dṛśyate dharaṇītale /
analyzed: sthitaḥ nirvāna dhātau san dṛśyate dharaṇī tale
translated: Abiding in the realm of nirvana, he is seen on the surface of the earth.

original: śāntaṃ kṛtvā sarvalokaṃ buddhaḥ śodheti dakṣiṇāṃ /
analyzed: śāntam kṛtvā sarva lokam buddhaḥ śodha iti dakṣiṇām
translated: Having pacified the entire world, the Buddha purifies the offerings.

original: moceti navakān sattvān moceti ca purāṇakān
analyzed: moca iti navakān sattvān moca iti ca purāṇakān
translated: He liberates the newly arisen beings and also the ancient ones.

original: mocayitvānupūrveṇa sarvasattvāstridhātukāt
analyzed: mocayitvā ānupūrveṇa sarva sattvāḥ tridhātukāt
translated: Having liberated them in sequence, all beings from the three realms,

original: baddhā hi narakadvārastiryakpretā vimocitāḥ
analyzed: baddhāḥ hi naraka dvāraḥ tiryak pretāḥ vimocitāḥ
translated: The doors to the hells are closed, and the animals and hungry ghosts are freed.

original: śāntiḥ kṛtā hi lokesmin paraloke sukhaṃ kṛtaṃ //
analyzed: śāntiḥ kṛtā hi loke asmin para loke sukham kṛtam
translated: Peace is brought to this world, and happiness is brought to the next world.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyāṃ smitaṃ prāduṣcakāra / āha ca
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyām smitam prāduṣcakāra āha ca
translated: Then the Blessed One smiled at that time and said:

original: sādhu darśanu sādhūnāṃ buddhānām sādhu darśanaṃ /
analyzed: sādhu sādhūnām buddhānām
translated: Good is the sight of the virtuous, good is the sight of the Buddhas,

original: sādhu dharmaguṇaḥ kṣetraṃ saṃghasāmagridarśanam
analyzed: sādhu dharma guṇaḥ kṣetram saṃgha sāmagri darśanam
translated: Good is the field of the qualities of the Dharma, good is the sight of the unity of the Sangha.

original: sādhu saṃghātanirdeśaṃ sarvapāpavināśanaṃ
analyzed: sādhu saṃghāta nirdeśam sarva pāpa vināśanam
translated: Good is the teaching of the unity of the Sangha, which destroys all evil,

original: ye śroṣyanti idaṃ sūtraṃ padaṃ prāpsyantyanuttaraṃ
analyzed: ye śroṣyanti idam sūtram padam prāpsyanti anuttaram
translated: Those who hear this sutra will attain the unsurpassed stage.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo yena bhagavāṃstenāṃjaliṃ praṇamayya bhagavantametadavocat ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim praṇamayya bhagavantam etat avocat kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Bhaisajyasena, having bowed with folded hands to the Blessed One, said this to the Blessed One: What is the cause, Blessed One? What is the reason for this smile?

original: pratyayaḥ smitasya prāduṣkaraṇāya /
analyzed: pratyayaḥ smitasya prāduṣkaraṇāya
translated: The reason for the manifestation of a smile.

original: bhagavān āha paśyasi tvaṃ kulaputraitāni daharāṇi sattvāni /
analyzed: bhagavān āha paśyasi tvam kula putra etāni daharāṇi sattvāni
translated: The Blessed One said, Son of noble family, do you see these young beings?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said,

original: paśyāmi bhagavan paśyāmi sugata /
analyzed: paśyāmi bhagavan paśyāmi sugata
translated: I see them, Blessed One, I see them, Sugata.

original: bhagavān āha sarva ete bhaiṣajyasenādyaiva daśabhūmipratiṣṭhitā bodhisattvā bhaviṣyanti //
analyzed: bhagavān āha sarve ete bhaiṣajyasena adya eva daśa bhūmi pratiṣṭhitāḥ bodhisattvāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: The Blessed One said, All of these, Bhaisajyasena, will today attain the tenth stage of the bodhisattva.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'śītiryojanasahasrāṇyūrdhavamuparyantarīkṣe
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ śītiḥ yojana sahasrāṇi ūrdhavam upari antarīkṣe
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahasattva Bhaisajyasena stood in the sky above, eighty thousand yojanas up,

original: sthādathāśītirdevaputrakoṭīsahasrāṇi bhagavata upari puṣpavarṣaṃ pravarṣanti te ca
analyzed: sthāt atha aśītiḥ devaputra koṭī sahasrāṇi bhagavataḥ upari puṣpa varṣam pravarṣanti te ca
translated: and eighty thousand kotis of devas rained down a shower of flowers on the Blessed One from above,

original: daharāḥ sattvā dṛṣṭvā sarve 'ñjalayaḥ kṛtvā namaskurvanti /
analyzed: daharāḥ sattvāḥ dṛṣṭvā sarve ñjalayaḥ kṛtvā namaskurvanti
translated: and those young beings, having seen this, all put their palms together and bowed down.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo antarīkṣastha evaṃ vāg bhāṣate /
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ antarīkṣa sthaḥ evam vāc bhāṣate
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahasattva Bhaisajyasena, standing in the sky, spoke these words:

original: yena trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātuḥ śabdenāpūrayati /
analyzed: yena tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ śabdena āpūrayati
translated: With a sound that fills the trichiliocosm,

original: dvātriṃśan mahānarakopapannāḥ sattvāstaṃ śabdaṃ śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: dvātriṃśat mahānaraka upapannāḥ sattvāḥ tam śabdam śṛṇvanti
translated: the beings who have been reborn in the thirty-two great hells hear that sound.

original: dvātriṃśacca devanikāyāstaṃ śabdaṃ śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: dvātriṃśat ca devanikāyāḥ tam śabdam śṛṇvanti
translated: The thirty-two classes of gods hear that sound.

original: trisāhasramahāsāhasraśca lokadhātuḥ ṣaḍvikāraṃ prakampitaḥ caturaśītiśca nāgarājasahasrāṇi mahāsamudre saṃkṣubdāni /
analyzed: tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ ca lokadhātuḥ ṣaṣ vikāram prakampitaḥ caturaśītiḥ ca nāga rāja sahasrāṇi mahā samudre saṃkṣubdāni
translated: The great trichiliocosm shakes in six ways, and eighty-four thousand nāga kings are agitated in the great ocean.

original: triṃśat koṭīsahasrāṇi rākṣasānām imaṃ jaṃbūdvīpamāgatāni /
analyzed: triṃśat koṭī sahasrāṇi rākṣasānām imam jaṃbūdvīpam āgatāni
translated: Thirty thousand koṭis of rākṣasas come to this Jambudvīpa.

original: paṃcaviṃśat koṭīsahasrāṇi pretānāṃ yakṣānāṃ rākṣasānāmaḍakavatyāṃ rājadhānyāmāgatāni bhagavataḥ purato mahāsannipātaḥ saṃsthitaḥ //
analyzed: paṃcaviṃśat koṭī sahasrāṇi pretānām yakṣānām rākṣasānām aḍakavatyām rājadhānyām āgatāni bhagavataḥ puratas mahā sannipātaḥ saṃsthitaḥ
translated: Twenty-five thousand koṭis of pretas, yakṣas, and rākṣasas gather in front of the Blessed One in the capital city of Aḍakavatī.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhagavāṃsteṣān daharāṇāṃ sattvānān dharman deśayati /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān teṣām daharāṇām sattvānām dharman deśayati
translated: Then the Blessed One teaches the Dharma to those young beings.

original: daśasu dikṣu lokadhātukoṭīniyutaśatasahasreṣu bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ svakasvakābhyo ṛddhibhirāgatāni /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu lokadhātu koṭī niyuta śata sahasreṣu bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ svaka svakābhyaḥ ṛddhibhiḥ āgatāni
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas from a hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas of world systems in the ten directions come by their own miraculous powers.

original: atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo yena bhagavāṃstenāṃjaliṃ praṇamayya
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim praṇamayya
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada bowed to the Blessed One with folded hands

original: bhagavantametadavocat bahavo bhagavan bahavo sugata bodhisattvāḥ sannipatitāḥ sanniṣaṇṇāḥ
analyzed: bhagavantam etat avocat bahavaḥ bhagavan sugata bodhisattvāḥ sannipatitāḥ sanniṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: and said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, many, many bodhisattvas have gathered and are seated,

original: bahūni ca bhagavan devanāgāni sannipatitāni sanniṣaṇṇāni /
analyzed: bahūni ca bhagavan deva nāgāni sannipatitāni sanniṣaṇṇāni
translated: And many gods and nagas, Blessed One, have assembled and are seated.

original: punaścānekāni rākṣasapretānyaḍakavatyāṃ rājadhānyamāgatya sannipatitāni sanniṣaṇṇānyabhūvan dharmaśravaṇāya //
analyzed: punar ca anekāni rākṣasa pretāni aḍakavatyām rājadhānyam āgatya sannipatitāni sanniṣaṇṇāni abhūvan dharma śravaṇāya
translated: And again, many rakshasas and pretas, having come to the capital city of Aḍakavatī, have assembled and are seated to listen to the Dharma.

original: SaSū tatra khalu bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamāmantrayati /
analyzed: tatra khalu bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āmantrayati
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada.

original: āgaccha kulaputra /
analyzed: āgaccha kula putra
translated: Come, son of noble family.

original: atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo ṛddhibalenordhvādavatīrya yena bhagavāṃstenāṃjaliṃ praṇamayya bhagavantametadavocat dharmaskandho🔽dharmaskandha iti /
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ṛddhi balena ūrdhvāt avatīrya yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim praṇamayya bhagavantam etat avocat dharmaskandhaḥ  dharma skandhaḥ iti
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, having descended from above through the power of his supernatural abilities, bowed with palms joined toward the Blessed One and said this to the Blessed One: 'Aggregate of Dharma,'🔽'aggregate of Dharma' is said, Blessed One.

original: bhagavannucyate kiyatā bhagavan dharmaskandha ityucyate /
analyzed: bhagavan ucyate kiyatā bhagavan dharma skandhaḥ iti ucyate
translated: Blessed One, by how much is it said 'aggregate of Dharma'?

original: bhagavān āha dharmaskandha iti kulaputrocyate /
analyzed: bhagavān āha dharma skandhaḥ iti kula putra ucyate
translated: The Blessed One said, Son of noble family, it is said 'aggregate of Dharma'

original: yo brahmacaryaṃ paryeṣate brahmacaryaṃ paryeṣya sarvapāpādviramati /
analyzed: yaḥ brahmacaryam paryeṣate brahmacaryam paryeṣya sarva pāpāt viramati
translated: means one who seeks the holy life, having sought the holy life, turns away from all evil.

original: paśyasi tvaṃ kulaputrāmī daharā sattvā abrahmacaryād viramanti /
analyzed: paśyasi tvam kula putra amī daharā sattvāḥ a brahmacaryāt viramanti
translated: Do you see, son of noble family, these young beings turning away from unchastity?

original: āha paśyāmi bhagavan paśyāmi sugata / āha /
analyzed: āha paśyāmi bhagavan paśyāmi sugataḥ āha
translated: He said, I see, Blessed One. I see, Sugata. He said:

original: te nūnan dhāraṇīpratilabdhā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: te nūnan dhāraṇī pratilabdhāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will surely attain the dhāraṇīs.

original: sarvadharmasamanvāgatāśca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sarva dharma samanvāgatāḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will be endowed with all dharmas.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: kenopāyena bhagavan bahūni sattvāni sannipatitāni /
analyzed: kena upāyena bhagavan bahūni sattvāni sannipatitāni
translated: By what means, Blessed One, have many beings gathered

original: dharmaskandhaṃ śrotum
analyzed: dharma skandham śrotum
translated: to listen to the aggregate of the Dharma?

original: SaSū atha khalu bhagavāṃ bhaiṣajyasenaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamāmantrayati /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āmantrayati
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃkusumita-rāja:

original: bahavo bhaiṣajyasena sattvāḥ santi /🔽ye jātireva duḥkhaṃ na śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: bahavaḥ bhaiṣajyasena sattvāḥ santi  ye jātiḥ eva duḥkham na śṛṇvanti
translated: Bhaiṣajya-saṃkusumita-rāja, there are many beings🔽who do not hear that birth itself is suffering.

original: jarā eva duḥkhaṃ na śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: jarā eva duḥkham na śṛṇvanti
translated: They do not hear that old age itself is suffering.

original: vyādhireva duḥkhaṃ na śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: vyādhiḥ eva duḥkham na śṛṇvanti
translated: They do not hear that sickness itself is suffering.

original: śokaduḥkhaṃ paridevaduḥkhaṃ priyaviprayogaduḥkhamapriyasaṃprayogaduḥkhaṃ maraṇaṃ tu sarvaduḥkhaṃ harate /
analyzed: śoka duḥkham parideva duḥkham priya viprayoga duḥkham apriya saṃprayoga duḥkham maraṇam tu sarva duḥkham harate
translated: Grief, lamentation, pain, sorrow, and despair - the suffering of not obtaining what one desires - all this suffering is taken away by death.

original: kāyajīvitamidamucyate bhaiṣajyasena sarvaduḥkham
analyzed: kāya jīvitam idam ucyate bhaiṣajyasena sarva duḥkham
translated: This body and life are said to be all suffering, Bhaiṣajya-saṃkusumita-rāja.

original: SaSū atha khalu te daharāḥ sattvā imannirdeśaṃ śrutvā yena bhagavāṃstenāṃjalayaḥ praṇamayya bhagavantametadavocan asmākamapi bhagavan
analyzed: atha khalu te daharāḥ sattvāḥ ima nirdeśam śrutvā yena bhagavān tena aṃjalayaḥ praṇamayya bhagavantam etat avocan asmākam api bhagavan
translated: Then those young beings, having heard this teaching, bowed with palms joined to the Blessed One and said to the Blessed One: Blessed One, we too

original: marttavyaṃ /
analyzed: marttavyam
translated: one must die.

original: bhagavān āha yuṣmābhirapi kulaputrāḥ sarvasattvaiśca martavyamiti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha yuṣmābhiḥ api kula putrāḥ sarva sattvaiḥ ca martavyam iti
translated: The Blessed One said, You, noble sons, and all beings must die.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said,

original: kathaṃ bhagavan maraṇakālamākramati /
analyzed: katham bhagavat maraṇa kālam ākramati
translated: How, Blessed One, does the time of death approach?

original: bhagavān āha maraṇakāle kulaputrāścarimavijñāne vijñānanirodho nāma vātaḥ vijñānavibhramo
analyzed: bhagavān āha maraṇa kāle kula putrāḥ carima vijñāne vijñāna nirodhaḥ nāma vātaḥ vijñāna vibhramaḥ
translated: The Blessed One said, At the time of death, noble sons, in the final consciousness, there is a wind called 'cessation of consciousness,'🔽a wind called 'confusion of consciousness,'

original: nāma vātaḥ vijñānasaṃkṣobhasaṃyukto nāma vātaḥ ime trayaḥ kulaputrā vātā maraṇakālasamaye
analyzed: nāma vātaḥ vijñāna saṃkṣobha saṃyuktaḥ nāma vātaḥ ime trayaḥ kula putrāḥ vātāḥ maraṇa kāla samaye
translated: a wind called 'associated with agitation of consciousness.' These three winds, noble sons, at the time of death,

original: carimavijñāne saṃluḍanti saṃkṣubhanti
analyzed: carima vijñāne saṃluḍanti saṃkṣubhanti
translated: in the final consciousness, churn, agitate,

original: saṃkṣobhamutpādayanti /
analyzed: saṃkṣobham utpādayanti
translated: and produce agitation.

original: ta āhu /
analyzed: te āhuḥ
translated: They said,

original: katamāni bhagavan trīṇi maraṇakālasamaye vijñānanirodhe vartamāne śarīraṃ nirghātayanti /
analyzed: katamāni bhagavan trīṇi maraṇa kāla samaye vijñāna nirodhe vartamāne śarīram nirghātayanti
translated: Blessed One, which three, at the time of death, when the cessation of consciousness is occurring, cause the body to be destroyed?

original: bhagavān āha śastrakaśca nāma mārṣāḥ sūcakaśca nāma mārṣāḥ ṣṭhīlakaśca nāma /
analyzed: bhagavān āha  śastrakaḥ ca nāma mārṣāḥ sūcakaḥ ca nāma mārṣāḥ ṣṭhīlakaḥ ca nāma
translated: The Blessed One said, Friends, there is one called 'weapon,' friends, one called 'needle,' and one called 'pestle.'

original: ye śarīraṃ nirghātayaṃti /
analyzed: ye śarīram nirghātayaṃti
translated: They cause the body to be destroyed.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said,

original: kimetadbhagavaṃccharīraṇ nāma /
analyzed: kim etat bhagavan śarīraṇ nāma
translated: Blessed One, what is this called 'body'?

original: bhagavān āha ādīptakaśca nāma mārṣā dahanavāsakaśca nāma /
analyzed: bhagavān āha ādīptakaḥ ca nāma mārṣāḥ dahanavāsakaḥ ca nāma
translated: The Blessed One said, Friends, there is one called 'blazing,' friends, one called 'dwelling in fire,'

original: meḍikaśca nāma /🔽śṛṃgārikaśca nāma /
analyzed: meḍikaḥ ca nāma 🔽śṛṃgārikaḥ ca nāma
translated: one called 'bladder,'🔽one called 'erotic,'

original: śmaśānikaśca nāma /
analyzed: śmaśānikaḥ ca nāma
translated: And one named Śmaśānīka,

original: durbuddhikaśca nāma /
analyzed: durbuddhikaḥ ca nāma
translated: And one named Durbuddhi,

original: bhāragurukaśca nāma /🔽jātiparipīḍitaśca nāma /
analyzed: bhāragurukaḥ ca nāma  jātiparipīḍitaḥ ca nāma
translated: And one named Bhāraguruka,🔽And one named Jātipariḍīpita,

original: jātisaṃkṣubhitaśca nāma /🔽jīvitaparibhāvikaśca nāma /
analyzed: jātisaṃkṣubhitaḥ ca nāma  jīvitaparibhāvikaḥ ca nāma
translated: And one named Jātiparikṣubhita,🔽And one named Jīvitaparibhāvika,

original: maraṇapriyaviprayogakaśca nāma /
analyzed: maraṇapriyaviprayogakaḥ ca nāma
translated: And one named Maraṇapriyaviprayogaka.

original: ime mārṣā ucyante śarīranāmānaḥ
analyzed: ime mārṣāḥ ucyante śarīra nāmānaḥ
translated: These, friends, are called the names of the body.

original: SaSū ta āhu / kathaṃ bhagavan mṛyate kathaṃ jīvati /
analyzed: te āhuḥ katham bhagavat mṛyate katham jīvati
translated: They said, Blessed One, how does one die? How does one live?

original: bhagavān āha vijñānaṃ nāmāyuṣmanto mriyate /
analyzed: bhagavān āha vijñānam nāma āyuṣmantaḥ mriyate
translated: The Blessed One said, Venerable ones, consciousness dies.

original: puṇyaṃ nāmāyuṣmanto jīvati /
analyzed: puṇyam nāma āyuṣmantaḥ jīvati
translated: Venerable ones, merit lives.🔽Friends, the body dies, bound by millions of sinews, by eighty-four thousand channels, by pores,

original: śarīraṃ nāma mārṣā mṛyate snāyukoṭībhirbaddham caturaśītibhiḥ sirākūrvasahasrai romakūpairbaddham dvādaśabhiḥ sahasrairaṃgānāṃ baddhaṃ /
analyzed: śarīram nāma mārṣāḥ mṛyate snāyu koṭībhiḥ baddham caturaśītibhiḥ sirā kūrva sahasraiḥ romakūpaiḥ baddham dvādaśabhiḥ sahasraiḥ aṃgānām baddham
translated: by twelve thousand limbs,

original: ṣaṣṭyuttaraistribhiḥ śatairasthīnāṃ baddham caturaśītiḥ kṛmikulaśatānyabhyantare vasanti teṣāṃ sarveṣāṃ praṇakānāṃ maraṇaṃ saṃvidyate /
analyzed: ṣaṣṭi uttaraiḥ tribhiḥ śataiḥ asthīnām baddham caturaśītiḥ kṛmi kula śatāni abhyantare vasanti teṣām sarveṣām praṇakānām maraṇam saṃvidyate
translated: by three hundred and sixty bones, and by eighty-four thousand worms that live inside it. The death of all those worms exists.

original: maraṇanirodhaṃ ca saṃvidyate tatra sarve te prāṇakā nirāśā bhavanti /
analyzed: maraṇa nirodham ca saṃvidyate tatra sarve te prāṇakāḥ nirāśāḥ bhavanti
translated: And the cessation of death exists. There, all those worms become hopeless.

original: yadā sa puruṣo mṛyate tadā sarvaprāṇakānāṃ vātasaṃkṣobhaḥ saṃluḍati anyonyaparibhākṣanārthāya tadā te duḥkhāṃ vedanāṃ vedayanti /
analyzed: yadā sa puruṣaḥ mṛyate tadā sarva prāṇakānām vāta saṃkṣobhaḥ saṃluḍati anyonya paribhākṣana arthāya tadā te duḥkhām vedanām vedayanti
translated: When that person dies, then there is a disturbance of the wind of all living beings, for the purpose of mutual devouring. At that time they experience painful feelings.

original: anye punaḥ putraśokaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: anye punar putra śokam kurvanti
translated: Others again make grief for their sons.

original: anye duhitṛśokaṃ jñātṛśokaṃ sarve eva te śokaśalyaviddhāḥ anyonyabhakṣaṇamārabhante /
analyzed: anye duhitṛ śokam jñātṛ śokam sarve eva te śoka śalya viddhāḥ anyonya bhakṣaṇam ārabhante
translated: Others make grief for their daughters, grief for their relatives. All of them, pierced by the dart of grief, begin to devour each other.

original: sarve te anupūrveṇa parasparaṃ bhakṣayanta /
analyzed: sarve te anupūrveṇa parasparam bhakṣayanta
translated: All of them, in due course, devour each other.

original: dvau prāṇakāvavatiṣṭhante /
analyzed: dvau prāṇakau avatiṣṭhante
translated: Two living beings remain.

original: tau saptāhamabhiyudhyataḥ yāva saptāhe 'tikrānte tata ekaḥ prāṇako nirmathyate /
analyzed: tau sapta aham abhiyudhyataḥ yāva sapta ahe tikrānte tatas ekaḥ prāṇakaḥ nirmathyate
translated: They fight for seven days, until after seven days one living being is ground to dust.

original: eko mucyate /
analyzed: ekaḥ mucyate
translated: One is freed.

original: tat katama āyuṣmanta ucyate dharmaḥ tatkiṃ manyadhve yathā sarvaprāṇakānāṃ anyonyanirodhena maraṇaṃ /
analyzed: tat katamaḥ āyuṣmantaḥ ucyate dharmaḥ tat kim manyadhve yathā sarva prāṇakānām anyonya nirodhena maraṇam
translated: Venerable ones, what is that called Dharma? What do you think? Just as the death of all living beings is by mutual obstruction of all living beings,

original: SaSū evameva bālapṛthagjanā sattvā anyonyaviradhamāpdyante /
analyzed: evam eva bāla pṛthagjanā sattvāḥ anyonya viradham āpdyante
translated: in the same way, foolish ordinary beings, living beings, obtain mutual obstruction.

original: te jātyā na bibhyanti /
analyzed: te jātyā na bibhyanti
translated: They are not afraid of birth.

original: vyādhibhyo na bibhyanti /
analyzed: vyādhibhyaḥ na bibhyanti
translated: They are not afraid of sickness.

original: maraṇā na bibhyanti yathā tau
analyzed: maraṇāḥ na bibhyanti yathā tau
translated: They are not afraid of death, just as those two

original: dvau prāṇakau yudhyataḥ evameva bālapṛthagjanāḥ parasparaṃ yudhyante /
analyzed: dvau prāṇakau yudhyataḥ evam eva bāla pṛthagjanāḥ parasparam yudhyante
translated: Two living beings fight, just so, foolish ordinary people fight with each other.

original: atha maraṇakālasamaye ucyate sādhu puruṣaiḥ kiṃ tvaṃ bho puruṣa viśvāsamāpadyase /
analyzed: atha maraṇa kāla samaye ucyate sādhu puruṣaiḥ kim tvam bho puruṣa viśvāsam āpadyase
translated: Then, at the time of death, good people say, 'Well, man, do you have any confidence?

original: kiṃ tvayā manuṣyaloke na kiṃcidādīnavaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ /
analyzed: kim tvayā manuṣya loke na kiṃcid ādīnavam dṛṣṭam
translated: Have you seen any misfortune in the human world?

original: na jātyād ādīnavo dṛṣṭaḥ na jarayā na vyādherādīnavo dṛṣṭa /
analyzed: na jātyāt ādīnavaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ na jarayā na vyādheḥ ādīnavaḥ dṛṣṭa
translated: Have you seen the misfortune of birth, the misfortune of old age, the misfortune of sickness?

original: na maraṇādādīnavo dṛṣṭa /
analyzed: na maraṇāt ādīnavaḥ dṛṣṭa
translated: Have you seen the misfortune of death?'

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He says:

original: dṛṣṭo me āyuṣmanta jātyād ādīnavo jarayā vyādherādīnavo dṛṣṭaḥ sarvapaścān maraṇādādīnavo dṛṣṭaḥ āha /
analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ me āyuṣmanta jātyāt ādīnavaḥ jarayā vyādheḥ ādīnavaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ sarva paścāt maraṇāt ādīnavaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ āha
translated: 'Venerable ones, I have seen the misfortune of birth, I have seen the misfortune of old age, the misfortune of sickness, and lastly I have seen the misfortune of death.' He says:

original: kathaṃ na kṛtāni yat karaṇīyāni kuśalamūlāni /
analyzed: katham na kṛtāni yat karaṇīyāni kuśala mūlāni
translated: 'How is it that you have not done what should be done, the roots of virtue?

original: tat kathaṃ tvayā bhoḥ puruṣa na kṛtamubhayorlokayo hitasaṃvartakāni dharmaskandhakuśalamūlāni /
analyzed: tat katham tvayā bhoḥ puruṣa na kṛtam ubhayoḥ lokayoḥ hita saṃvartakāni dharma skandha kuśala mūlāni
translated: How is it that, man, you have not done the roots of virtue that lead to the accumulation of wholesome dharmas for both worlds?'

original: dvitīyaṃ mārṣāḥ pṛcchāmi /
analyzed: dvitīyam mārṣāḥ pṛcchāmi
translated: 'Friends, I ask a second time:

original: kathaṃ tvayā na kṛtaḥ kuśalamūlasaṃbhāraḥ yastvaṃ parimuktaḥ syājjātyā jarayā vyādhermaraṇāt tat kathaṃ te na kṛtaṃ yoniśomanasikārapratyavekṣaṇāṃ
analyzed: katham tvayā na kṛtaḥ kuśala mūla saṃbhāraḥ yaḥ tvam parimuktaḥ syāt jātyā jarayā vyādheḥ maraṇāt tat katham te na kṛtam yoni śomanasikāra pratyavekṣaṇām
translated: How is it that you did not accumulate roots of virtue, by which you could have been liberated from birth, old age, sickness, and death? How is it that you did not properly contemplate and investigate?

original: kiṃ tvayā bhoḥ puruṣa śrutaṃ /
analyzed: kim tvayā bhoḥ puruṣa śrutam
translated: What have you heard, good man?

original: pṛthivyāṃ gaṇḍyāṃ ākoṭanaśabdaṃ /
analyzed: pṛthivyām gaṇḍyām ākoṭana śabdam
translated: The sound of a gong being struck on the earth.

original: na ca dṛṣṭā jāṃbudvīpakā manuṣyā dānāni dadantaḥ puṇyāni ca kurvantaḥ upavāsamupavasantaḥ
analyzed: na ca dṛṣṭāḥ jāṃbudvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ dānāni dadantaḥ puṇyāni ca kurvantaḥ upavāsam upavasantaḥ
translated: But you have not seen the people of Jambudvīpa giving gifts, making merit, observing the uposatha,

original: tathāgatakṣetre kuśalamūlabījānyavaropayantaḥ gandhaṃ vā mālyaṃ vā dīpaṃ va na tvayā
analyzed: tathāgata kṣetre kuśala mūla bījāni avaropayantaḥ gandham vā mālyam vā dīpam na tvayā
translated: and planting the seeds of roots of virtue in the Tathāgata's field, or offering incense, garlands, or lamps, or

original: dṛṣṭaṃ khādanīyabhojanīyaṃ vā dīyamānam na ca te dṛṣṭāstathāgatasya catasraḥ parṣadaḥ🔽santarpyamānāḥ bhikṣurvā bhikṣuṇī vā upāsako vā upāsikā vā imāṃścatasraḥ parṣadaḥ
analyzed: dṛṣṭam khādanīya bhojanīyam vā dīyamānam na ca te dṛṣṭāḥ tathāgatasya catasraḥ parṣadaḥ  santarpyamānāḥ bhikṣuḥ vā bhikṣuṇī vā upāsakaḥ vā upāsikā vā imān catasraḥ parṣadaḥ
translated: food and drink being given. You have not seen the Tathāgata's four assemblies🔽being satisfied, or the monks, nuns, male lay followers, or female lay followers

original: śāsane 'bhinivustāḥ evaṃ tasya hitāni vadantyālapanti ca /
analyzed: śāsane evam tasya hitāni vadanti ālapanti ca
translated: in the four assemblies being devoted to the teaching, and speaking and conversing about his benefits.

original: na hi devakṛtaṃ kiṃcit asādhustvayā bhoḥ puruṣa kṛtam imimaṃ jaṃbudvīpamāgatya /
analyzed: na hi deva kṛtam kiṃcid asādhuḥ tvayā bhoḥ puruṣa kṛtam im imam jaṃbudvīpam āgatya
translated: You have not done anything bad, good man, having come to this Jambudvīpa.

original: SaSū tasya mṛtasya dharmarājā tasmin kāle taṃ puruṣaṃ anuśāsan tā gāthā bhāṣate
analyzed: tasya mṛtasya dharmarājā tasmin kāle tam puruṣam anuśāsan tāḥ gāthāḥ bhāṣate
translated: The Dharma King, at that time, instructed that man with these verses:

original: dṛṣṭvā tathāgatotpādaḥ śrutvā gaṇḍīparāhatām
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tathāgata utpādaḥ śrutvā gaṇḍī parāhatām
translated: Having seen the Tathāgata's appearance, having heard the striking of the gong,

original: śrutvā dharman deśayamānaṃ śantaṃ nirvāṇagāminaṃ /
analyzed: śrutvā dharman deśayamānam śantam nirvāṇa gāminam
translated: Having heard the Dharma being taught, which leads to the peaceful nirvāṇa,

original: kasmāt te na kṛtaṃ puṇyaṃ paralokasukhāvaham
analyzed: kasmāt te na kṛtam puṇyam para loka sukha āvaham
translated: Why did you not create merit that would bring happiness in the next world?

original: bhokṣyase narake duḥkham aniṣṭhakarmaṇaḥ phalam
analyzed: bhokṣyase narake duḥkham aniṣṭha karmaṇaḥ phalam
translated: You will experience the suffering of hell, the result of your unfinished karma.

original: SaSū atha sa puruṣastaṃ dharmarājānaṃ gāthābhi pratyabhāṣata
analyzed: atha sa puruṣaḥ tam dharma rājānam gāthā abhi pratyabhāṣata
translated: Then that man replied to the Dharma King with these verses:

original: bālabuddhirahaṃ āsīt pāpamitravaśānugaḥ
analyzed: bāla buddhiḥ aham āsīt pāpa mitra vaśa anugaḥ
translated: I had the intelligence of a child, under the control of evil friends,

original: kṛtaṃ me pāpakaṃ karma kāmabhrāntena cetasā //
analyzed: kṛtam me pāpakam karma kāma bhrāntena cetasā
translated: I committed evil actions, with a mind deluded by desire.

original: kāmaśca me citastasya āgataṃ dāruṇaṃ phalam
analyzed: kāmaḥ ca me citaḥ tasya āgatam dāruṇam phalam
translated: Desire arose in my mind, and I obtained its terrible result.

original: kṛtā me prāṇināṃ hiṃsā sāṃghikaṃ ca vināśitaṃ /
analyzed: kṛtā me prāṇinām hiṃsā sāṃghikam ca vināśitam
translated: I harmed living beings, and destroyed the Saṅgha's property.

original: kṛtaṃ me stūpabhedaṃ ca praduṣṭenānatarātmanā
analyzed: kṛtam me stūpa bhedam ca praduṣṭena anatarātmanā
translated: I broke into stūpas, with a completely corrupted mind.

original: dauṣṭhulyaṃ bhāṣitaṃ vākyaṃ mātā me paritāpitā //
analyzed: dauṣṭhulyam bhāṣitam vākyam mātā me paritāpitā
translated: I spoke harshly, and my mother was tormented.

original: aparādhaṃ vijānāmi svaśarīreṇa yat kṛtaṃ
analyzed: aparādham vijānāmi sva śarīreṇa yat kṛtam
translated: I know the offense, what was done with my own body.

original: raurave narake paśyāmyupapattiṃ sudāruṇe /
analyzed: raurave narake paśyāmi upapattim su dāruṇe
translated: I see my rebirth in the terrible Raurava hell.

original: saṃghāte vedanāṃ vetsye tathaiva ca pratāpane /🔽mahāvīcau ca kaṭukāmanubhaviṣyāmi vedanāṃ
analyzed: saṃghāte vedanām vetsye tathā eva ca pratāpane  mahāvīcau ca kaṭukām anubhaviṣyāmi vedanām
translated: I will experience pain in Saṃghāta, and likewise in Pratāpana,🔽And in Mahāvīci I will experience bitter pain.

original: mahāpadme ca narake krandayiṣyāmi suduḥkhitaḥ
analyzed: mahāpadme ca narake krandayiṣyāmi su duḥkhitaḥ
translated: And in the great lotus hell I will cry out in great suffering.

original: vārā śataṃ kālasūtre utpatsyāmi mahābhaye
analyzed: śatam kālasūtre utpatsyāmi mahā bhaye
translated: For a hundred years I will be reborn in Kālasūtra, the great fear,

original: hatāśca nārakā sattvāḥ punaḥ paśyanti te bhayam
analyzed: hatāḥ ca sattvāḥ punar paśyanti te bhayam
translated: And the beings in hell, having been killed, will see that fear again.

original: yojanānāṃ śataṃ bhūyaḥ pratipadyanti mahābhayam
analyzed: yojanānām śatam bhūyas pratipadyanti mahā bhayam
translated: Again they will travel a hundred yojanas to the great fear.

original: dvāran te na labhiṣyanti punaḥ kuṃbhe pratāpitāḥ
analyzed: dvāran te na labhiṣyanti punar kuṃbhe pratāpitāḥ
translated: They will not find a door, being heated in the pot again.

original: kṣūraṃ tu nāma narakaṃ sahasraṃ kṣūrasaṃbhavam
analyzed: kṣūram tu nāma narakam sahasram kṣūra saṃbhavam
translated: The hell named Kṣūra is a thousand times more fearful than Kṣūra.

original: śatam sahasraṃ koṭīnāṃ kṣūrāṇāṃ jāyate grataḥ
analyzed: śatam sahasram koṭīnām kṣūrāṇām jāyate gratas
translated: A hundred thousand koṭis of razor blades are born in front of him.

original: taistasya bhidyante gātraṃ karmabhi duṣkṛtaiḥ svakaiḥ //
analyzed: taiḥ tasya bhidyante gātram karmabhi duṣkṛtaiḥ svakaiḥ
translated: By his own evil actions, his body is split by them.

original: vātakṣobhā mahāghorā sarvaṃ cchindanti tāṃ tanum
analyzed: vāta kṣobhā mahā ghorā sarvam chindanti tām tanum
translated: The great fearsome wind disturbs everything and cuts up that body.

original: anubhāvyā mayā duḥkhā īdṛśā narake dhruvam
analyzed: anubhāvyāḥ mayā duḥkhāḥ īdṛśāḥ narake dhruvam
translated: Such sufferings are certainly to be experienced by me in hell.

original: drakṣyante sarvasattvā me kāyaṃ duḥkhaprapīḍitaṃ /
analyzed: drakṣyante sarva sattvāḥ me kāyam duḥkha prapīḍitam
translated: All beings will see my body afflicted by suffering.

original: arthā parakyā ādattā mayā veśmasya kāraṇāt
analyzed: arthā parakyā ādattā mayā veśmasya kāraṇāt
translated: For the sake of a house, I have taken others' wealth.

original: putrā duhitaro mahya bhrātā ca bhāginī tathā🔽mātā pitā caiva mama mitrajñātigaṇo 'pi ca
analyzed: putrāḥ duhitaraḥ bhrātā ca bhāginī tathā  mātā pitā ca eva mama mitra jñāti gaṇaḥ ca
translated: My sons, daughters, brothers, and sisters,🔽My mother, father, and even my friends and relatives,

original: dāsakarmakarāścaiva gāvo bhṛtyaḥ paśuṃ tathā /
analyzed: dāsa karmakarāḥ ca eva gāvaḥ bhṛtyaḥ paśum tathā
translated: My servants, workers, cows, and other animals,

original: bhrānto smyahaṃ kukāryeṣu rupyasauvarṇabhājanaiḥ
analyzed: bhrāntaḥ smi aham ku kāryeṣu rupya sauvarṇa bhājanaiḥ
translated: I have wandered in bad deeds, with silver and golden vessels,

original: vastraistathā susūkṣmaiśca bhrāntaḥ kārāpane gṛhe
analyzed: vastraiḥ tathā su sūkṣmaiḥ ca bhrāntaḥ kārāpane gṛhe
translated: And with very fine clothes, I have wandered in the house of bondage.

original: suvicitraṃ gṛhaṃ kṛtvā naranārīsamākulaṃ /🔽vīṇāstūryāḥ parāhatya rataṃ me durdamaṃ manaḥ
analyzed: su vicitram gṛham kṛtvā nara nārī samākulam  vīṇāḥ tūryāḥ parāhatya ratam me durdamam manaḥ
translated: Having made a very colorful house full of men and women,🔽Having played vīṇās and musical instruments, my uncontrollable mind has enjoyed.

original: gātraṃ gandhodakairliptaṃ kṛtajño 'dyāpi naiva saḥ
analyzed: gātram gandha udakaiḥ liptam kṛtajñaḥ na eva saḥ
translated: My body has been anointed with fragrant waters, but even today I am not grateful.

original: acetana śarīrastvaṃ bhrānto 'smi tava kāraṇāt
analyzed: acetana śarīraḥ tvam bhrāntaḥ smi tava kāraṇāt
translated: You are an insentient body, I have wandered because of you.

original: na vidyā te mama trātā kaścit sattvaḥ punarbhavet
analyzed: na vidyā te mama trātā kaścid sattvaḥ punar bhavet
translated: Neither knowledge nor anyone else can be my protector in future births.

original: vātakṣobhe mahāghore śarīraparitāpane /🔽bhuktā rasā svāduvanto jihvayā vividhāstathā
analyzed: vāta kṣobhe mahā ghore śarīra paritāpane  bhuktāḥ svāduvantaḥ jihvayā vividhāḥ tathā
translated: In the great and terrible disturbance of the wind, which torments the body,🔽Various delicious tastes have been enjoyed with the tongue.

original: śīrṣe mālāśca bahavo baddhā śvitrāḥ suśobhanāḥ
analyzed: śīrṣe mālāḥ ca bahavaḥ baddhā śvitrāḥ su śobhanāḥ
translated: Many beautiful garlands have been worn on the head.

original: rūpeṇa bhrāmitaścakṣuścakṣutrāṇaṃ na vidyate /
analyzed: rūpeṇa bhrāmitaḥ cakṣuḥ cakṣu trāṇam na vidyate
translated: The eyes have been deluded by forms, there is no protection for the eyes.

original: pāpānāṃ cakṣuṣī heturmayā dṛṣṭvātu yatkṛtam
analyzed: pāpānām cakṣuṣī hetuḥ mayā dṛṣṭvā tu yat kṛtam
translated: The eyes are the cause of sins, I have seen what has been done by me.

original: śrotrau hetuśca me bhūyaḥ bāhū vajraparāhatāḥ🔽hastebhyaḥ kaṭakā baddhā aṅgulīyebhi yaṃtrikā /
analyzed: śrotrau hetuḥ ca me bhūyas bāhū vajra parāhatāḥ  hastebhyaḥ kaṭakā baddhā aṅgulīyebhiḥ yaṃtrikā
translated: My ears are the cause, and again my arms, struck by the thunderbolt,🔽On my arms are bound bracelets, on my fingers are rings.

original: grīvāyāṃ muktihārāṇi pādau cāpi svalaṃkṛtau
analyzed: grīvāyām mukti hārāṇi pādau ca api su alaṃkṛtau
translated: On my neck are pearl necklaces, and my feet are also well-adorned.

original: jālāni kṛtvā tatraiva sauvaraṇaṃ saṃsthitaṃ tataḥ🔽gātrai ca vividhā ratnā sauvarṇakaṭakāstathā /
analyzed: jālāni kṛtvā tatra eva sauvaraṇam saṃsthitam tatas  ca vividhā ratnā sauvarṇa kaṭakāḥ tathā
translated: Having made nets there, I then remained in a golden abode.🔽And on my body are various jewels, and golden bracelets as well.

original: udārai ramito bhogairmanasaṃbṛhaṇairapi /
analyzed: udāraiḥ ramitaḥ bhogaiḥ mana saṃbṛhaṇaiḥ api
translated: With generous and delightful enjoyments, which also delight the mind,

original: sparśaṃ ca sukumāraṃ me tṛṣṇagrastena sevitaṃ /
analyzed: sparśam ca su kumāram me tṛṣṇa grastena sevitam
translated: And the touch of a tender one, I served while being seized by craving.

original: nānāstaraṇaśayyābhiḥ kāyaḥ krīḍāpito mayā/🔽snāto gandhodakairviśadairgandhaiścāpi pralepitaḥ
analyzed: nānā āstaraṇa śayyābhiḥ kāyaḥ krīḍāpitaḥ mayā  snātaḥ gandha udakaiḥ viśadaiḥ gandhaiḥ ca api pralepitaḥ
translated: My body was amused with various beddings and beds.🔽I bathed with clear scented waters and was anointed with perfumes.

original: karpūracandanairdivyairdhūpanaiścāpi dhūpitaḥ
analyzed: karpūra candanaiḥ divyaiḥ dhūpanaiḥ ca api dhūpitaḥ
translated: I was fumigated with divine camphor and sandalwood incense.

original: kastūrikāsamāyukto vāso varṇakaraḥ kṛtaḥ
analyzed: kastūrikā samāyuktaḥ vāsaḥ varṇa karaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: I wore a garment that makes the complexion beautiful, mixed with musk.

original: gandhavārṣikatailena sumanācaṇpakādibhiḥ🔽makṣitaḥ pāṇḍuraṃ vastraṃ prāvṛtaṃ sūkṣmakāśikaṃ
analyzed: makṣitaḥ pāṇḍuram vastram prāvṛtam sūkṣma kāśikam
translated: With the oil of Gandhavarshita, and with Sumana, Champaka, and others,🔽I was anointed, and put on a white, fine, transparent garment.

original: avatīrya hastipṛṣṭhādaśvapṛṣṭhe bhiruhya ca
analyzed: avatīrya hasti pṛṣṭhāt aśva pṛṣṭhe bhiḥ uhya ca
translated: Having descended from the elephant's back, and mounted the horse's back,

original: rājāhamiti manyāmi jano me dhāvate grataḥ
analyzed: rājā aham iti manyāmi janaḥ me dhāvate gratas
translated: I think 'I am a king,' and people run in front of me.

original: antaḥpuraṃ vijānāmi gīte nṛtye suśīkṣitaḥ
analyzed: antaḥpuram vijānāmi gīte nṛtye su śīkṣitaḥ
translated: I know the inner quarters, well-trained in singing and dancing,

original: nirāparādhā mṛgayā hatā kāṇḍaiśca me mṛgā
analyzed: nirāparādhā mṛgayā hatā kāṇḍaiḥ ca me mṛgā
translated: And my deer were killed without fault, and my deer with arrows,

original: īdṛśaṃ me kṛtaṃ pāpaṃ paralokamajānatā /
analyzed: īdṛśam me kṛtam pāpam para lokam a jānatā
translated: Such a sin has been committed by me, not knowing the next world.

original: paramāṃsā mayā bhuktāstato duḥkhamidaṃ mama //
analyzed: para māṃsāḥ mayā bhuktāḥ tatas duḥkham idam mama
translated: The highest meat has been eaten by me, therefore this is my suffering.

original: maraṇaṃ me na vijñātamāgamiṣyati dāruṇaṃ
analyzed: maraṇam me na vijñātam āgamiṣyati dāruṇam
translated: My death was not known, it will come terribly,

original: bālabuddhirahaṃ āsīccharīraṃ poṣitaṃ mayā /
analyzed: bāla buddhiḥ aham āsīt śarīram poṣitam mayā
translated: I had the intelligence of a child, my body was nourished by me.

original: āgataṃ maraṇaṃ me dya kaścittrātā na vidyate /
analyzed: āgatam maraṇam me dya kaścid trātā na vidyate
translated: Death has come to me today, there is no savior to be found.

original: yūyaṃ hi jñātayaḥ sarve mukhaṃ me kiṃ nirīkṣatha /🔽kasmād vastraṃ pāṭayadhvaṃ pralāpaiścāpi kiṃkṛte /🔽keśān kasmād vikiratha raktaṃ kiṃ vā kariṣyati
analyzed: yūyam hi jñātayaḥ sarve mukham me kim nirīkṣatha  kasmāt vastram pāṭayadhvam pralāpaiḥ ca api kiṃkṛte  keśān kasmāt vikiratha raktam kim vā kariṣyati
translated: You are all relatives, why do you look at my face?🔽Why do you tear my clothes, and for what purpose do you lament?🔽Why do you scatter my hair, what will blood do?

original: pāṃsuṃ ca śīrṣe kṣipatha urastāḍaṃ karotha kim
analyzed: pāṃsum ca śīrṣe kṣipatha uraḥ tāḍam karotha kim
translated: Why do you throw dust on your head, why do you beat your chest?

original: jīvaṃ nāhaṃ vāritavyaḥ pāpāt kiṃ ruditena vaḥ
analyzed: jīvam na aham vāritavyaḥ pāpāt kim ruditena vaḥ
translated: I am alive, I should not be stopped, what is the use of crying?

original: śarīraṃ me vṛkabhojyaṃ kurkurāṇāṃ ca vāyasām
analyzed: śarīram me vṛka bhojyam kurkurāṇām ca vāyasām
translated: My body will be eaten by wolves, dogs, and crows,

original: bhaviṣyate pakṣiṇāṃ ca vṛthā puṣṭaṃ ayan tanuḥ
analyzed: bhaviṣyate pakṣiṇām ca vṛthā puṣṭam ayan tanuḥ
translated: This body will be uselessly nourished by birds.

original: maraṇoragasaṃspṛṣṭo jāyate 'pi sudāruṇaḥ
analyzed: maraṇa uraga saṃspṛṣṭaḥ jāyate su dāruṇaḥ
translated: Touched by the snake of death, it becomes extremely terrible.

original: tathopayojyaṃ bhaiṣajyaṃ yathāsmān mucyate bhayāt
analyzed: tathā upayojyam bhaiṣajyam yathā asmāt mucyate bhayāt
translated: And apply the medicine accordingly, so that we may be freed from this fear.

original: yan me vaidyāḥ pradāsyanti bhaiṣajyaṃ na tadiṣyate
analyzed: yat me vaidyāḥ pradāsyanti bhaiṣajyam na tat iṣyate
translated: The medicine that the doctors will give me, that is not accepted.

original: sāṃprataṃ dharmabhaiṣajyaṃ kleśoragavimocakam
analyzed: sāṃpratam dharma bhaiṣajyam kleśa uraga vimocakam
translated: Now, the medicine of the Dharma, which liberates from the snake of afflictions,

original: mṛyato mama dātavyaṃ mā memaṃ saṃprayacchatha /
analyzed: mṛyataḥ mama dātavyam mā mā imam saṃprayacchatha
translated: Should be given to me who is dying, do not give it to me later.

original: poṣyamāṇaśarīro yamavaśyaṃ nāśameṣyati /
analyzed: poṣyamāṇa śarīraḥ yam avaśyam nāśam eṣyati
translated: The body that is being nourished will surely perish under Yama's control.

original: pāpaskandhaṃ kimākṣipya yatpaścā duḥkhadāyakam
analyzed: pāpa skandham kim ākṣipya yat paścā duḥkha dāyakam
translated: Why accumulate a heap of sins that will later bring suffering?

original: poṣito me pṛyaṃ kāyaḥ kṛtaghnatvaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: poṣitaḥ me kāyaḥ kṛtaghna tvam kariṣyati
translated: The body that I have nourished will act with ingratitude.

original: putrā duhitaraṃ kiṃ me cakṣuṣā sannirīkṣatha /
analyzed: putrāḥ duhitaram kim me cakṣuṣā san nirīkṣatha
translated: Why do you, my sons and daughter, look at me with eyes of grief?

original: trāyadhvamasmād rogān me rudadhvaṃ kinnirarthakam
analyzed: trāyadhvam asmāt rogāt me rudadhvam kinnirarthakam
translated: Protect me from this disease, why do you weep in vain?

original: yūyaṃ hi putra duhitṛ kṛtaghnā mama sāmpratam
analyzed: yūyam hi putra duhitṛ kṛtaghnāḥ mama sāmpratam
translated: You, my sons and daughter, are now ungrateful to me.

original: yuṣmākaṃ poṣaṇārthāya parakīyaṃ mayā hṛtaṃ /
analyzed: yuṣmākam poṣaṇa arthāya parakīyam mayā hṛtam
translated: For the sake of nourishing you, I have taken what belongs to others.

original: sāprataṃ maraṇaṃ prāptaṃ nirāśaṃ mām karotha kim
analyzed: sāpratam maraṇam prāptam nirāśam mām karotha kim
translated: Now that I have reached death, why do you make me hopeless?

original: jātidurgatisaṃtrasto maraṇena ca pīḍitaḥ
analyzed: jāti durgati saṃtrastaḥ maraṇena ca pīḍitaḥ
translated: Terrified by birth and bad destinies, afflicted by death,

original: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ sparṣaṃ paramavedanāḥ
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ sparṣam parama vedanāḥ
translated: Feeling, perception, mental formations, contact is the supreme feeling.

original: tṛṣṇāyā bhrāmyate bālaḥ prāpnoti kaṭukaṃ phalaṃ /
analyzed: tṛṣṇāyāḥ bhrāmyate bālaḥ prāpnoti kaṭukam phalam
translated: The fool wanders due to craving, and attains bitter fruits.🔽Here is the corrected and aligned text:

original: śokabandhana mahya tu jātasya viṣame kule🔽alpapuṇyaṃ tu māṃ jñātvā śocayiṣyantyapare janāḥ
analyzed: śoka bandhana tu jātasya viṣame kule  alpa puṇyam tu mām jñātvā śocayiṣyanti apare janāḥ
translated: I was born in a difficult family, bound by sorrow.

original: dānaśīlaparibhraṣṭo dharmāccāpi parānmukhaḥ
analyzed: dāna śīla paribhraṣṭaḥ dharmāt ca api parāt mukhaḥ
translated: Knowing me to be of little merit, other people will grieve, saying, He has fallen away from generosity and morality, and has turned his back on the Dharma.

original: punarbhavaṃ na jānīte kleśoragaviṣārditā
analyzed: punarbhavam na jānīte kleśa uraga viṣa arditā
translated: He does not know about rebirth, afflicted by the poison of the serpent of afflictions.

original: bhrāmyate vidyayā bālo yatra mokṣaṃ na vidyate /
analyzed: bhrāmyate vidyayā bālaḥ yatra mokṣam na vidyate
translated: The child wanders with knowledge, where there is no liberation.

original: mokṣārthaṃ na vijānāti bhrāntaḥ pāpaṃ karoti ca
analyzed: mokṣa artham na vijānāti bhrāntaḥ pāpam karoti ca
translated: He does not know the meaning of liberation, confused, he commits evil.

original: kleśaiśca bhrāmyate bālo nityaṃ vyākṣiptamānasaḥ //
analyzed: kleśaiḥ ca bhrāmyate bālaḥ nityam vyākṣipta mānasaḥ
translated: The child wanders due to afflictions, his mind always distracted.

original: dahyate hyagninā dīptaḥ kāyo vividhabandhanaḥ
analyzed: dahyate hi agninā dīptaḥ kāyaḥ vividha bandhanaḥ
translated: The body, burning with various bonds, is scorched by the blazing fire.

original: vibhrānto bhramate kāyo yatra saukhyaṃ na vidyate /
analyzed: vibhrāntaḥ bhramate kāyaḥ yatra saukhyam na vidyate
translated: The body, confused, wanders where there is no happiness.

original: tacca saukhyaṃ na jānāti yadabhyantasukhāvaham
analyzed: tat ca saukhyam na jānāti yat abhyanta sukha āvaham
translated: He does not know that happiness which brings inner bliss.

original: buddhānām sukhadaṃ kṣetraṃ dharmacakraṃ mahāgadam
analyzed: buddhānām sukha dam kṣetram dharma cakram mahā gadam
translated: The field that brings happiness to the Buddhas, the great medicine of the wheel of Dharma,

original: śīlaṃ ca satyaṃ śīlanāṃ brahmaghoṣāstathāgatā //
analyzed: śīlam ca satyam śīlanām brahmaghoṣāḥ tathāgatā
translated: morality, truth, the Brahmic voice of the Tathagatas.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamāmantrayetadavocat evaṃ ca bhaiṣajyasena sattvā maraṇakāle paridevanti
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āmantraya itat avocat evam ca bhaiṣajyasena sattvāḥ maraṇa kāle paridevanti
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Bhaisajyasena, saying, Bhaiṣajyasena, beings lament at the time of death in this way:

original: na na hi teṣāṃ kaścittrātā bhaviṣyatyanyatra sukṛtānāṃ karmāṇāṃ phalavipākaṃ ca gāthā cemā bhāṣate //
analyzed: na na hi teṣām kaścid trātā bhaviṣyati anyatra su kṛtānām karmāṇām phala vipākam ca gāthā ca imāḥ bhāṣate
translated: For none of them will there be a savior, except the ripening of their own good and bad actions. And he spoke this verse:

original: kṛtvā tu pāpakaṃ karma narakeṣu patanti hi🔽bhuṃjante cīmaraṃ taptaṃ pīvante lohapānakam
analyzed: kṛtvā tu pāpakam karma narakeṣu patanti hi  bhuṃjante cīmaram taptam pīvante loha pānakam
translated: Having committed evil actions, they fall into the hells.🔽They eat the burning iron ball, they drink the iron beverage.

original: kāyebhyo varṣate 'ṅgāraṃ dagdhāḥ krandanti dāruṇam
analyzed: kāyebhyaḥ varṣate ṅgāram dagdhāḥ krandanti dāruṇam
translated: From their bodies, embers rain down, burned, they cry out terribly.

original: dahyatyeṣāṃ taccharīraṃ narakesmin mahābhaye /
analyzed: dahyati eṣām tat śarīram narake ismin mahā bhaye
translated: Their bodies are burned in this great and fearful hell.

original: na vijānanti saukhyāni dharmaṃ ca na vijānate
analyzed: na vijānanti saukhyāni dharmam ca na vijānate
translated: They do not know happiness, they do not know the Dharma.

original: bālo bhramatyadharmeṇa saukhyaṃ nāpnoti kiṃcana /
analyzed: bālaḥ bhramati adharmeṇa saukhyam nā āpnoti kiṃcana
translated: The fool wanders in non-Dharma, he does not attain any happiness.

original: śraddhāśīlena saṃpannaḥ prajñāyukto mahātapāḥ
analyzed: śraddhā śīlena saṃpannaḥ prajñā yuktaḥ mahā tapāḥ
translated: Endowed with faith and morality, endowed with wisdom and great austerities,

original: mitraṃ bhajati kalyāṇaṃ śīghraṃ bhoti tathāgataḥ
analyzed: mitram bhajati kalyāṇam śīghram tathāgataḥ
translated: He befriends the virtuous, and quickly becomes a Tathāgata.

original: vīryamārabhate śreyaṃ buddhalokopapattaye
analyzed: vīryam ārabhate śreyam buddha loka upapattaye
translated: He exerts vigor for the sake of the attainment of the Buddha-realm.

original: deśetha kuśalaṃ dharmaṃ sarvasattvaparigrahaṃ
analyzed: deśetha kuśalam dharmam sarva sattva parigraham
translated: He teaches the wholesome Dharma, which embraces all beings.

original: maitraṃ cittaṃ samāpanno brahmacaryaparāyaṇaḥ
analyzed: maitram cittam samāpannaḥ brahmacarya parāyaṇaḥ
translated: Having attained the mind of loving-kindness, he is devoted to the holy life.

original: śrutvaivaṃ bhaiṣajyasena pratipattiparo bhavet
analyzed: śrutvā evam bhaiṣajyasena pratipatti paraḥ bhavet
translated: Having heard this, Bhaiṣajyasena, one should be devoted to practice.

original: vimuktidarśanaṃ buddhaṃ guṣṭaśabdaṃ vināyakaṃ /
analyzed: vimukti darśanam buddham guṣṭa śabdam vināyakam
translated: The Buddha, who bestows liberation, is the one who is praised, the leader,

original: lokasya mātāpitaraṃ bodhicittaṃ taducyate /🔽kalyāṇamitrāṃ paramāṃ suduṣkaraṃ yo deśayet
analyzed: lokasya mātā pitaram bodhi cittam tat ucyate  kalyāṇa mitrām paramām su duṣkaram yaḥ deśayet
translated: The mother and father of the world, that is called the mind of enlightenment.🔽The supreme spiritual friend, who teaches here in the world the Dharma that is so difficult to practice,

original: iha dharma loke śṛṇvanti ye gauravādbuddhaśāsanaṃ
analyzed: iha dharma loke śṛṇvanti ye gauravāt buddha śāsanam
translated: Those who listen with respect to the Buddha's teachings,

original: te bhonti buddhāḥ sugatā narottamāḥ
analyzed: te bhonti buddhāḥ sugatāḥ nara uttamāḥ
translated: They become Buddhas, Sugatas, supreme among men,

original: lokanāthā bhavantyete sarvasattvapramocakāḥ
analyzed: lokanāthāḥ bhavanti ete sarva sattva pramocakāḥ
translated: They become lords of the world, liberators of all beings.

original: śāntebhyo buddhakṣetrebhyo ye bhavanti sagauravāḥ //
analyzed: śāntebhyaḥ buddhakṣetrebhyaḥ ye bhavanti sa gauravāḥ
translated: From the peaceful Buddha-fields, those who are respectful,

original: SaSū atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat kim idaṃ bhagavan pṛthivī kaṃpati saṃprakaṃpati /
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kim idam bhagavan pṛthivī kaṃpati saṃprakaṃpati
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahasattva Bhaisajyasena said this to the Blessed One: Why does the earth tremble, quake?

original: evamukte bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat vyavalokaya bhaiṣajyasena kiṃ paśyasi /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat vyavalokaya bhaiṣajyasena kim paśyasi
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to the bodhisattva mahasattva Bhaisajyasena: Bhaisajyasena, look around and see what you see.

original: vyavalokitaṃ bhaiṣajyasenena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena /
analyzed: vyavalokitam bhaiṣajyasenena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
translated: The bodhisattva mahasattva Bhaisajyasena looked around.

original: atha tāvadeva caturbhyo digbhyaḥ paśyati /🔽pṛthivīvivaraṃ dadāti /
analyzed: atha tāvat eva caturbhyaḥ digbhyaḥ paśyati  pṛthivī vivaram dadāti
translated: Then, at that very moment, he saw from the four directions🔽the earth opening up.

original: pṛthivyā vivṛtāyāṃ paśyati /
analyzed: pṛthivyāḥ vivṛtāyām paśyati
translated: When the earth opened up, he saw

original: pṛthivīvivarebhyo viṃśati koṭyo manuṣyāṇāṃ jāyante /🔽adhastāddiśi viṃśati koṭyo manuṣyānāṃ jāyante /
analyzed: pṛthivī vivarebhyaḥ viṃśati koṭyaḥ manuṣyāṇām jāyante  adhastāt diśi viṃśati koṭyaḥ manuṣyānām jāyante
translated: From the openings in the earth, twenty koṭis of humans are born.🔽Below, in the direction, twenty koṭis of humans are born.

original: ūrdhvāyāṃ diśāyāṃ paṃcaviṃśati koṭyo manuṣyānāṃ jāyante /
analyzed: ūrdhvāyām diśāyām paṃcaviṃśati koṭyaḥ manuṣyānām jāyante
translated: Above, in the direction, twenty-five koṭis of humans are born.

original: SaSū atha te daharāḥ sattvā vyavalokya bhagavantametadavocan katame bhagavanniha jātā /
analyzed: atha te daharāḥ sattvāḥ vyavalokya bhagavantam etat avocan katame bhagavan iha jātā
translated: Then those young beings, having looked, said this to the Blessed One: Which ones, Blessed One, are born here?

original: bhagavān āha paśyatha yūyamime janakāyāḥ ta āhuḥ paśyāmo bhagavan bhagavān āha ime janakāyā yuṣmākaṃ sakhāyā jātāḥ ta āhuḥ eteṣāmapi bhagavan 🔽sattvānāṃ maraṇaṃ bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha paśyatha yūyam ime jana kāyāḥ te āhuḥ paśyāmaḥ bhagavan bhagavān āha ime jana kāyāḥ yuṣmākam sakhāyāḥ jātāḥ te āhuḥ eteṣām api bhagavan  sattvānām maraṇam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: The Blessed One said: Do you see these masses of people? They said: We see them, Blessed One. The Blessed One said: These masses of people are born as your friends. They said: Blessed One, these beings will also die.

original: bhagavān āha evametan mārṣāḥ sarvasattvānāmapi maraṇaṃ bhaviṣyati /🔽SaSū atha te pūrvimakā sattvā daharāḥ ye prathamataramutpannāste yena bhagavāṃstenāṃjaliṃ
analyzed: bhagavān āha evam etat mārṣāḥ sarva sattvānām api maraṇam bhaviṣyati  atha te sattvāḥ daharāḥ ye prathamataram utpannāḥ te yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim
translated: The Blessed One said: So it is, friends. For all beings, death will occur.

original: praṇamayya bhagavantametadavocan notsahāmo vayaṃ punarbhagavaṃ jātiṃ maraṇaṃ ca
analyzed: praṇamayya bhagavantam etat avocat na utsahāmaḥ vayam punar bhagavan jātim maraṇam ca
translated: Then those young beings who were born earlier, who were born first, having bowed to the Blessed One with their hands folded, said this to the Blessed One: We are not eager, Blessed One, to be born again and to die again and again,🔽to be reborn again and again, to pass away again and again, to transmigrate again and again.

original: draṣṭum bhagavān āha tatkiṃ yūyamutsahatha vīryavalālabdham ta āhuḥ tathāgataṃ
analyzed: draṣṭum bhagavān āha tat kim yūyam utsahatha vīrya vala ālabdham te āhuḥ tathāgatam
translated: The Blessed One said, Do you have the strength to see that? They said, We would see the Tathāgata🔽face to face, and hear the pleasant and agreeable Dharma from him, and see

original: saṃmukhaṃ paśyemaḥ tasya ca sakāśāddharmaśravaṇaṃ mṛṣṭaṃ manāpaṃ śṛṇuyāmaḥ tathāgataśrāvakasaṃghaṃ
analyzed: saṃmukham paśyemaḥ tasya ca sakāśāt dharma śravaṇam mṛṣṭam manāpam śṛṇuyāmaḥ tathāgata śrāvaka saṃgham
translated: the assembly of the Tathāgata's disciples,

original: ca niṣaṇṇaṃ paśyemaḥ bodhisattvān mahardhikān mahānubhāvān paśyemaḥ īdṛśaṃ ca bhagavannotsahāmo
analyzed: ca niṣaṇṇam paśyemaḥ bodhisattvān mahardhikān mahā anubhāvān paśyemaḥ īdṛśam ca bhagavan na utsahāmaḥ
translated: and we would see the bodhisattvas with great supernormal powers and great influence. Blessed One, we have the strength to see such things,

original: jātiṃ maraṇaṃ ca draṣṭum
analyzed: jātim maraṇam ca draṣṭum
translated: but we do not have the strength to see birth and death.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo ṛddhibalenotthāyāsanāt sārdhaṃ taiḥ paṃcabhirbodhisattvaśataiḥ te sarve ṛddhyā utthāyoparyantarīkṣe 🔽caṃkramanti /
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ṛddhi balena utthāya āsanāt sārdham taiḥ paṃcabhiḥ bodhisattva śataiḥ te sarve ṛddhyā utthāya upari antarīkṣe  caṃkramanti
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃgha rose from his seat through his supernormal power, together with those five hundred bodhisattvas. They all rose through their supernormal power and🔽walked in the sky above,

original: paryaṃkañca badhvā dhyāyanti /
analyzed: paryaṃkam ca badhvā dhyāyanti
translated: sitting cross-legged and meditating.

original: teṣāṃ sarvakāyebhyaḥ siṃhā niṣkrāmanti /
analyzed: teṣām sarva kāyebhyaḥ siṃhāḥ niṣkrāmanti
translated: From all their bodies, lions emerged,

original: vyāghrā niṣkrāmanti /🔽vyāḍā niṣkrāmanti /
analyzed: vyāghrāḥ niṣkrāmanti  vyāḍāḥ niṣkrāmanti
translated: tigers emerged,🔽hyenas emerged,

original: hastino niṣkrāmanti /
analyzed: hastinaḥ niṣkrāmanti
translated: elephants emerged,

original: mahāṛddhivikurvitāni darśayanti /
analyzed: mahā ṛddhi vikurvitāni darśayanti
translated: displaying great supernormal powers and transformations.

original: parvateṣu ca paryaṃkaṃ badhvā niṣīdanti /
analyzed: parvateṣu ca paryaṃkam badhvā niṣīdanti
translated: They sat cross-legged on the mountains,

original: viṃśatiryojanasahasrāṇyūrdhvamāruhanti /
analyzed: viṃśatiḥ yojana sahasrāṇi ūrdhvam āruhanti
translated: They ascend upwards for twenty thousand yojanas.

original: daśa koṭīsahasrāṇi candramasūryāṇimavataranti /
analyzed: daśa koṭī sahasrāṇi candramasūryāṇim avataranti
translated: The sun and moon descend for ten thousand koṭis.

original: SaSū atha khalu te daharāḥ sattvā bhagavantametadavocan ko bhagavan hetuḥ
analyzed: atha khalu te daharāḥ sattvāḥ bhagavantam etat avocan kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ
translated: Then those young beings said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, what is the cause

original: kaḥ pratyayo mahāraśmyāvabhāsasya mahacca ṛddhivikurvitā loke prādurbhūtāḥ bhagavān
analyzed: kaḥ pratyayaḥ mahā raśmi avabhāsasya mahat ca ṛddhi vikurvitā loke prādurbhūtāḥ bhagavān
translated: what is the condition for the great radiance of light and the great manifestation of supernatural powers appearing in the world? The Blessed One

original: āha paśyatha kulaputrā etau candrasūryau prādurbhūtau /
analyzed: āha paśyatha kula putrāḥ etau candra sūryau prādurbhūtau
translated: said, Noble sons, do you see these sun and moon appearing?

original: ta āhu /
analyzed: te āhuḥ
translated: They said,

original: paśyāmo bhadanta bhagavan paśyāmo bhadanta sugata /
analyzed: paśyāmaḥ bhadanta bhagavan paśyāmaḥ bhadanta sugata
translated: We see them, Blessed One, we see them, Well-Gone One.

original: bhagavān āha eṣa bodhisattvaiḥ svakāyād raśmyāvabhāso ṛddhiprātihāryaṃ ca darśitaṃ sandarśayitvā sattvānān dharman deśayanti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha eṣa bodhisattvaiḥ sva kāyāt ṛddhi prātihāryam ca darśitam sandarśayitvā dharman deśayanti
translated: The Blessed One said, This is the radiance of light and the supernatural manifestation shown by the bodhisattvas from their own bodies. Having shown it, they teach the Dharma to beings.

original: bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukaṃpāyairmahato janakāyasyārthāya hitāya sukhāya
analyzed: bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukaṃpā ayaiḥ mahataḥ jana kāyasya arthāya hitāya sukhāya
translated: For the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of compassion for the world, for the sake of the great multitude, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness

original: devānāṃ ca manuṣyāṇāṃ ca ihaiva te mānuṣyake kāye vīryabalamupadarśayitvā īdṛśam
analyzed: devānām ca manuṣyāṇām ca iha eva te mānuṣyake kāye vīrya balam upadarśayitvā īdṛśam
translated: of gods and human beings. Having shown the power of diligence in this very human body, they

original: ṛddhibalamupadarśayanti /
analyzed: ṛddhi balam upadarśayanti
translated: display such supernatural power.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said,🔽Blessed One, we have never seen such a great manifestation of supernatural power as this.

original: deśayatu bhagavān raśmyāvabhāsaprādurbhāvāya dharmam
analyzed: deśayatu bhagavān raśmi avabhāsa prādurbhāvāya dharmam
translated: May the Blessed One teach the Dharma for the appearance of the light of rays.

original: SaSū evamukte bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat paśyasi tvaṃ bhaiṣajyasena trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātuḥ 🔽ṣaḍvikāraṃ prakaṃpitaḥ āha /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat paśyasi tvam bhaiṣajyasena tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ  ṣaṣ vikāram prakaṃpitaḥ āha
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃpurṇa, Do you see, Bhaiṣajya-saṃpurṇa, the great trichiliocosm

original: paśyāmi bhagavaṃ paśyāmi sugata /
analyzed: paśyāmi bhagavan paśyāmi sugata
translated: shaking in six ways? He said, I see it, Blessed One, I see it, Sugata.

original: tasya mama bhagavannevaṃ bhavatvahaṃ tathāgatametamarthaṃ paripṛccheyaṃ /
analyzed: tasya mama bhagavan evam bhavatu aham tathāgatam etam artham paripṛccheyam
translated: Blessed One, may it be so for me. I will ask the Tathāgata about this matter.

original: bhagavān āha pṛccha tvaṃ bhaiṣajyasena yadyadevākāṃkṣasyahaṃ te tasya tasyaiva praśnasya vyākaraṇena cittamārādhayiṣyāmi nirdekṣyāmi vibhajiṣyāmi
analyzed: bhagavān āha pṛccha tvam bhaiṣajyasena yat yat eva ākāṃkṣasi aham te tasya tasya eva praśnasya vyākaraṇena cittam ārādhayiṣyāmi nirdekṣyāmi vibhajiṣyāmi
translated: The Blessed One said, Ask, Bhaiṣajya-saṃpurṇa, whatever you wish. I will satisfy your mind with an explanation of each question, I will show,

original: bhaiṣajyasena yadatītānāgatapratyutpanneṣvadhvasu tatsarvaṃ darśayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: bhaiṣajyasena yat atīta anāgata pratyutpanneṣu adhvasu tat sarvam darśayiṣyāmi
translated: Bhaiṣajya-saṃpurṇa, all that in the past, future, and present.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said,

original: deśayatu me bhagavan kaukṛtyavinodanārthaṃ /
analyzed: deśayatu me bhagavan kaukṛtya vinodana artham
translated: May the Blessed One teach for the sake of dispelling remorse.

original: ihāhaṃ bhagavan paśyāmi tathāgataṃ caturaśītibhirdevaputrasahasraiḥ parivṛtaṃ caturaśītibhiḥ koṭīsahasrairbodhisattvaiḥ parivṛtaṃ /
analyzed: iha aham bhagavan paśyāmi tathāgatam caturaśītibhiḥ devaputra sahasraiḥ parivṛtam caturaśītibhiḥ koṭī sahasraiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ parivṛtam
translated: Here, Blessed One, I see the Thus-Gone One surrounded by 84,000 gods, surrounded by 84,000 koṭis of bodhisattvas,

original: dvādaśabhiḥ koṭīsahasrairnāgarājñāṃ parivṛtaṃ /
analyzed: dvādaśabhiḥ koṭī sahasraiḥ nāga rājñām parivṛtam
translated: surrounded by 12,000 koṭis of nāga kings,

original: aṣṭādaśabhiḥ koṭīsahasrairbhūtānāṃ parivṛtaṃ paṃcaviṃśatibhiḥ koṭīsahasraiḥ pretapiśācaiḥ parivṛtaṃ /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśabhiḥ koṭī sahasraiḥ bhūtānām parivṛtam paṃcaviṃśatibhiḥ koṭī sahasraiḥ preta piśācaiḥ parivṛtam
translated: surrounded by 18,000 koṭis of bhūtas, surrounded by 25,000 koṭis of pretas and piśācas.

original: SaSū bhagavān āha nūnamete bhaiṣajyasena sattvāḥ ya iha parṣadi mamāntike sannipatitā sanniṣaṇṇā dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: bhagavān āha nūnam ete bhaiṣajyasena sattvāḥ ye iha parṣadi mama antike sannipatitā sanniṣaṇṇā dharma śravaṇāya
translated: The Blessed One said, Indeed, these beings, O Bhaiṣajyasena, who have assembled and are seated in this assembly near me to listen to the Dharma,

original: ta ete bhaiṣajyasenādyaiva saṃsāraṃ paścanmukhaṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: te ete bhaiṣajyasena adya eva saṃsāram paścanmukham kariṣyanti
translated: they will turn the wheel of existence away today, O Bhaiṣajyasena.

original: adyaiva daśabhūmipratilābhino bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: adyā eva daśa bhūmi pratilābhinaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will attain the ten grounds today.

original: daśabhūmipratiṣṭhitā nirvāṇadhātaumanuprāpsyanti /
analyzed: daśa bhūmi pratiṣṭhitāḥ nirvāṇa dhātaum anuprāpsyanti
translated: Having attained the ten grounds, they will reach the realm of nirvāṇa.

original: sarvasattvahitaiṣiṇaḥ jarāmaraṇaparimokṣaṇārthāya kṛtadharmāḥ sukhāvahāḥ kleśapāśaṃ nirjitvā prāpsyante buddhaśāsanāṃ /
analyzed: sarva sattva hita eṣiṇaḥ jarā maraṇa parimokṣaṇa arthāya kṛta dharmāḥ sukha āvahāḥ kleśa pāśam nirjitvā prāpsyante buddha śāsanām
translated: Desiring the welfare of all beings, having accomplished the Dharma for the sake of being liberated from old age and death, bringing happiness, having conquered the bonds of afflictions, they will attain the Buddha's teachings.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:🔽Blessed One, Blessed One.

original: kimete bhagavan sattvā bahūni sattvasthānāni nānāvicitraiḥ karmabhiṛ utpannāni /
analyzed: kim ete bhagavan sattvāḥ bahūni sattvasthānāni nānā vicitraiḥ karmabhiḥ utpannāni
translated: What are these beings, Bhagavān, who have been born in many realms of beings due to various kinds of karma?

original: te bhagavantaṃ parivāryāvasthitāni
analyzed: te bhagavantam parivārya avasthitāni
translated: They stood surrounding the Bhagavān.

original: bhagavān āha śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena /
analyzed: bhagavān āha śṛṇu bhaiṣajyasena
translated: The Bhagavān said, Listen, Bhaiṣajyasena!

original: āha ca
analyzed: āha ca
translated: He said,

original: mūḍhāḥ sattvā na jānanti kuto mokṣo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: mūḍhāḥ sattvāḥ na jānanti kutas mokṣaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Foolish beings do not know how they will attain liberation.

original: bahavo navakāḥ sattvāḥ adya prāpsyanti dhāraṇim
analyzed: bahavaḥ navakāḥ sattvāḥ adya prāpsyanti dhāraṇim
translated: Many new beings will today attain retention.

original: jñāsyante te sarvadharmān prāptaye daśabhūmināṃ
analyzed: jñāsyante te sarva dharmān prāptaye daśa bhūminām
translated: They will know all dharmas for the attainment of the ten stages.

original: bhūmayo daśa prāpsyanti buddhakṛtyaṃ kariṣyataḥ
analyzed: bhūmayaḥ daśa prāpsyanti buddha kṛtyam kariṣyataḥ
translated: They will attain the ten stages and will perform the deeds of a Buddha.

original: vartiṣyanti dharmacakraṃ dharmavarṣaṃ pravarṣiṣūḥ
analyzed: vartiṣyanti dharma cakram dharma varṣam pravarṣiṣūḥ
translated: They will turn the wheel of Dharma and will rain down the Dharma rain.

original: ramaṇīyaṃ śāsanaṃ mahyaṃ yena sattvāḥ samāgatāḥ
analyzed: ramaṇīyam śāsanam mahyam yena sattvāḥ samāgatāḥ
translated: My teaching is delightful, by which beings have assembled.

original: devanāgāśca pretāśca asurāśca sudāruṇāḥ
analyzed: deva nāgāḥ ca pretāḥ ca asurāḥ ca su dāruṇāḥ
translated: Gods, nāgas, and terrifying asuras,

original: daśabhūmipratiṣṭhante dharmaśabdaparāhatāḥ
analyzed: daśa bhūmi pratiṣṭhante dharma śabda parāhatāḥ
translated: They will be established in the ten stages, struck by the sound of the Dharma.

original: dharmabherī udāharaṃ dharmaśaṃkhaprapūraṇaṃ
analyzed: dharma bherī dharma śaṃkha prapūraṇam
translated: They will beat the drum of the Dharma, blow the conch of the Dharma.

original: adyaiṣāṃ navasattvānāṃ vīryasthāmo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: adya eṣām nava sattvānām vīrya sthāmaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Today these new beings will have the strength of diligence.

original: dharmaṃ prāpsyanti adyeme yathā prāptaṃ tathāgataiḥ //
analyzed: dharmam prāpsyanti adyā ime yathā prāptam tathāgataiḥ
translated: Today they will attain the Dharma as it was attained by the Tathāgatas.

original: SaSū atha paṃcamātrāṇi sahasrāṇi daharāṇāṃ sattvānāmutthāyāsanebhyo yena bhagavāṃstenāṃjaliṃ praṇamayya bhagavantametadavocan
analyzed: atha paṃca mātrāṇi sahasrāṇi daharāṇām sattvānām utthāya āsanebhyaḥ yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim praṇamayya bhagavantam etat avocan
translated: Then five thousand young beings rose from their seats, bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined, and said this to the Blessed One:

original: gurubhāro bhagavan kāyo dāruṇaśca mahābhaya /
analyzed: guru bhāraḥ bhagavan kāyaḥ dāruṇaḥ ca mahā bhaya
translated: The body is a heavy burden, Blessed One, and greatly fearful.

original: saṃsāre yena badhyāmaḥ paryantamavijānakāḥ
analyzed: saṃsāre yena badhyāmaḥ paryantam avijānakāḥ
translated: By which we are killed in saṃsāra, not knowing the end.

original: mārgan tu na vijānāmo mārgameva na dṛśyate /
analyzed: mārgan tu na vijānāmaḥ mārgam eva na dṛśyate
translated: We do not know the path, the path itself is not seen.

original: andhabhūtā vayaṃ nātha asmākaṃ kuru saṃgrahaṃ /
analyzed: andha bhūtāḥ vayam nātha asmākam kuru saṃgraham
translated: We are like the blind, O Protector, have compassion on us.

original: adhyeṣāma vayaṃ vīra dharman deśaya nāyaka /
analyzed: adhyeṣāma vayam vīra dharman deśaya nāyaka
translated: We request you, O Hero, teach the Dharma, O Leader.

original: alpaprajñā vayaṃ jātā anabhijñāḥ sukhasya hi /
analyzed: alpa prajñāḥ vayam jātāḥ anabhijñāḥ sukhasya hi
translated: We have been born with little wisdom, ignorant of happiness.

original: dharman deśaya asmākaṃ duḥkhān mocaya dāruṇāt
analyzed: dharman deśaya asmākam duḥkhāt mocaya dāruṇāt
translated: Teach the Dharma to us, liberate us from terrible suffering.

original: yatra yatropapadyemaḥ syād asmād buddhadarśanaṃ //
analyzed: yatra yatra upapadyemaḥ syāt asmāt buddha darśanam
translated: Wherever we are reborn, may we see the Buddha.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo yena te daharā sattvāstenopasaṃkrāmadupasaṃkramya tān daharān sattvāṅ gāthāyā adhyabhāṣatā
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yena te daharāḥ sattvāḥ tena upasaṃkrāmat upasaṃkramya tān daharān sattvān gāthāyāḥ adhyabhāṣatā
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃbuddha approached those young beings, and having approached, he spoke this verse to those young beings:

original: bhūṃjadhvaṃ bhojanaṃ yūyaṃ pivadhvaṃ rasamadbhutam
analyzed: bhūṃjadhvam bhojanam yūyam pivadhvam rasam adbhutam
translated: Eat food, you all, drink the wondrous juice,

original: paścādviśāradā bhūtvā dharmaṃ śroṣyatha nirbhayaṃ /
analyzed: paścāt viśāradāḥ bhūtvā dharmam śroṣyatha nirbhayam
translated: Later, having become confident, you will listen to the Dharma fearlessly.

original: ta āhuḥ
analyzed: te āhuḥ
translated: They said:

original: bhadanta sthavira kastvaṃ najānīmo vayaṃ tava /
analyzed: bhadanta sthavira kaḥ tvam na jānīmaḥ vayam tava
translated: Venerable Elder, who are you? We do not know you.

original: prāsādikastvaṃ paśyāmaḥ śāntarūpaṃ mahāyaśaḥ
analyzed: prāsādikaḥ tvam paśyāmaḥ śānta rūpam mahā yaśaḥ
translated: We see that you are pleasing, with a peaceful form and great fame.

original: muktaṃ narakatiryakṣuḥ pretalokān mahābhayāt
analyzed: muktam preta lokāt mahā bhayāt
translated: You are freed from the great fears of the hells, animal realms, and ghost worlds.

original: śāntaste sarvapāpāni yathā jagati śobhase
analyzed: śāntaḥ te sarva pāpāni yathā jagati śobhase
translated: All your evil deeds are pacified, just as you shine in the world.

original: paśyāma haste karakaṃ saptaratnasamanvitam
analyzed: paśyāma haste karakam sapta ratna samanvitam
translated: We see a vessel in your hand, endowed with the seven jewels.

original: sūtraṃ ratnāmayaṃ kāye tejarāśau viveṣṭitaṃ /
analyzed: sūtram ratna āmayam kāye teja rāśau viveṣṭitam
translated: A thread made of precious jewels is wrapped around your body, a mass of radiance.

original: prativoḍhuṃ na śaktā sma śāntavākyasya te vaca /
analyzed: prativoḍhum na śaktā sma śānta vākyasya te
translated: We are unable to respond to your peaceful words.

original: bhaktena kāryaṃ nāsmākaṃ pānena svādunā na ca /
analyzed: bhaktena kāryam na asmākam pānena svādunā na ca
translated: We do not need food, nor do we need delicious drinks.

original: bhaktāduccāra saṃbhavati pānān mūtraṃ tathaiva ca /
