analyzed: bhaktāt uccāra saṃbhavati pānāt mūtram tathā eva ca
translated: From food comes excrement, and from drinks comes urine.

original: śoṇitaṃ ca rasādbhavati raktān māṃsaṃ ca saṃbhavet🔽nāsmākaṃ bhojanaṃ kāryaṃ pānān caiva sausaṃskṛtaṃ /🔽vastrāṇi naiva sūkṣmāṇi paṭṭāpaṭṭakasaṃhitā /
analyzed: śoṇitam ca rasāt bhavati raktāt māṃsam ca saṃbhavet  na asmākam bhojanam kāryam pānān ca eva sausaṃskṛtam  vastrāṇi nā eva sūkṣmāṇi paṭṭa apaṭṭaka saṃhitā
translated: From juice comes blood, and from blood flesh is produced.🔽We do not need food or well-prepared drinks.🔽We do not need fine clothes, nor those made of silk or cotton.

original: kaṭakāśca na sauvarṇāḥ kāryā muktilatā na ca /
analyzed: kaṭakāḥ ca na sauvarṇāḥ kāryāḥ mukti latāḥ na ca
translated: We do not need golden bracelets, nor pearl necklaces.

original: aṅguliyairnaiva kāryaṃ sarve te nityadharmiṇaḥ
analyzed: aṅguliyaiḥ nā eva kāryam sarve te nitya dharmiṇaḥ
translated: We will not do anything with our fingers, all of us are always observing the Dharma.

original: jīvitairarthikāśca sma na ca gacchema durgatim
analyzed: jīvitaiḥ arthikāḥ ca sma na ca gacchema durgatim
translated: We are seeking for the sake of life, and we will not go to a bad rebirth.

original: arthikā dharmadānena na devānāṃ sukhairapi /
analyzed: arthikāḥ dharma dānena na devānām sukhaiḥ api
translated: We are seeking for the gift of the Dharma, not even for the happiness of the gods.

original: kalyāṇamitratā kāryā na rājyaṃ cakravartināṃ /
analyzed: kalyāṇa mitra tā kāryā na rājyam cakravartinām
translated: We should be good spiritual friends, not for the sake of the kingdoms of universal monarchs.

original: cakravartī mariṣyanti tyaktvā dvīpān suśobhanāṃ /
analyzed: cakravartī mariṣyanti tyaktvā dvīpān su śobhanām
translated: Universal monarchs will die, having abandoned their beautiful continents.

original: na putrāḥ pṛṣṭhato yānti na bhāryā na ca dhītarāḥ
analyzed: na putrāḥ pṛṣṭhatas yānti na bhāryāḥ na ca dhītarāḥ
translated: Sons do not go behind them, nor wives nor daughters.

original: saptaratnā nivartyante nāpi yāsyanti pṛṣṭhataḥ
analyzed: sapta ratnāḥ nivartyante na api yāsyanti pṛṣṭhatas
translated: The seven treasures turn back, and they will not go behind.

original: saṃnnipātya bahujano na ca yāsyanti pṛṣṭhataḥ
analyzed: saṃnnipātya bahu janaḥ na ca yāsyanti pṛṣṭhatas
translated: Having assembled many people, they will not go behind.

original: purataśca na dhāvante vaśaṃ bhūyo na vartati /
analyzed: puratas ca na dhāvante vaśam bhūyas na vartati
translated: They do not run in front, and they do not return to power again.

original: ekajanmikarājāno bhrāmitā nityayā bahu /
analyzed: ekajanmika rājānaḥ bhrāmitāḥ nityayā bahu
translated: The kings of one life, deluded by permanence, are deluded by much.

original: kṛtvā pāpāni karmāṇi rauravaṃ prapatanti te /
analyzed: kṛtvā pāpāni karmāṇi rauravam prapatanti te
translated: Having done evil deeds, they fall into the Raurava hell.

original: caturdiśaṃ paryaṇvitvā saptaratnairmahardhikaiḥ
analyzed: caturdiśam sapta ratnaiḥ mahardhikaiḥ
translated: Having gone around in the four directions with the seven treasures of great power

original: yāsyate kva ca sā ṛddhiryadā vatsyati raurave /
analyzed: yāsyate kva ca sā ṛddhiḥ yadā vatsyati raurave
translated: Where will that power go when one dwells in the Raurava hell?

original: mṛtā ṛddhiṃ na śaknonti yatra bhūmirna vidyate
analyzed: mṛtāḥ ṛddhim na śaknonti yatra bhūmiḥ na vidyate
translated: The dead are not able to have power where there is no earth.

original: sthavira śṛṇuṣva asmākaṃ gaccha yena tathāgataḥ
analyzed: sthavira śṛṇuṣva asmākam gaccha yena tathāgataḥ
translated: Elder, listen to us, go to where the Tathāgata is.

original: kāṃkṣāma darśanaṃ tasya mātāpitroryathaiva hi /
analyzed: kāṃkṣāma darśanam tasya mātā pitroḥ yathā eva hi
translated: Just as the mother and father have a desire to see him, thinking, When will our son come?

original: nāsmākaṃ vidyate mātā na pitā bhrātarau na ca
analyzed: na asmākam vidyate mātā na pitā bhrātarau na ca
translated: As for the mother and father, they have a desire to see him, thinking, We are without a mother, without a father, without brothers, and without relatives.

original: saiva lokagururmātā pitā caiva tathāgataḥ
analyzed: sā eva loka guruḥ mātā pitā ca eva tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathāgata is the mother and father, the teacher of the world.

original: saiva candraśca sūryaśca kṣemamārgapradarśakaḥ
analyzed: sā eva candraḥ ca sūryaḥ ca kṣema mārga pradarśakaḥ
translated: He is the moon, the sun, the one who shows the path to safety.

original: mocakaḥ sa hi saṃsārād yena bhūyo na jāyate /
analyzed: mocakaḥ sa hi saṃsārāt yena bhūyas na jāyate
translated: He is the one who liberates from saṃsāra, from which one is not reborn.

original: sa nāvātarako oghāt kleśoghācca mahābhayāt
analyzed: sa na avātarakaḥ oghāt kleśa oghāt ca mahā bhayāt
translated: He is the one who crosses the flood, the great fear of the flood of afflictions.

original: tena pratāritāḥ sattvāḥ na bhūyo vinivartitā
analyzed: tena pratāritāḥ sattvāḥ na bhūyas vinivartitā
translated: The beings who are led by him do not return again.

original: saddharmo deśitastena agrabodhīya kāraṇāt
analyzed: saddharmaḥ deśitaḥ tena agrabodhīya kāraṇāt
translated: He teaches the true Dharma for the sake of supreme enlightenment.

original: nāsmākaṃ bhojanenārtho na rājyaphalakāṃkṣiṇaḥ
analyzed: na asmākam bhojanena arthaḥ na rājya phala kāṃkṣiṇaḥ
translated: We have no need for food, nor do we desire the fruits of kingship.

original: na devalokagamanaṃ kāryaṃ narakabhīrubhiḥ
analyzed: na deva loka gamanam kāryam naraka bhīrubhiḥ
translated: Those who fear hell should not go to the world of the gods.

original: sukhaṃ mānuṣyakaṃ janma dṛśyate yatra sarvavit
analyzed: sukham mānuṣyakam janma dṛśyate yatra sarva vid
translated: The birth of a human is seen to be happy, where the Omniscient One is seen.

original: alpāyuṣāśca dṛśyante duṣkṛtaiḥ karmabhiḥ svakaiḥ
analyzed: alpa āyuṣāḥ ca dṛśyante duṣkṛtaiḥ karmabhiḥ svakaiḥ
translated: Those with short lifespans are seen due to their own evil actions.

original: rajyante kāmabhogaiste vindanti maraṇaṃ na ca /
analyzed: rajyante kāma bhogaiḥ te vindanti maraṇam na ca
translated: They delight in the enjoyment of desires, but do not find death.

original: jānanti na ca bhāyante nirodhotpādavāṃcitāḥ
analyzed: jānanti na ca bhāyante nirodha utpāda vāṃcitāḥ
translated: They do not know and are not afraid, desiring cessation and origination.

original: sukṣmān dharmān na jānanti sūkṣmaṃ kāryaṃ na kurvante /
analyzed: sukṣmān dharmān na jānanti sūkṣmam kāryam na kurvante
translated: They do not know the subtle dharmas, they do not perform the subtle actions.

original: śāntaṃ dhātuṃ na jānanti avidyākrāntacetasaḥ
analyzed: śāntam dhātum na jānanti avidyā ākrānta cetasaḥ
translated: They do not know the peaceful realm, their minds overwhelmed by ignorance.

original: cyavanto na ca khidyante jāyantaśca punaḥ puna
analyzed: cyavantaḥ na ca khidyante jāyantaḥ ca punar punar
translated: They die and are not weary, and are born again and again.

original: dīrgharātraṃ duḥkhahatā nityatā daṇḍatāḍitāḥ
analyzed: dīrgharātram duḥkha hatāḥ daṇḍa tāḍitāḥ
translated: For a long time, struck by the stick of impermanence, they are afflicted by suffering.

original: parakīyaṃ hariṣyanti ghātyante bandhane tathā /
analyzed: parakīyam hariṣyanti ghātyante bandhane tathā
translated: They will steal what belongs to others, and are killed and bound accordingly.

original: paṃcabandhanabaddhāste pūrvapāpena coditāḥ
analyzed: paṃcabandhana baddhāḥ te pūrva pāpena coditāḥ
translated: Bound by the five bonds, impelled by their previous evil deeds,

original: nirāśāśca mariṣyanti śokaśalyasamarpitā /
analyzed: nirāśāḥ ca mariṣyanti śoka śalya samarpitā
translated: They will die in despair, their hearts pierced by the stake of grief.

original: niruddhyamāne vijñāne karuṇaṃ paridevate /
analyzed: niruddhyamāne vijñāne karuṇam paridevate
translated: When consciousness is obstructed, he laments with compassion:

original: ko nu trātā bhaveyurme sarvān bhogān dadāmyahaṃ /
analyzed: kaḥ nu trātā bhaveyuḥ me sarvān bhogān dadāmi aham
translated: Who will be my protector? I will give all my possessions.

original: suvarṇarupyasphaṭikaṃ dāso 'pi ca bhavāmyahaṃ /
analyzed: suvarṇa rupya sphaṭikam ca bhavāmi aham
translated: Gold, silver, crystal, I will even be a slave.

original: sarvaṃ karma kariṣyāmi dāsayogyaṃ ca yadbhavet
analyzed: sarvam karma kariṣyāmi dāsa yogyam ca yat bhavet
translated: I will do all the work that is suitable for a slave.

original: na rājyabhogairme kāryaṃ na dhānyena dhanena ca /
analyzed: na rājya bhogaiḥ me kāryam na dhānyena dhanena ca
translated: I have no need for the enjoyments of a kingdom, for grain or wealth.

original: svaśarīreṇa me kāryaṃ pāpakārī na mucyate
analyzed: sva śarīreṇa me kāryam pāpa kārī na mucyate
translated: I have need for my own body, one who commits evil is not freed.

original: evaṃ hi sthavirāsmākaṃ na kāryaṃ bhojanaṃ bhavet
analyzed: evam hi sthavira asmākam na kāryam bhojanam bhavet
translated: Thus, for us elders, food would not be necessary.

original: rājāno 'pi mariṣyanti yairbhuktaṃ mṛṣṭabhojanam
analyzed: rājānaḥ pi mariṣyanti yaiḥ bhuktam mṛṣṭa bhojanam
translated: Even kings will die, those who have eaten delicious food.

original: devaputrā mariṣyanti pītvā vai pānamuttamam
analyzed: deva putrāḥ mariṣyanti pītvā vai pānam uttamam
translated: Sons of gods will die, having drunk the best drink.

original: nānārasamāyuktaṃ saṃskṛtaṃ pānabhojanam🔽ānīya purato rājā jihvayā spṛśati bhojana /
analyzed: nānā rasa māyuktam saṃskṛtam pāna bhojanam  ānīya puratas rājā jihvayā spṛśati bhojana
translated: With various flavors, the prepared drink and food,🔽The king brought it before him and touched the food with his tongue.

original: rasagṛddhā hi rājānaḥ pāpaṃ kurvantyanalpakaṃ /
analyzed: rasa gṛddhāḥ hi rājānaḥ pāpam kurvanti analpakam
translated: Kings, greedy for flavors, commit much evil.

original: rajyantyanityehi rasehi yatra sāraṃ na vidyate /
analyzed: rajyanti anityehi rasehi yatra sāram na vidyate
translated: They are attached to impermanent flavors, where there is no essence,

original: pānaṃ na kāryaṃ asmākaṃ na ca kāryaṃ hi bhojanaṃ /
analyzed: pānam na kāryam asmākam na ca kāryam hi bhojanam
translated: We should not drink, nor should we eat,

original: dharmatā īdṛśī kāryā duḥkhān mucyema yadvayam
analyzed: dharmatā īdṛśī kāryā duḥkhāt mucyema yat vayam
translated: This kind of Dharma should be done, so that we may be freed from suffering.

original: tṛṣṇābandhananirmuktaṃ tṛṣṇākleśavimokṣanam
translated: Freed from the bondage of craving, liberated from the defilement of craving,

original: sarvabandhananirmuktaṃ taṃ buddhaṃ śaraṇaṃ gatāḥ
analyzed: sarva bandhana nirmuktam tam buddham śaraṇam gatāḥ
translated: Freed from all bondage, we go for refuge to that Buddha.

original: vayaṃ hi śaraṇaṃ yāmo lokanāthaṃ maharṣiṇam
analyzed: vayam hi śaraṇam yāmaḥ loka nātham mahā ṛṣiṇam
translated: We go for refuge to the protector of the world, the great sage,

original: vandanāya vayaṃ yāmaḥ sattvānāṃ priyadarśanam
analyzed: vandanāya vayam yāmaḥ sattvānām priya darśanam
translated: We go to pay homage to the one who is dear to see for beings.

original: nāmaṃ tava na jānāmo nāmamācakṣva śobhanaṃ /
analyzed: nāmam tava na jānāmaḥ nāmam ācakṣva śobhanam
translated: We do not know your name, please tell us your auspicious name.

original: bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattva āha
analyzed: bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Bhaiṣajya-senā said,

original: yūyaṃ hi śrotumicchadhvaṃ nāmaṃ sarvajanasya ca /
analyzed: yūyam hi śrotum icchadhvam nāmam sarva janasya ca
translated: You all wish to hear the name of all beings,

original: vṛtaḥ koṭīśatasahasrairnavakaiḥ sattvaistathāgataḥ
analyzed: vṛtaḥ koṭī śata sahasraiḥ navakaiḥ sattvaiḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathāgata is surrounded by nine hundred thousand koṭis of new beings.

original: ta āhuḥ tava tu śrotumicchāmo nāmaṃ sarvaguṇodbhavaṃ /
analyzed: te āhuḥ tava tu śrotum icchāmaḥ nāmam sarva guṇa udbhavam
translated: They said, We wish to hear your name, which arises from all good qualities,🔽

original: gaṃbhīraṃ śrūyate nāma yastvaṃ buddhānā śrāvakaḥ āha /
analyzed: gaṃbhīram śrūyate nāma yaḥ tvam śrāvakaḥ āha
translated: Your name is heard to be profound, and you are a disciple of the Buddhas. He said:

original: bhaiṣajyaseno nāmnāhaṃ sattvānāṃ bhaiṣajyo hyahaṃ
analyzed: bhaiṣajyasenaḥ nāmnā aham sattvānām bhaiṣajyaḥ hi aham
translated: Your name is heard to be profound, and you are a disciple of the Buddhas. He said: I am named Bhaiṣajyasena, for I am the medicine for beings.

original: yuṣmākaṃ deśayaiṣyāmi sarveṣāmauṣadhaṃ varaṃ /
analyzed: yuṣmākam deśayaiṣyāmi sarveṣām auṣadham varam
translated: I will teach you all the supreme medicine,

original: sarvavyādhipraśamanaṃ sarvavyādhihate jane /
analyzed: sarva vyādhi praśamanam sarva vyādhi hate jane
translated: Which alleviates all illnesses in afflicted people.

original: rāgo vyādhirmahāvyādhirloke naśyati dāruṇaḥ
analyzed: rāgaḥ vyādhiḥ mahā vyādhiḥ loke naśyati dāruṇaḥ
translated: Passion is a great illness, a terrible disease that destroys the world,

original: moho vyādhirmahāghoro yena bhrāmyantyabuddhayaḥ
analyzed: mohaḥ vyādhiḥ mahā ghoraḥ yena bhrāmyanti abuddhayaḥ
translated: Delusion is a greatly terrible disease by which the unwise wander,

original: vrajanti narakaṃ sattvāstiryakpreteṣu vai tathā /
analyzed: vrajanti narakam sattvāḥ tiryak preteṣu vai tathā
translated: Beings go to hell, and likewise to the animal realm and hungry ghosts,

original: dveṣagrastā ime bālāsteṣāṃ śāntiḥ kathaṃ bhavet //
analyzed: dveṣa grastāḥ ime bālāḥ teṣām śāntiḥ katham bhavet
translated: These foolish ones are seized by hatred, how can there be peace for them?

original: ta āhuḥ
analyzed: te āhuḥ
translated: They said:

original: mucyema sarvaduḥkhātaḥ śrutvā dharmamimaṃ śubhaṃ /
analyzed: mucyema sarva duḥkhātaḥ śrutvā dharmam imam śubham
translated: May we be freed from all suffering upon hearing this auspicious Dharma.

original: muktaśca sarvaduḥkhebhyo bālabuddhirajānakāḥ
analyzed: muktaḥ ca sarva duḥkhebhyaḥ bāla buddhiḥ ajānakāḥ
translated: Freed from all suffering, the unwise ones with childish understanding,

original: śroṣyāmahe dharmadānaṃ pāpakarmavivarjitāḥ
analyzed: śroṣyāmahe dharma dānam pāpa karma vivarjitāḥ
translated: We will listen to the gift of the Dharma, abandoning evil actions.

original: sarvapāpaṃ vivarjitvā prahīṇabhayabhairavāḥ
analyzed: sarva pāpam vivarjitvā prahīṇa bhaya bhairavāḥ
translated: Abandoning all evil, having eliminated fear and terror,

original: drakṣyāma śīghraṃ saṃbuddhaṃ sarvavyādhipramocakaṃ /
analyzed: drakṣyāma śīghram saṃbuddham sarva vyādhi pramocakam
translated: We will quickly see the fully enlightened one, the liberator from all illnesses,

original: vaidyarājaṃ mahāvaidyaṃ duḥkhitānāṃ cikitsakaṃ /
analyzed: vaidya rājam mahā vaidyam duḥkhitānām cikitsakam
translated: The king of physicians, the great physician, the healer of the afflicted.

original: gaccha sthavira śīghraṃ tvaṃ vandanāya tathāgataṃ /
analyzed: gaccha sthavira śīghram tvam vandanāya tathāgatam
translated: Go, elder, quickly to the Tathagata to pay homage,

original: vandasva cāsmadvacanā brūhi lokavināyakaṃ /
analyzed: vandasva ca asmad vacanā brūhi loka vināyakam
translated: and speak these words of ours to the Lord of the World:

original: praśāmaya imaṃ vyādhiṃ praśamayāgniṃ sudāruṇam
analyzed: praśāmaya imam vyādhim praśamaya agnim su dāruṇam
translated: Quell this disease, quell this terrible fire,

original: kāyo yaṃ jvalitaḥ sarvo dahyamāno na śāmyate /
analyzed: kāyaḥ yam jvalitaḥ sarvaḥ dahyamānaḥ na śāmyate
translated: which burns the whole body, burning without ceasing.

original: duḥkhārditānāmasmākaṃ kāryuṇyaṃ kuru subrata /
analyzed: duḥkha arditānām asmākam kāryuṇyam kuru subrata
translated: Have compassion on us who are afflicted with suffering, O well-disciplined one.

original: kāyabhāro mahābhārastīkṣṇabhāraḥ sudāruṇaḥ
analyzed: kāya bhāraḥ mahā bhāraḥ tīkṣṇa bhāraḥ su dāruṇaḥ
translated: The burden of the body is a great burden, a sharp and terrible burden,

original: dveṣamohasamākrānta udvahanti janāḥ sadā /
analyzed: dveṣa moha samākrāntaḥ udvahanti janāḥ sadā
translated: overcome by hatred and delusion, people always carry it.

original: punaḥ punarbahaṃtyete mokṣabhāraṃ ajānakāḥ
analyzed: punar punar bahaṃti ete mokṣa bhāram a jānakāḥ
translated: Again and again, those who do not know carry the burden of liberation,

original: martavyaṃ na vijānante trāso notpadyate tha ca /
analyzed: martavyam na vijānante trāsaḥ na utpadyate ca
translated: they do not know that they must die, and fear does not arise in them.

original: mokṣamārgaṃ ajānānā mokṣamārgamapaśyakāḥ
analyzed: mokṣa mārgam a jānānāḥ mokṣa mārgam apaśyakāḥ
translated: Not knowing the path of liberation, not seeing the path of liberation,

original: asmākaṃ maraṇaṃ nāsti kadāciditi susthitāḥ
analyzed: asmākam maraṇam na asti kadācid iti susthitāḥ
translated: they are well-settled, thinking, We will never die.

original: saṃbhrāntā na vijānanti paśyanto mātaraṃ mṛtā /
analyzed: saṃbhrāntāḥ na vijānanti paśyantaḥ mātaram mṛtā
translated: Distressed, they do not know, seeing their mother dead.

original: pitaraṃ na smarantyanye nityaṃ ca vyādhipīḍitāḥ
analyzed: pitaram na smaranti anye nityam ca vyādhi pīḍitāḥ
translated: Others do not remember their father, always afflicted with disease.

original: kleśakarmapraluḍitāḥ kathaṃ bhūṃjāma bhojanaṃ /
analyzed: kleśa karma praluḍitāḥ katham bhūṃjāma bhojanam
translated: Bewildered by afflictions and karma, how should we eat food?

original: duḥkhāntaṃ na vijānāmaḥ śramāmo 'tha nirarthakaṃ /
analyzed: duḥkhāntam na vijānāmaḥ nirarthakam
translated: We do not know the end of suffering, we strive in vain.

original: asmākamīdṛśān duḥkhāṃ jātyavidyānidānataḥ
analyzed: asmākam īdṛśān duḥkhām jātya vidyā nidānataḥ
translated: For us, such suffering arises from the ignorance of birth.

original: mahābhayaṃ gurubhāraṃ saṃjñāsaṃskāravedanā /
analyzed: mahā bhayam guru bhāram saṃjñā saṃskāra vedanā
translated: The great fear, the heavy burden, is due to perception, formations, and feeling.

original: tṛṣṇāyā bhrāmyate bālo yo dharmaṃ na vijānate /
analyzed: tṛṣṇāyāḥ bhrāmyate bālaḥ yaḥ dharmam na vijānate
translated: The fool is deluded by craving, who does not understand the Dharma.

original: jāto loke hyanarthāya kāyabhāraparivṛta
analyzed: jātaḥ loke hi anarthāya kāya bhāra parivṛta
translated: Born in the world for misfortune, surrounded by the burden of the body.

original: snānānulepanaiḥ kāryaṃ śucirvastraṃ suśobhanaṃ /
analyzed: snāna anulepanaiḥ kāryam śuciḥ vastram su śobhanam
translated: Bathing, anointing, one should be clean, with beautiful clothes.

original: mṛṣṭaṃ ca bhojanaṃ kāryaṃ yaccharīre manoramaṃ /
analyzed: mṛṣṭam ca bhojanam kāryam yat śarīre manoramam
translated: Delicious food should be taken, which is pleasing to the body.

original: paṃcatūryāmanojñaṃ ca śrotraṃ yācayate tathā /
analyzed: paṃca tūryā manojñam ca śrotram yācayate tathā
translated: The ear also requests pleasant sounds from the five musical instruments.

original: saptaratnasamutthāne rūpe rajyanti cakṣuṣī /
analyzed: sapta ratna samutthāne rūpe rajyanti cakṣuṣī
translated: The eyes are attached to forms that arise from the seven precious substances.

original: sarvaṃ rasaṃ ca mṛṣṭaṃ ca jihvā yācayate 'pi ca /🔽sparśaṃ ca mṛdukaṃ sūkṣmaṃ kāyaḥ prārthayate sadā /
analyzed: sarvam rasam ca mṛṣṭam ca jihvā yācayate ca  sparśam ca mṛdukam sūkṣmam kāyaḥ prārthayate sadā
translated: The tongue also requests all tastes and flavors.🔽The body always desires soft and subtle touch.

original: māṃsadvayaṃ śarīreṇa niṣpīḍya ratī jāyate /
analyzed: māṃsa dvayam śarīreṇa niṣpīḍya ratī jāyate
translated: Pleasure arises by squeezing the two pieces of flesh with the body.

original: kāyo hyacetano hyeṣa ratiṃ kastatra vindati /
analyzed: kāyaḥ hi acetanaḥ hi eṣa ratim kaḥ tatra vindati
translated: This body is indeed insensate, who finds pleasure in that?

original: pādau me ramatastatra prāvṛtaṃ carma sundaraṃ /🔽bhavanti maraṇatrāṇa na vastraṃ na vilepanam
analyzed: pādau me ramataḥ tatra prāvṛtam carma sundaram  bhavanti maraṇa trāṇa na vastram na vilepanam
translated: My feet are delighted there, and the beautiful skin is covered.🔽Clothes and ointments are not a protection from death.

original: bhaveccharīraṃ na trāṇaṃ kiṃ punarvastralepanaṃ /
analyzed: bhavet śarīram na trāṇam kim punar vastra lepanam
translated: The body itself is not a protection, what to speak of clothes and ointments.

original: puruṣa ucyate kāyameti śvāsaṃ mahābalaṃ
analyzed: puruṣaḥ ucyate kāyam eti śvāsam mahā balam
translated: The man is said to enter the body, with great strength in breathing,

original: tīkṣṇaṃ balaṃ pratisaṃkhyā taṃ taccharīre mahāguṇaṃ /
analyzed: tīkṣṇam balam pratisaṃkhyā tam tad śarīre mahā guṇam
translated: sharp strength, and discernment, that great quality in the body.

original: krīḍayā bhrāmitaḥ pūrvamaśvahastiparivṛtaḥ
analyzed: krīḍayā bhrāmitaḥ pūrvam aśva hasti parivṛtaḥ
translated: Previously, surrounded by horses and elephants, I was whirled around in play,

original: mokṣadharmamajānāno rato 'haṃ pāpakarmaṇi /
analyzed: mokṣa dharmam a jānānaḥ rataḥ ham pāpa karmaṇi
translated: ignorant of the Dharma of liberation, I delighted in sinful deeds.

original: krīḍyā kārāpitaṃ pāpaṃ paralokamajānatā /
analyzed: krīḍyā kārāpitam pāpam para lokam a jānatā
translated: The sin committed in play, not knowing about the next world,

original: punaḥ punaśca jāto 'haṃ punarmaraṇamāgataḥ
analyzed: punar punar ca jātaḥ ham punar maraṇam āgataḥ
translated: I was born again and again, and again came to death.

original: śokaḥ punaḥ punardṛṣṭaṃ paridevitabandhanaṃ /
analyzed: śokaḥ punar punar dṛṣṭam paridevita bandhanam
translated: Grief is seen again and again, and the bondage of lamenting,

original: mātṝṇāṃ maraṇaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ dṛṣṭāśca pitaro mṛtā /
analyzed: mātṝṇām maraṇam dṛṣṭam dṛṣṭāḥ ca pitaraḥ mṛtā
translated: The death of mothers is seen, and fathers are seen to die.

original: jñātayo bhaginī caiva putrā bhāryā mṛtāpi ca /
analyzed: jñātayaḥ bhaginī ca eva putrāḥ bhāryā mṛtā api ca
translated: Relatives, sisters, sons, and wives have also died.

original: śūnyāḥ sarve hi saṃskārāḥ ko hi rajyet sacetanaḥ
analyzed: śūnyāḥ sarve hi saṃskārāḥ kaḥ hi rajyet sa cetanaḥ
translated: All conditioned things are empty, who would be attached, if conscious?

original: viśvāsaṃ hi mayā jñātaṃ lobhagrastena cetasā /
analyzed: viśvāsam hi mayā jñātam lobha grastena cetasā
translated: I have known trust, with a mind seized by greed.

original: śāntaṃ dharmaṃ nopalabdhaṃ maraṇaṃ nābhinanditaṃ /
analyzed: śāntam dharmam na upalabdham maraṇam na abhinanditam
translated: The peaceful Dharma was not attained, death was not welcomed.

original: tena dānaṃ na dattaṃ me lobhenāvṛtacetasā /
analyzed: tena dānam na dattam me lobhena āvṛta cetasā
translated: Therefore, I did not give charity, with a mind covered by greed.

original: kaḥ syā lobhasamo pāpo yo 'dyāpi na nivartate /
analyzed: kaḥ syāḥ pāpaḥ yaḥ dyā api na nivartate
translated: What sin is equal to greed, which does not cease even now?

original: saṃbhrāntā hi vayaṃ jātāḥ saṃbhrāntaṃ sakalaṃ jagat
analyzed: saṃbhrāntāḥ hi vayam jātāḥ saṃbhrāntam sakalam jagat
translated: We are born in confusion, the whole world is confused.

original: saṃbhrāntāḥ śabdaṃ śṛṇumo asaddharmaparigrahaṃ /
analyzed: saṃbhrāntāḥ śabdam śṛṇumaḥ asat dharma parigraham
translated: We hear the sound of confusion, We uphold the wrong Dharma.

original: mokṣaṃ dhyānāśca margāmaḥ śarīraṃ nodvahāmahe /
analyzed: mokṣam dhyānāḥ ca margāmaḥ śarīram na udvahāmahe
translated: We seek liberation and meditation, but we do not uphold the body.

original: buddhā bhavema lokārthe śāstāro guravo jage /
analyzed: buddhāḥ bhavema loka arthe śāstāraḥ guravaḥ jage
translated: We wish to become Buddhas for the sake of the world, teachers and guides for the people.

original: buddho mātāpitā loke buddho mārgapradarśakaḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ mātā pitā loke buddhaḥ mārga pradarśakaḥ
translated: The Buddha is the father and mother of the world, the Buddha shows the path.

original: pravarṣate dharmavarṣaṃ jaṃbudvīpe samantataḥ
analyzed: pravarṣate dharma varṣam jaṃbudvīpe samantataḥ
translated: He rains down the rain of Dharma everywhere in Jambudvipa.

original: mūḍhā sattvā na jānanti dharmāṇāṃ saṃgrahaṃ kathaṃ /
analyzed: mūḍhāḥ sattvāḥ na jānanti dharmāṇām saṃgraham katham
translated: Foolish beings do not know how to gather the Dharma.

original: bodhau cittaṃ nāmayitvā labhyate dharmasaṃgrahaḥ
analyzed: bodhau cittam nāmayitvā labhyate dharma saṃgrahaḥ
translated: By directing the mind towards enlightenment, the gathering of the Dharma is attained.

original: śunyatāḥ sarvasasṃkārāḥ śunyā bhogā dhanaṃ tathā /
analyzed: śunyatāḥ sarva sasṃkārāḥ śunyāḥ bhogāḥ dhanam tathā
translated: All conditioned things are empty, enjoyments and wealth are also empty.

original: paśyāma śunyamātmānaṃ dṛṣṭvā jātā nirāśatā /
analyzed: paśyāma śunyam ātmānam dṛṣṭvā jātāḥ nirāśa tā
translated: We see the self as empty, having seen, we become free from hope.

original: sthavira bhaiṣajyasenamasmākaṃ vacanaṃ śṛṇu /
analyzed: sthavira bhaiṣajyasenam asmākam vacanam śṛṇu
translated: Elder Bhaisajyasena, listen to our words.

original: dūraṃ ca te visarjema bodhisattvānā kāraṇāt
analyzed: dūram ca te visarjema bodhisattvānā kāraṇāt
translated: We will send you far away for the sake of the Bodhisattvas.

original: bodhisattvā na khidyante vīryavanto mahātapāḥ
analyzed: bodhisattvāḥ na khidyante vīryavantaḥ mahā tapāḥ
translated: The Bodhisattvas are not weary, they are diligent and have great austerities.

original: smṛtvā saṃsāradoṣāṇi kurvante guṇasaṃgrahaṃ /
analyzed: smṛtvā saṃsāra doṣāṇi kurvante guṇa saṃgraham
translated: Remembering the faults of samsara, they gather the qualities.

original: gacchasva yena śāstāsau pṛccha cāsmāka kāranāt
analyzed: gacchasva yena śāstā asau pṛccha ca asmāka kāranāt
translated: Go to where the Teacher is and ask on our behalf.

original: pratilabdhasukhaḥ śāstā mā kiṃcit khidyate jinaḥ
analyzed: pratilabdha sukhaḥ śāstā mā kiṃcid khidyate jinaḥ
translated: The Teacher has attained happiness, may the Victor not be troubled by anything.

original: parājitastvayā māraḥ sabalaśca savāhanaḥ
analyzed: parājitaḥ tvayā māraḥ sa balaḥ ca sa vāhanaḥ
translated: You have defeated Māra, along with his army and mounts.

original: śīghramujvālitaṃ dharmaṃ sarvasattvasukhāvahaṃ /
analyzed: śīghram ujvālitam dharmam sarva sattva sukha āvaham
translated: Quickly light the Dharma that brings happiness to all beings.

original: na cāsmābhiḥ śruto dharmo yena buddhā bhavemahe /
analyzed: na ca asmābhiḥ śrutaḥ dharmaḥ yena buddhāḥ bhavemahe
translated: We have not heard the Dharma by which we may become Buddhas.

original: gacchasva śīghraṃ sthavira asmākaṃ hitakāraṇāt
analyzed: gacchasva śīghram sthavira asmākam hita kāraṇāt
translated: Go quickly, elder, for our benefit.

original: nottarāmo vayaṃ yāvanna paśyāmastathāgataṃ /
analyzed: na uttarāmaḥ vayam yāvat na paśyāmaḥ tathāgatam
translated: We will not rise up until we see the Tathāgata.

original: dvātṛṃśalakṣaṇadharaṃ sthitā sarve sagauravāḥ //
analyzed: dvātṛṃśa lakṣaṇa dharam sthitā sarve sa gauravāḥ
translated: We all stand here with respect, bearing the thirty-two marks.

original: bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattva āha
analyzed: bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Bhaiṣajya-sena said

original: ūrdhvaṃ tāvannirīkṣadhvaṃ kiṃ paśyadhvaṃ hi sāṃprataṃ /
analyzed: ūrdhvam tāvat nirīkṣadhvam kim paśyadhvam hi sāṃpratam
translated: Look up now, what do you see at present?🔽They looked up and saw five hundred

original: avalokayanti te ūrdhvaṃ sthitā paṃca anūnakāḥ
analyzed: avalokayanti te ūrdhvam sthitā paṃca anūnakāḥ
translated: monks standing in the sky,

original: śatāstrayaḥ sahasrāṇi kūṭāgārāḥ samantataḥ
analyzed: śatāḥ trayaḥ sahasrāṇi kūṭāgārāḥ samantataḥ
translated: three thousand in all, surrounding the kūṭāgāra

original: saptaratnasamārūḍhā ratnajālasvalaṃkṛtāḥ
analyzed: sapta ratna samārūḍhāḥ ratna jāla su alaṃkṛtāḥ
translated: made of the seven precious substances, adorned with jeweled nets,

original: padmaṃ praphullaṃ madhye ca divyagandhapramuñcanaṃ /
analyzed: padmam praphullam madhye ca divya gandha pramuñcanam
translated: with a fully blossomed lotus in the middle, emitting a divine fragrance.

original: pṛcchanti sthaviraṃ tatra kimetadiha dṛśyate
analyzed: pṛcchanti sthaviram tatra kim etat iha dṛśyate
translated: They asked the elder there, What is this seen here?

original: kūṭāgārā ratnajālāḥ padmakesarasaṃsthitāḥ
analyzed: kūṭāgārāḥ ratna jālāḥ padma kesara saṃsthitāḥ
translated: Kūṭāgāras made of jeweled nets, standing on lotus filaments.

original: bhaiṣajayasena āha
analyzed: bhaiṣajayasenaḥ āha
translated: Bhaiṣajya-sena said:

original: sthānānyetāni yuṣmākaṃ gacchadhvaṃ buddhadarśanaṃ /
analyzed: sthānāni etāni yuṣmākam gacchadhvam buddha darśanam
translated: These are your places. Go to see the Buddha,

original: vandadhvaṃ lokapradyotaṃ yo 'sau lokottaro guruḥ //
analyzed: vandadhvam loka pradyotam sau loka uttaraḥ guruḥ
translated: and pay homage to the Light of the World, who is the world's unsurpassed teacher.

original: ta āha
analyzed: te āha
translated: They said:

original: tatra mārgaṃ na jānīmo na paśyāmastathāgataṃ /
analyzed: tatra mārgam na jānīmaḥ na paśyāmaḥ tathāgatam
translated: We do not know the path there, nor do we see the Tathāgata.

original: yatra mārgaṃ na jānīmaḥ kva gacchāma vandituṃ /
analyzed: yatra mārgam na jānīmaḥ kva gacchāma vanditum
translated: Where we do not know the path, how can we go to pay homage?

original: bhaiṣajyasena āha
analyzed: bhaiṣajyasenaḥ āha
translated: Bhaiṣajya-senā said:

original: vandanāya ca gantavyaṃ śāstāramamṛtaprabhaṃ /
analyzed: vandanāya ca gantavyam śāstāram amṛta prabham
translated: You should go to pay homage to the Teacher, the one with the nectar-like radiance.

original: anantamākāśamiva parāmārṣṭuṃ na śakyate /
analyzed: anantam ākāśam iva parāmārṣṭum na śakyate
translated: It is not possible to touch him, who is infinite like space.

original: sthāne tiṣṭhatyasau śāstā yathā tiṣṭhanti meravaḥ
analyzed: sthāne tiṣṭhati asau śāstā yathā tiṣṭhanti meravaḥ
translated: The Teacher abides in his place, just as the Merus abide.

original: sumerorupamā syāttu gādhaṃ caiva mahodadhe /
analyzed: sumeroḥ upamā syāt tu gādham ca eva mahā udadhe
translated: The analogy of Mount Sumeru would be the depth of the great ocean,

original: tṛsāhasrācca rajaso na jñānādbuddhasaṃbhavāt
analyzed: tṛsāhasrāt ca rajasaḥ na jñānāt buddha saṃbhavāt
translated: but not from the knowledge of the arising of the Buddha in the three-thousand [world system].

original: vandito lokapradyoto bodhisattvairdaśaddiśe //
analyzed: vanditaḥ loka pradyotaḥ bodhisattvaiḥ daśat diśe
translated: The Light of the World is worshipped by the bodhisattvas in the ten directions.

original: ta āhuḥ
analyzed: te āhuḥ
translated: They said:

original: vilokaya lokanātha pūrayāsmakamāśayaṃ /
analyzed: vilokaya lokanātha pūraya asmakam āśayam
translated: Look upon the world, O Lord of the World, fulfill our aspiration.

original: cittena vandito 'smābhiḥ śāstā labdhāstataḥ phalaṃ /
analyzed: cittena smābhiḥ śāstā labdhāḥ tatas phalam
translated: We have paid homage with our minds to the Teacher, and from that we have attained the fruit.

original: bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattva āha
analyzed: bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Bhaiṣajya-senā said:

original: na gandhai rajyate śāstā na mālyairna
analyzed: na gandhaiḥ rajyate śāstā na mālyaiḥ na
translated: The Teacher is not attached to perfumes, garlands, or

original: vilepanaiḥ hetuṃ gṛhṇāti sattvānāṃ yena mucyanti saṃskṛtāt
analyzed: vilepanaiḥ hetum gṛhṇāti sattvānām yena mucyanti saṃskṛtāt
translated: He takes up the practice of anointments, by which beings are liberated from the conditioned.

original: saṃgrāmaṃ na kurute tasya māraḥ paramadāruṇaṃ /
analyzed: saṃgrāmam na kurute tasya māraḥ parama dāruṇam
translated: Mara does not wage war against him, let alone the most terrible one.

original: damito hi mano yena buddhaṃ ca śaraṇaṃ gataḥ
analyzed: damitaḥ hi manaḥ yena buddham ca śaraṇam gataḥ
translated: For one whose mind is subdued, who has gone for refuge to the Buddha,

original: mṛtyorna yāsyati vaśaṃ kṣipraṃ prāpsyati dhāraṇī
analyzed: mṛtyoḥ na yāsyati vaśam kṣipram prāpsyati dhāraṇī
translated: Death will not come under his control, he will quickly attain retention.

original: cittaprasādaṃ kṛtvāsau śāstāraṃ paśyate tataḥ
analyzed: citta prasādam kṛtvā asau śāstāram paśyate tatas
translated: Having gained faith in the mind, he then sees the Teacher.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhagavān kalaviṅkarutasvaramanojñaghoṣastathāgataḥ smitaṃ prāduṣcakāra /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān kalaviṅka ruta svara manojña ghoṣaḥ tathāgataḥ smitam prāduṣcakāra
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Tathagata with the melodious voice of a kalaviṅka bird, manifested a smile.

original: atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattva utthāyāsanād yena bhagavāṃstenāṃjaliṃ
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ utthāya āsanāt yena bhagavān tena aṃjalim
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃgha rose from his seat, bowed with folded hands

original: praṇamya bhagavantametadavocat ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya prāduṣkaraṇāya
analyzed: praṇamya bhagavantam etat avocat kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ smitasya prāduṣkaraṇāya
translated: to the Blessed One, and said this to the Blessed One: Blessed One, what is the cause, what is the condition, for manifesting a smile?

original: yadbhagavato mukhadvārāccaturaśīti raśmiśatasahasrāṇi niścaranti /
analyzed: yat bhagavataḥ mukha dvārāt caturaśīti raśmi śata sahasrāṇi niścaranti
translated: From the mouth of the Blessed One, 84,000 rays of light shine forth.

original: taiśca raśmibhiriyaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasrā lokadhāturavabhāsena sphuṭābhūt sarve ca dvātṛṃśan mahānirayā sphuṭā abhūvan dvātṛṃśatiśca devabhavanānyavabhāsitāni
analyzed: taiḥ ca raśmibhiḥ iyam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrā lokadhātuḥ avabhāsena sphuṭā abhūt sarve ca dvātṛṃśat mahānirayāḥ sphuṭāḥ abhūvan dvātṛṃśatiḥ ca deva bhavanāni avabhāsitāni
translated: And those light rays illuminated this great trichiliocosm, and all the thirty-two great hells were illuminated, and the thirty-two divine abodes were illuminated.

original: tāśca raśmayo nānāvarṇāḥ tadyathā nīlapītalohitāvadātamaṃjiṣṭhāsphaṭikarajatavaraṇāḥ
analyzed: tāḥ ca raśmayaḥ nānā varṇāḥ tat yathā nīla pīta lohita avadāta maṃjiṣṭhā sphaṭika rajata varaṇāḥ
translated: And those light rays were of various colors, namely blue, yellow, red, white, pink, crystal, silver, and golden.

original: etāśca raśmayo bhagavato mukhadvārānniścarya trisāhasramahāsāhasrāyāṃ lokadhātau
analyzed: etāḥ ca raśmayaḥ bhagavataḥ mukha dvārāt niścarya tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrāyām lokadhātau
translated: And those light rays issued forth from the Bhagavān's mouth and illuminated the great trichiliocosm,

original: sattvānāṃ sarvamukhopadhānaṃ kṛtvā punareva pratyudāvṛtya bhagavantaṃ saptakṛt pradakṣiṇākṛtya
analyzed: sattvānām sarva mukha upadhānam kṛtvā punar eva pratyudāvṛtya bhagavantam sapta kṛt pradakṣiṇākṛtya
translated: and having made an offering to all the beings in the great trichiliocosm, they returned and circled the Bhagavān seven times,

original: bhagavato mūrdhanyantaradhīyanta /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ mūrdhani antaradhīyanta
translated: and disappeared into the Bhagavān's head.

original: SaSū atha khalu bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat
analyzed: atha khalu bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃgha said to the Bhagavān:

original: pṛccheyamahaṃ bhagavantaṃ tathāgatamarhantaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ kañcideva pradeśaṃ
analyzed: pṛccheyam aham bhagavantam tathāgatam arhantam samyaksaṃbuddham kañcid eva pradeśam
translated: Bhagavān, I would ask the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, about a certain matter,

original: sacenme bhagavān avakāśaṃ kuryāt pṛṣṭaḥ praśnavyākaraṇāya / //
analyzed: saced me bhagavān avakāśam kuryāt pṛṣṭaḥ praśna vyākaraṇāya
translated: if the Bhagavān would grant me the opportunity to ask my question and answer it.

original: evamukte bhagavāṃ bhaiṣajyasenaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvametadavocat pṛccha tvaṃ bhaiṣajyasena yadyadevākāṃkṣasyahaṃ te tasya tasyaiva pṛṣṭasya
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān bhaiṣajyasenam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam etat avocat pṛccha tvam bhaiṣajyasena yat yat eva ākāṃkṣasi aham te tasya tasya eva pṛṣṭasya
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃpurṇa, “Ask, Bhaiṣajya-saṃpurṇa, whatever you wish. I will satisfy your mind with the answers to your questions.

original: praśnasya vyākaraṇena cittamāradhayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: praśnasya vyākaraṇena cittam āradhayiṣyāmi
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, Ask, Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, whatever you wish. I will gratify your mind by answering each and every question you ask.

original: SaSū evamukte bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat 🔽tṛṃśatkoṭīsahasrāṇi bhagavannavakānāṃ sattvānāṃ prādurbhūtāni te tathāgatasya sūkṣmān
analyzed: evam ukte bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat  tṛṃśat koṭī sahasrāṇi bhagavat navakānām sattvānām prādurbhūtāni te tathāgatasya sūkṣmān
translated: When this was said, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada said to the Blessed One,

original: dharmadeśanāmavagāhanti /
analyzed: dharma deśanām avagāhanti
translated: Blessed One, thirty thousand times ten million young beings have appeared who are penetrating the Tathāgata's subtle teaching of the Dharma.

original: sūkṣmaṃ bhagavan bṛddhānāṃ sattvānāṃ paribhāṣanti parivadanti paripīḍayanti /
analyzed: sūkṣmam bhagavan bṛddhānām sattvānām paribhāṣanti parivadanti paripīḍayanti
translated: Blessed One, they are slandering, reviling, and oppressing the elder beings.

original: na yūyaṃ bṛddhāḥ sattvā dharmaṃ jānītha nityaṃ yūyaṃmadharme cākuśale ca rajyatha /
analyzed: na yūyam bṛddhāḥ sattvāḥ dharmam jānītha nityam yūyam adharme ca akuśale ca rajyatha
translated: 'You elders do not know the Dharma. You are always attached to non-Dharma and unwholesome things.'

original: tad bhagavān mṛṣṭā manāpā vāgbhāṣante tatkena kāraṇena bhagavantamevaṃ vāgbhāṣante /
analyzed: tat bhagavān mṛṣṭāḥ manāpāḥ vāc bhāṣante tat kena kāraṇena bhagavantam evam vāc bhāṣante
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, they are speaking such pleasant and agreeable words. For what reason do they speak such words to the Blessed One?

original: bhagavān āha na vijānāsi bhaiṣajyasena kena kāraṇenaite sattvā evaṃ vāgbhāṣante /
analyzed: bhagavān āha na vijānāsi bhaiṣajyasena kena kāraṇena ete sattvāḥ evam vāc bhāṣante
translated: The Blessed One said, Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, you do not know for what reason these beings are speaking such words.

original: tathāgatasyaibhirmṛdukaṃ sukukāraṃ bhāṣitaṃ dharmaṃ śrutvā tenaite bhaiṣajyasena sarvadharmāṇāṃ arthamavabhotsyante sarvaguṇasamanvāgatāśca 🔽bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tathāgatasya ebhiḥ mṛdukam su kukāram bhāṣitam dharmam śrutvā tena ete bhaiṣajyasena sarva dharmāṇām artham avabhotsyante sarva guṇa samanvāgatāḥ ca  bhaviṣyanti
translated: Having heard the Dharma spoken by the Tathāgata in this soft and gentle way, Bhesajyasena, they will all understand the meaning of all dharmas and will be endowed with all good qualities.

original: sarve ca dhāraṇāmavagāhiṣyanti /
analyzed: sarve ca dhāraṇām avagāhiṣyanti
translated: They will all attain retention.

original: adyadagreṇa daśabhūmipratiṣṭhitā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: adya agreṇa daśa bhūmi pratiṣṭhitāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: From now on they will be established in the ten grounds.

original: adya mahādundubhiśabdaṃ prakariṣyanti /
analyzed: adya mahā dundubhi śabdam prakariṣyanti
translated: Today they will beat the great drum.

original: adya mahādharmaprakārasamanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: adya mahā dharma prakāra samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Today they will be endowed with the great aspects of the Dharma.

original: paśyasi tvaṃ bhaiṣajyasena imāni kūṭāgārāṇi //
analyzed: paśyasi tvam bhaiṣajyasena imāni kūṭāgārāṇi
translated: Bhesajyasena, do you see these multi-storied buildings?

original: bhaiṣajyasena āha paśyāmi bhagavan paśyāmi sugata /
analyzed: bhaiṣajyasenaḥ āha paśyāmi bhagavan paśyāmi sugata
translated: Bhesajyasena said, I see them, Blessed One, I see them, Sugata.

original: bhagavān āha adyeme bhaiṣajyasena daharāḥ sattvāḥ eṣu kūṭāgāreṣvabhiruhya dharmābhisamayamanuprāpsyanti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha adya ime bhaiṣajyasena daharāḥ sattvāḥ eṣu kūṭāgāreṣu abhiruhya dharma abhisamayam anuprāpsyanti
translated: The Blessed One said, Today, Bhesajyasena, these young beings will ascend into these multi-storied buildings and attain the realization of the Dharma.

original: adyeme sarvakuśaladharmapāripūriṃ kariṣyanti /
analyzed: adyā ime sarva kuśala dharma pāripūrim kariṣyanti
translated: Today they will perfect all good qualities.

original: adya mahādharmadundubhiṃ parāhaniṣyanti /
analyzed: adya mahā dharma dundubhim parāhaniṣyanti
translated: Today they will beat the great Dharma drum.

original: anekeṣāṃ ca devanikāyānāmadya dharmābhisamayo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: anekeṣām ca deva nikāyānām adya dharma abhisamayaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Today there will be the realization of the Dharma for many groups of gods.

original: bahūnāñca nairayikānāṃ sattvānāṃ vinipātasaṃprasthitānāṃ tathāgatajñānanirdeśaṃ śrutvā sarvasaṃsāraparāṅmukhaparājayo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bahūnām ca nairayikānām sattvānām vinipāta saṃprasthitānām tathāgata jñāna nirdeśam śrutvā sarva saṃsāra parāṅmukha parājayaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And many beings in the hells who were on the verge of falling, having heard the Thus-Gone One's teaching of knowledge, will turn their backs on all saṃsāra and be victorious.

original: SaSū tasyām ca velāyāṃ vṛddhasattvairnavānavatibhiḥ koṭīśasraiḥ sarve
analyzed: tasyām ca velāyām vṛddha sattvaiḥ navānavatibhiḥ koṭī śasraiḥ sarve
translated: And at that time, ninety-nine koṭis of great beings, all of them

original: srotaāpattiphalaṃ prāptaṃ te ca sarvadharmasamanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: srotaāpatti phalam prāptam te ca sarva dharma samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: attained the fruit of stream-entry. They will be endowed with all the dharmas.

original: sarve te bhaiṣajyasena sarvaduḥkhaparivarjitā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: sarve te bhaiṣajyasena sarva duḥkha parivarjitāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: All of them, Bhaiṣajya-sena, will be free from all suffering.

original: sarve te bhaiṣajyasena sarvatathāgatadarśanaṃ niṣpādayiṣyanti /
analyzed: sarve te bhaiṣajyasena sarva tathāgata darśanam niṣpādayiṣyanti
translated: All of them, Bhaiṣajya-sena, will accomplish seeing all the Tathāgatas.

original: sarve te bhaiṣajyasena mahādharmasamanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti /🔽avalokaya bhaiṣajyasena caturdiśaṃ
analyzed: sarve te bhaiṣajyasena mahā dharma samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti  avalokaya bhaiṣajyasena caturdiśam
translated: All of them, Bhaiṣajya-sena, will be endowed with the great Dharma.🔽Look, Bhaiṣajya-sena, in the four directions.

original: SaSū avalokayati bhaiṣajyaseno bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ samantā caturdiśaṃ sa paśyati pūrvasyān diśi paṃcāśat koṭyo gaṃgānadīvālikāsamāni
analyzed: avalokayati bhaiṣajyasenaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ samantā caturdiśam sa paśyati diśi paṃcāśat koṭyaḥ gaṃgā nadī vālikā samāni
translated: Bhaiṣajya-sena, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, looked all around in the four directions and saw in the east fifty koṭis of

original: bodhisattvānāmāgacchanti /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām āgacchanti
translated: bodhisattvas coming, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river.

original: dakṣiṇasyān diśi ṣaṣṭi koṭī gaṃgānadīvālikāsamāni bodhisattvānāmāgacchanti /🔽paścimasyāṃn diśi saptati koṭī gaṃgānadīvālikāsamāni bodhisattvānāmāgacchanti /
analyzed: diśi ṣaṣṭi koṭī gaṃgā nadī vālikā samāni bodhisattvānām āgacchanti  paścimasyām diśi saptati koṭī gaṃgā nadī vālikā samāni bodhisattvānām āgacchanti
translated: From the southern direction, sixty koṭis of Bodhisattvas equal to the sands of the Ganges came.🔽From the western direction, seventy koṭis of Bodhisattvas equal to the sands of the Ganges came.

original: uttarasyān diśyaśīti koṭyo gaṃgānadīvālikāsamāni bodhisattvānāmāgacchanti /🔽adhastāddiśi navakoṭīsahasrāṇi gaṃgānadīvālikāsamāni bodhisattvānāmāgacchanti /
analyzed: diśi aśīti koṭyaḥ gaṃgā nadī vālikā samāni bodhisattvānām āgacchanti  adhastāt diśi nava koṭī sahasrāṇi gaṃgā nadī vālikā samāni bodhisattvānām āgacchanti
translated: From the northern direction, eighty koṭis of Bodhisattvas equal to the sands of the Ganges came.🔽From the lower direction, ninety thousand koṭis of Bodhisattvas equal to the sands of the Ganges came.

original: ūrdhvāyāṃ diśi koṭīśatasahasraṃ gaṃgānadīvālikāsamāni bodhisattvānāmāgacchanti /
analyzed: ūrdhvāyām diśi koṭī śata sahasram gaṃgā nadī vālikā samāni bodhisattvānām āgacchanti
translated: From the upper direction, one hundred thousand koṭis of Bodhisattvas equal to the sands of the Ganges came.

original: te cāgatāgatā bodhisattvā mahāsattvā bhagavataḥ purataḥ pādau śiraśābhivandyaikānte taśuḥ
analyzed: te ca āgata āgatāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ bhagavataḥ puratas pādau śiraśā abhivandya ekānte taśuḥ
translated: And those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas who had come, having bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, sat to one side.

original: SaSū ekāntasthitānāṃ daśadigbhyāgatānāṃ bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānāmatha bhaiṣajyaseno
analyzed: ekānta sthitānām daśa diś bhyāgatānām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām atha bhaiṣajyasenaḥ
translated: While those Bodhisattva Mahasattvas who had come from the ten directions were sitting to one side, then the Bodhisattva Mahesvara

original: bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametadavocat kimetad bhagavan khagamantarīkṣe
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat kim etat bhagavan khagam antarīkṣe
translated: the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Bhaiṣajya-senā said this to the Blessed One: What is this, Blessed One? In the sky

original: kṛṣṇarūpaṃ lohitarūpaṃ ca paśyāmi /
analyzed: kṛṣṇa rūpam lohita rūpam ca paśyāmi
translated: I see a black form and a red form.

original: bhagavān āha kimidaṃ bhaiṣajyasena /
analyzed: bhagavān āha kim idam bhaiṣajyasena
translated: The Blessed One said, What is this, Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada?

original: na saṃjānāsi yadetadantarīkṣe kṛṣṇarūpaṃ lohitarūpaṃ ca paśyasi /
analyzed: na saṃjānāsi yat etat antarīkṣe kṛṣṇa rūpam lohita rūpam ca paśyasi
translated: Do you not understand that you see a black form and a red form in the sky?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: na jānāmi bhagavan na jānāmi sugata /
analyzed: na jānāmi bhagavat na jānāmi sugata
translated: I do not know, Blessed One, I do not know, Sugata.

original: bhagavān āha eṣa tathāgata eva jānāti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha eṣa tathāgataḥ eva jānāti
translated: The Blessed One said, Only the Tathāgata knows this.

original: māro 'yaṃ bhaiṣajyasena vicakṣuskaraṇāyehopasaṃkrāntaḥ icchasi bhaiṣajyasenaitān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān draṣṭuṃ ya ete khagāntarīkṣe vyavasthitāḥ
analyzed: māraḥ yam bhaiṣajyasena vicakṣuskaraṇāya iha upasaṃkrāntaḥ icchasi bhaiṣajyasena etān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān draṣṭum ye ete khaga antarīkṣe vyavasthitāḥ  /
translated: Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, this Māra has come here to blind us. Do you wish to see those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are stationed in the sky?

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: icchāmi bhagavannicchāmi sugata /
analyzed: icchāmi bhagavan icchāmi sugata
translated: I wish to, Blessed One, I wish to, Sugata.

original: SaSū atha bhagavāṃstān bodhisattvān darśayitvā bhaiṣajyasenaṃ bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvamāmantrayati sma /
analyzed: atha bhagavān tān bodhisattvān darśayitvā bhaiṣajyasenam bodhisattvam mahāsattvam āmantrayati sma
translated: Then the Blessed One, having shown those bodhisattvas, addressed the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada:

original: īdṛśānāṃ bhaiṣajyasena koṭīśatagaṃgānadīvālikāsamāni bodhisattvānā āgatāni /
analyzed: īdṛśānām bhaiṣajyasena koṭī śata gaṃgā nadī vālikā samāni bodhisattvānām āgatāni
translated: Bhaiṣajya-saṃpada, bodhisattvas equal in number to the sands of a hundred thousand Ganges Rivers have come.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

original: ko bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayo yadete bodhisattvā etāvanta ihāgatā /
analyzed: kaḥ bhagavan hetuḥ kaḥ pratyayaḥ yat ete bodhisattvāḥ etāvantaḥ iha āgatā
translated: What is the cause, Blessed One, what is the condition, that these bodhisattvas have come here in such great numbers?

original: bhagavān āha daharāṇāṃ sattvānāṃ pratyayena bhaiṣajyasena saṃprataṃ sarvasattvā dharmadhyānasamanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: bhagavān āha daharāṇām sattvānām pratyayena bhaiṣajyasena saṃpratam sarva sattvāḥ dharma dhyāna samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: The Blessed One said, For the sake of young beings, Bhaisajyasena, now all beings will be endowed with the meditation on the Dharma.

original: paśyasi tvaṃ bhaiṣajyasena ya ete bodhisattvā mahāsattvā nānārūpā āgatā ṛddhibalādhānena /
analyzed: paśyasi tvam bhaiṣajyasena ye ete bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ nānā rūpāḥ āgatāḥ ṛddhi bala ādhānena
translated: Do you see, Bhaisajyasena, those bodhisattva mahāsattvas who have come in various forms through the power of their spiritual accomplishments?

original: āhāvalokitāni mayā koṭīśatagaṃgānadīvālikāsamā lokadhātavastatra mayā koṭīniyutaśatasahasragaṃgānadīvālikāsamā
analyzed: āha avalokitāni mayā koṭī śata gaṃgā nadī vālikā samāḥ lokadhātavaḥ tatra mayā koṭī niyuta śata sahasra gaṃgā nadī vālikā samā
translated: He said, I have seen worlds as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, a hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas,🔽where I have seen bodhisattva mahāsattvas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, a hundred thousand koṭis of nayutas,

original: bodhisattvā mahāsattvā dṛṣṭāḥ svakasvakena ṛddhibalena tiṣṭhanti nānārūpā nānāvarṇā
analyzed: bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ dṛṣṭāḥ svaka svakena ṛddhi balena tiṣṭhanti nānā rūpāḥ nānā varṇāḥ
translated: standing in their own spiritual accomplishments, of various forms, various colors,

original: nānābalasaṃsthānāstiṣṭhanti /🔽āryadharmavihāreṣu te bodhisattvastiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: nānā bala saṃsthānāḥ tiṣṭhanti  ārya dharma vihāreṣu te bodhisattvaḥ tiṣṭhanti
translated: various strengths and appearances, standing.🔽Those bodhisattvas abide in the noble abodes of the Dharma.

original: dharmavihāreṣu te bodhisattvaparivārāstiṣṭhanti /
analyzed: dharma vihāreṣu te bodhisattva parivārāḥ tiṣṭhanti
translated: Those bodhisattvas and their retinues abide in the abodes of the Dharma.

original: SaSū idamavocadbhagavān āttamanāḥ sarvaśuro bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ bhaiṣajyaseno
analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān ātta manāḥ sarvaśuraḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhaiṣajyasenaḥ
translated: The Blessed One said this, and the bodhisattva mahāsattva Sarvaśūra, the bodhisattva mahāsattva Bhaisajyasena,

original: bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarve ca navapurāṇakā bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ sā ca sarvāvatī
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarve ca nava purāṇakāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sā ca sarvāvatī
translated: and all the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, both new and old, and the entire assembly,

original: parṣat sadevamānuṣāsuragandharvaśca loko bhagavato bhāṣitaṃ abhyanandat🔽Colophon B / // // saṃghāṭaṃ nāma mahāyānasūtraṃ mahādharmaparyāyaṃ ////
analyzed: parṣad sa deva mānuṣa asura gandharvaḥ ca lokaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandat  colophon b
translated: The assembly, together with the world of gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas, rejoiced in the Blessed One's teaching.🔽Colophon B: The great Dharma discourse called the Sanghata, a Mahayana sutra...

original: Colophon D / // // āryasaṃghāṭaṃ nāma dharmmaparyāyaṃ samāptam ////
analyzed: colophon d ārya saṃghāṭam nāma dharmmaparyāyam samāptam
translated: Colophon D: The noble Dharma discourse called the Sanghata is completed.
